loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks for her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a quality breed of cow.

loans.name: Betty O.

texts.en:
Betty is a second year student at the Methodist University College, pursuing a three year course in Marketing. The loan is to help pay for her tuition fees.
Her inspiration comes from her mother who is outspoken, confident and never gives up in life. She learnt from her mother that nothing good comes easy, thus one must work towards their own success in life and that advice has kept her working towards her goal.

She sees herself owning her own company in five to ten years to come to enable her support as many people that may require her assistance in any way possible.  Her profession would help her become more knowledgeable in her field of work and also allow her the opportunity of helping her community and family financially.
"Without this loan, I would have dropped out of school. My country is peaceful and the people hospitable”, she says.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition fees in Marketing

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is an enterprising 30 year-old smallholder farmer. He loves farming and generating his own livelihood because he never wants to depend on someone. He lives in the Kitale area, which is located in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. Felix is an ambitious man, and looks to a future when he is the leading supplier of horticulture products. He's working 12 to 14 hours a day to fulfill his dream. He has farmed for five years, and earns an honest and decent income. Felix has both vegetables and a dairy farm, and has a small business to make ends meet. Although he has been making profits, life has not been easy for Felix. However, he has managed to overcome every challenge he faces. 

Felix seeks a loan via Juhudi Kilimo to buy seeds and venture into horticulture farming. His location is favorable to other types of farming due to the good road network, climate, and market demand. Felix and his family will work very hard to take good care of their investment in horticulture, in which they put their hopes for a better life. Felix is disciplined regarding finances, and he plans to enter international markets to earn more income, and obtain a stable future for his family.
Support this young entrepreneur who wants to fight for his future and help his family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and venture into horticulture farming

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de ropa, también vende verdura y pescado, comercializa la ropa de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor y asi continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: This young woman, whose face has been pixelated because she's 25 and lives in a dangerous area, works in the sale of clothing. She also sells produce and fish. She sells clothes as a mobile vendor throughout different marketplaces close to her home, and she manages to get by with the profit she makes. This young woman lives in her own home with her husband and daughter, and she's applying for a loan to buy more clothes wholesale so that she can keep selling and earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Other people perceive the task of managing a “sari-sari” (variety) store as a simple “wait and sell” practice. It’s not that effortless. Felomina of General Santos City wakes up very early in the morning and goes to bed late at night in order to meet the demand of her customers. Sometimes a customer knocks at 4:30am to buy one egg worth PhP 6. At times, she has to stay until 12 midnight to take the orders of a group drinking beer in front of her store. Felomina needs to be patient indeed or else customers will brand her as unfriendly and they will patronize other stores.

It’s a good thing that Felomina's husband, Carlito, takes his turn in looking after the store. She can also rely on her children to watch over the store during their free hours after school. They share the task because their usual everyday needs are supported by the income from the variety store. However, it cannot fully meet the educational expenses of Felomina’s children.

Now that she’s determined to improve her business and increase her profit, Felomina longs to obtain additional capital of PhP 50,000 that she will use to buy more sacks of rice, grocery items, and beverages to enhance her inventory. She dreams of converting her sari-sari into a convenience store someday and aspires to acquire property such as a lot and a car for her family. She would like to see her children with completed college education and successful careers in the near future. She shares this aspiration with her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice, grocery items, and beverages to enhance her inventory.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
This nice lady is 37 years old and lives with her retired mother in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. Her name is Margarita and she works at the market as a salesgirl. Margarita is a farmer and has cows, calves, sheep, and chickens. She grows potatoes, greens, beans, and tomatoes.  Her farm produces milk, cheese, meat, and eggs. Margarita’s mother sells their produce either at the farm or at the city’s wholesale market. 

This small family’s living conditions will surely become better if Margarita manages to receive this Kiva loan to buy one more calf.

loans.use: to buy one more calf for her farm and feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Daliana Ester

texts.es: Daliana de 22 años es una joven muy dinámica y en su negocio de elaboración de productos de repostería, cuenta con tres años de experiencia y una clientela fidelizada.  Ella inicio este negocio por herencia familiar, puesto que sus padres son panaderos y les enseñaron este oficio a todos sus hijos; sus primeras tortas, panes, postres y galletas, fueron avalados por su familia.   Ella labora de lunes a sábado y realiza las entregas a tiendas de barrios quienes son sus principales clientes y cancelan de contado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en insumos de panadería.   Esta inversión es muy importante para incrementar la capacidad de su negocio.  Su meta a futuro es convertirse en una profesional en Administración de Empresas y abrir varias sucursales en la ciudad.
texts.en:
Daliana is 22 years old. She is a very dynamic youth and her business is making confectionery products. She has three years of experience and regular customers. She started this business out of family tradition as her parents were bakers and taught this trade to all their children. Her first cakes, pastries desserts and cookies were endorsed by her family. She works from Monday to Saturday and distributes to neighborhood stores who are her main clients and she gets paid in cash.

She is currently applying for a loan from Kiva, her first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she will invest in bakery supplies. This investment is very important in order to increase the capacity of her business. Her future goal is to become a professional in Business Administration and open a number of branches in the city.

loans.use: to buy bakery supplies.

loans.name: Akotobu Group

texts.en:
Akotobu is a community based group committed to improve the livelihood of the people in their community. Its the reason they have mobilized each other to engage in business as well as community development projects. They are into the sale of cosmetics, African wax-prints, soaps, materials, jewelry and maize.

Naomi, 37 years is a married mother with 2 children. All her children are in school. She has been supporting her husband since they got married to provide for their children and take them to school.

Naomi comes from Teshie in greater Accra region. She has been selling African wax-prints, materials and jewelry with limited capital where she earns a living to take care of her family. She has applied for a loan of GHS 1,500 to help her add more stock for items such as African wax-prints, materials and jewelry in her business. Her major challenge is limited capital to run both her family and business. She is 1st person on the extreme left in the photograph. The group need a total amount of GHS 5,800 to expand businesses.

loans.use: To buy African wax-prints, materials and jewelry  which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
It’s rainy season in the Philippines – the season when it’s dangerous for fishermen to go fishing. The price of fish increases during this season and fish vendors find it hard to afford.

Juliet, a dried fish dealer who resides in General Santos City, South Cotabato, prepares for the upcoming days. She wants to have additional capital of PhP 50,000 to enhance her buying power when fresh fish gets expensive. She will buy different varieties of fresh fish in volume, dry the fish, and sell it afterwards. This additional capital will keep her business running even during the rainy season. Its income will continually cover their everyday needs and the educational expenses of Juliet's children.

Juliet is living with Jerney who suffered a vehicular accident just recently. Since then she has shouldered all the household and business responsibilities including the supervision of three helpers in fish processing. Juliet owns a pick-up truck that is being used for dried fish delivery. Eventually she plans to upgrade it to 10-wheeler truck so she can deliver a greater volume of dried fish. Her goal is to make her business prosper, gain stability in the midst of stiff competition, have her children complete their education, and enjoy better living conditions someday. She is a zealous member of CCT where she gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their life and businesses.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of fresh fish in volume.

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
Santa es una de las pocas mujeres que se esfuerzan día con día para brindarle a su querida familia lo mejor, ella para poder generar sus ingresos cuenta con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes con el que gracias a su amabilidad ha logrado contar con varios clientes, ella agradece mucho el apoyo que se le brindo con el anterior crédito pues a Dios gracias esta inversión fue de mucho beneficio para su familia porque con ello aumento su mercaría y su ingreso; pero Santa con el afán de seguir ampliando su negocio ha decidido solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de más productos como: azúcar, huevo, gaseosas, frijol que son los productos que se venden con más frecuencia.
Santa guarda las esperanzas de poder contar con este nuevo préstamo y seguir prosperando con su negocio.
texts.en:
Santa is one of the few women who make a real effort day by day to provide the best for her beloved family, to be able to generate her income she has a small convenience store, with which thanks to her kind nature she has managed to get many customers. She is very grateful for the support that her previous loan provided, and thanks God because this investment was of great benefit to her family; with that investment she increased her stocks and her income.  But Santa, with the desire to continue growing her business, decided to request another loan which she will invest in buying more of the items that sell most quickly, such as sugar, eggs, sodas and beans.

Santa maintains the hope that she will be able to get this new loan to continue with the success of her business.

loans.use: to buy convenience store products such as sugar, eggs, sodas and beans.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
General Santos City is famous for its tuna aside from being known as the hometown of Manny Pacquiao. Fishing or catching tuna is the usual livelihood of many residents of the area. One of them is Mary who owns a fishing boat and employs eight helper-fishermen. They are led by her fisherman husband, Reynaldo.

If the weather is unfavorable for fishing, Mary has an alternative source of income which is her “sari-sari” or variety store. At present she wants to prepare for those unfavorable days and she plans to procure a larger quantity of products for her store. A PhP 10,000 loan would be enough for this need. The additional income that will be derived from this loan will ensure their daily sustenance especially during this season of rains. Later on she plans to buy a bigger fishing boat that can withstand moderate winds. This would be very helpful for her husband and his group of fishermen.

Mary dreams of seeing her kids finish their schooling and wear their professional clothes. She also gives importance to peaceful and harmonious living with her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to obtain a larger quantity of products for her store.

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es: Milagro de 34 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 17 y 15 años de edad, por los cuales se ha esforzado por sacar adelante con sus estudios. Ella se dedica a prestar sus servicios como cosmetóloga desde hace cinco años. Milagro desea obtener mayores ingresos y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: herramientas de trabajo para la cosmetología como secadora, plancha para el cabello, pinzas, tijeras y productos para el cabello, pies y manos, y de esa forma aumentar su clientela ofreciéndoles un mejor servicio y más completo.
texts.en: Milagro, who is 34 years old, lives in her own house with her partner and their two children who are 17 and 15 years old, for whom she was inspired to continue with her studies.  She has been making a living by lending her services as a cosmetologist for five years.  Milagro wants to increase her income and for this reason she is requesting a credit from FUSAI to invest in: cosmetology work tools such as a hairdryer, hair straightener, tweezers, scissors and products for the hair, feet and hands  In this way she will increase her client base by offering a better and more complete service.

loans.use: to invest in: hairdryer, hair straighteners, tweezers, scissors and products for the hair, feet and hands.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
The stiff competition in the variety store business forces many store owners to find alternative sources of income. Elizabeth, 45, from General Santos City runs a variety store that sells wide selection such as toiletries, repacked condiments, eggs, charcoal, fruits, and vegetables. But she also finds extra income from chorizo and “embotido” making. Embotido is a processed meat combined with hotdog, cheese, raisins, carrots, and other ingredients. She’s correct that this product is quite saleable in their community. A lot of customers are placing their orders but she cannot meet their demands due to lack of capital. 

If she will be able to obtain additional capital worth PhP 38,000 she can purchase more ingredients for chorizo and embotido making. With this, she can produce bigger quantity of her products and supply the orders of her customers. She will also make part of the loan to buy additional items for her store. 

She’s positive that her sales will surely increase as well as her income. It will add up with the income of her husband, Edgar, a fisherman. They can continually provide for the needs of their family and schooling of their children. Both of them want to see their children finish their college degree and have a better chance to improve their living condition someday.

She gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their lives and businesses and draw strength from the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for chorizo and embotido making

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina creates different sizes of coin purse, cellphone pouch and body bags with the use of beautifully designed ethnic cloth. She has great appreciation to indigenous people’s creativity and she strives to promote it by using their intricately woven cloths as raw materials for her products. She distributes her finished products to stores that sell native products. It’s attractive to foreign and local tourists that usually visit their area.

Marina would like to enhance her business further. She will buy volume of raw materials such as native made cloth, zippers, threads, and other accessories for her business. Additional capital amounting to PhP 12,000 would be enough to meet this need. This will not only help her generate higher income and savings for her family, but most importantly, it will endorse the use of locally made products and uphold the creativity of indigenous people. 

Marina is married to Primo who is always supportive of her and her business. Together, they work really hard to ensure that their children will finish their schooling and have a stable job in the future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy volume of materials such as local ethnic designed cloth, zippers, threads and other accessories

loans.name: Edik

texts.en:
Edik is 65 years old and he lives with his wife in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. They have three sons and all of them with their families live and work in the Russian Federation and also send financial support to their parents. 

Edik is a skilled farmer and he has not small farm; in his farm he takes care of cows, calves, pigs, sheep and chickens. He also has a big hay-field and from here the gathers hay to sell to his villagers, as a fodder for their farm cattle.  Edik also sells his farm’s milk, meat and eggs to his regular customers.

 Edik asks this loan of 150.000 Armenian drams in order to organize his hay mowing activities.

loans.use: to organize his hay mowing activities

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa se encuentra en el sexto ciclo, se formó en la ciudad de Santaní, una zona rural en crecimiento, de difícil acceso y alejada de la capital del país. El grupo está conformado por 16 integrantes todas con actividades independientes.
La Sra. Catalina, quien integra este grupo, se dedica a las ventas, tiene una despensa bien surtida, donde todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano, hasta muy tarde. Comenta que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia y les da una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa poder vender, como ser,   Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer.
texts.en:
The Kuna Guapa committee is on its sixth loan cycle. It was formed in the city of Santaní, a growing rural area with difficult access, far away from the country's capital. The group is comprised of 16 members, all with independent occupations. 

Catalina who is part of this group, makes her living in sales and has a well-stocked grocery store, where she works every day from very early to very late. She says that through her work, she helps her family and provides them with a dignified living. She is asking for a loan in order to invest it in the purchase of supplies to sell in her store, for example, She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to grow.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, baked goods, meats and others.

loans.name: Rommel

texts.en: Rommel is 42 years old, is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. Rommel is engaged in the farming business as his primary source of income. He plants and harvests rice to sell. He also pays laborers who help him in the farming business. He wants to improve his crop production, which is why he is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. He hopes to become a progressive entrepreneur through his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Nolvia Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Nolvia, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con un hijo en una aldea del municipio de Yojoa, Cortes, cerca a Taulabe. Ella se dedica a la venta de almuerzos con pescado frito, lleva 15 años de hacer esta actividad donde genera sus propios ingresos. Ha obtenido varios préstamos con ODEF, y actualmente solicita otro por 20,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar mas pescado e insumos que necesita para la venta y también necesita comprar unos juegos de mesas con sillas para el negocio y poder atender mejor a sus clientes. Su meta es tener un ahorro a futuro para su vejez.
texts.en:
Nolvia is 53 years old and a single mother. She lives with one son in a small village in the municipality of Yojoa, Cortes near to Taulabe. She earns a living by selling lunches of fried fish. She has been doing this job for 15 years and she earns her own income. 

She has taken out several loans with ODEF and is asking for another one at the moment for 20,000 HNL, with which she is going to buy more fish and supplies that she needs to sell. She also needs to buy some sets of tables and chairs for the business, and be able to serve her customers better. Her goal is to have some savings in the future for her old age.

loans.use: to buy more fish and supplies to sell food, and also to buy more tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Antoneth

texts.en:
It is as deep and wide as the ocean. Antoneth’s dream is like this. Ever since, he really wants to give his family an affordable life and he wants to save enough for his children's education, and you can be a part of this realization. With just an amount of PHP 50,000, he can already start enhancing his business: a stepping stone to streamlining his aspirations.

Antoneth started his business five years ago. He is 33 years old now and is married to Qris. They share a little space in the market where they have their stall. Early in the morning, they buy baskets of raw and fresh crabs from the port nearby and then take them to sell in the marketplace. Crabs are sold then on a per kilo basis. Routines go like this every day and this enterprise has helped a lot, not just for himself, but also for the household.

As regards to the loan, what he’ll be taking out will be used in buying supplementary supplies of crabs and part will be used to improve his stall and as additional assistance for the family’s daily living expenses.

Today, Antoneth is working hard to earn enough for his children’s education. As is usually quoted, “If there’s no pain, no gain.” Thank you in advance for your heartfelt generosity.

He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional quantity of fresh crabs from the supplier.

loans.name: Volodya

texts.en:
Volodya is retailer. He gathers fruits and vegetables from his own farm and also purchases from his villagers and sells the fruits and vegetables in nearby communities. He used to rent a car for the organizing the selling process. After tireless and hard work, Volodya was able to save money and purchase his own truck needed for his retail business.

He now asks for this loan to be able to cover final costs (customs clearance costs) for the truck and to be able to use the truck in his business.

Volodya has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Please help this nice and hardworking farmer to improve his business activity, which is the only source of income for his family. Volodya is the father of two daughters and the husband of his beloved wife. His family members help him with taking care of the farm.

loans.use: to pay for truck customs clearance costs and to be able to use the truck in his business.

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Normelita has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own direct-selling business for several years, and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business, while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To further improve sales, Normelita would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional products to sell. With PHP 8,000, she could already purchase more quantity and varieties of personal products and other items to sell. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Normelita hopes to grow her business and improve her family's living condition. She is an active community partner of C.C.T. Every week she meets with her fellowship group*, where she studies the word of God and shares her story with her fellow entrepreneurs.

*All C.C.T. community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of merchandise and other direct-selling items.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 8 años, vende sus productos con los comerciantes que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. así como muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
This young man whose face has been blurred because he is twenty six years old and lives in a high risk area, makes his living planting maize and beans. He has been working at this occupation for eight years, and sells his products with traders who are close to his place of residency.  

The young man lives in his own house along with his wife. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizers, manures, pest control products, herbicides, etc., as the picture shows, to continue with his sales and thus obtain a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manures, pest control products, herbicides, etc

loans.name: Justino

texts.es: Justino de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica desde hace 20 años a la siembra de maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en los pueblos aledaños, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y tener una buena cosecha para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Justino, aged 37, lives in his own house with his family. For 20 years he has worked sowing corn and beans. When his harvest is ready it goes to the storehouse in the barns, as shown in the picture, to then sell it in the neighbouring villages. With the sales that he makes, he manages to settle some household expenses. 

Justino is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilisers, composts, pest control and other items, and to have a good harvest to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, composts, pest control and other items.

loans.name: Abizeranye Sub Group

texts.en:
Clementine is 24 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 2 and 3 years, all of them go to school. The group is called ABIZERANYE means “TRUST” in English. The members of the group sell different products and they have common goals to scale their business for the better future. 

She owns a shop and has been running in a business for past 3 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more soaps, juice and cooking oil for sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumptions and make savings.

loans.use: To buy more soaps, juice and cooking oil for sell.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
This is Candelaria from General Santos City. She is married to Felix and they have four children. Candelaria operates a tailoring shop for fifteen years now. Her income combined with her husband’s income as self-employed worker provide well for their everyday needs. But lately one of her sewing machines broke down and hampered her production. Many of her customers are waiting for her finished products but she cannot deliver on time. 

This is why she applies for PhP 10,000 loan. She longs to buy one surplus sewing machine to replace the damaged one. At this point she cannot afford a brand new one because her family’s expenses is growing. All her four children are studying and she has to squeeze her budget to give priority to her children’s education. She aspires that all of them will finish their college degree and gain a decent living wage. Someday she hopes to purchase a lot and construct a new house for her family.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy one surplus sewing machine to replace the damaged one

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
To be able to raise her children, Rosemarie, 55, from Las Pinas City, is very passionate and hardworking in operating her current business--a sari-sari store business. With her positive view of life and good harmony with people, customers search her out for her service. In this way, she earns a living. And what income she gets from her business is just enough to support the entire household.

Aspiring to grow her business and be successful, Rosemarie wants to ask for a loan assistance from you in the amount of PHP 50,000 which she will use in buying more merchandise for her shop. This will indeed be a great help for her and for her family in their daily expenses and necessities. Your help can mean a lot now to Rosemarie. In advance, she wants to thank you for your consideration and unwavering generosity.

Rosemarie regularly meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise  for her shop.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 25-year-old married woman from Bethlehem City. She lives with her husband and her little daughter in a humble, old house. Her husband works in the public sector where his earnings barely cover his family's needs.

Martha decided to help her husband. She look a USD loan from FATEN to open a salon in her house and buy the necessary tools. Martha dreams of opening big salon in the future and improving the living conditions of her family. Martha appears in the photo.

loans.use: to open a beauty salon in her house and buy the necessary tools.

loans.name: Daylester

texts.es: Daylester, durante años laboró como impulsadora en almacenes de cadena, sin embargo decidió dedicarse a la comercialización de calzado deportivo, ropa y accesorios e iniciar su propio negocio.  Ésta decidida joven con un talento inigualable para las ventas ha logrado persuadir a sus conocidos y amigos que residen en la ciudad de Cartagena de donde es originaria, así mismo les ofrece comodidad de pago a sus clientes, para que puedan comprar estos productos que en su gran mayoría son marcas extranjeras y al cambio de nuestra moneda son onerosos, pero de excelentes diseños y calidad.  En pro de capitalizarse está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en calzado deportivo y surtir con nueva colección.  Su meta a futuro es educar a sus hijos y formalizar una familia unida y prospera.
texts.en:
Over the years, Daylester, has worked as a product demonstrator for supermarket chains. However, she decided to start her own business and earn a living through selling sports shoes, clothes and accessories.   

She is a determined young woman with a unique talent for sales. She has managed to persuade her acquaintances and friends, that live in her home town of Cartagena, to buy these products. She offers payment options for her clients in order that they will be able to buy these products as they are foreign brands and very expensive in the local currency, although they are of an excellent design and quality.  

To further develop her business she is applying for a loan from Kiva, the first loan she has applied for from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy sports shoes and stock new collections.  

Her goal for the future is to educate her children and have a united and prosperous family.

loans.use: to buy sports shoes and stock new collections.

loans.name: Ma Theresa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Theresa, and she is very thankful that Kiva became an instrument for the realization of improving her current trade in Pasay City. This help was indeed a great remedy for their family's daily expenses. It was a benefit for the household, and at the same time, a hope for a better future that lies before them.

So far, Ma. Theresa's store is running well. But, she needs a little help to continue the operations of her business. She needs PHP 26,000 that she will use to supply her own store with more grocery items to sell. Buying those stuffs, she will be able to cater to the demands of the customers well, simultaneously benefiting more from the profit increase. If that happens, she will also save for the renovation of their house.

She hopes that you can help her with this because this is a very relevant source of living for the family aside from Emilio's (her husband) job. Wages from his job are not really enough to support the family’s needs alone. That's why Ma. Theresa hopes a lot that you will lend her your helping hands.

Someday, she dreams her business will expand and of helping others who are in need. She is also steadfastly praying for the future careers of her children.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise and products to display and sell at her variety store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more bales of textiles for her business.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is a married woman with four children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 41 years old.

She has a beauty salon business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business like spray, make up, etc.

Rosanna has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her beauty salon business, like spray, make up, etc.

loans.name: Pang Ya Wende De Tanghin Group

texts.fr:
Mr SOMIKIMANDE est responsable du groupe  PANG YA WENDE DE TANGHIN. Marié il père de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15 ans et le moins âgé a 11 mois. 04 des enfants vont à l’école.
Monsieur fait l’élevage depuis 10 ans. Il s’approvisionne  dans les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter 03 chèvres et 10 poules. 
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour accroitre son activité. Il ambitionne être plus tard un grand éleveur.
texts.en:
Somikimande is the leader of the Pang Ya Wende De Tanghin group. Married, he is the father of six children, of whom the eldest is 15 years old and the youngest is 11 months old. Four of the children are in school.

Somikimande has been raising livestock for 10 years, which he procures from the surrounding villages.

With this money received, he plans to buy three goats and 10 chickens. 

Somikimande wants to use his earnings to increase his business. He hopes later to become a major livestock farmer.

loans.use: to buy three goats and 10 chickens

loans.name: Santos Jesus

texts.es: Santos de 61 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar conformado por su compañera de vida y su hijo de 18 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando actualmente y al mismo tiempo termina sus estudios en una escuela cercana a su vivienda. Santos  se dedica  a la prestación de servicio de transporte en su vehículo propio desde hace siete años y de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento diario a su hogar. Santos anteriormente solicito un crédito el cual utilizo para mejorar su vivienda y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de la vida, gracias a la buena experiencia y feliz por haber logrado su objetivo vuelve a recurrir a FUSAI para solicitar un nuevo crédito para poder invertir en la reparación de su vehículo ya que necesita hacer unos ajustes al motor para consumir menos combustible y evitar en gran parte la emisión de gases contaminantes que dañan el medio ambiente, además para Santos es de mucha importancia obtener este crédito, debido a que sus ingresos económicos dependen principalmente de la actividad que realiza con su vehículo.
texts.en: Santos, 61, lives with his wife and 18-year old son in a house that he owns.  His son is in school now but will soon complete his studies at the local school.  Santos has operated a taxi business for seven years.  He has his own vehicle and his earnings from the business support the family.  He used a previous loan to make improvements to his house and provide his family with a better quality of life.  Pleased with that experience, he is back to apply for another FUSAI loan, this time for repairing the vehicle he uses for his business.  He wants to make adjustments to the vehicle's engine so that it uses less gas and belches fewer pollutants to the air.  The loan is very important to Santos because his business depends on the vehicle and the business is his main source of income.

loans.use: for engine adjustments that will make his vehicle more gas-efficient and reduce pollutants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish and shellfish for his small fish business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals, as well as buying balanced food for them.

loans.name: Eules

texts.es:
Eules tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Santo Tomás que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Eules se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, adicionalmente cría animales menores (gallinas, cuyes,) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, platano, vituca), cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 3 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Eules espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Eules, 25, lives with his wife and children in his own rustic house in the district of Santo Tomas which is located in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountain range of Peru.  Life in this district is peaceful and the locals work mainly in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.

Eules works in agriculture, mainly growing coffee.  He also raises small animals (hens, guinea pigs) and grows yucca, banana, and vituca.  He has been in the trade for three years and has very good personal and work references in the area.

He will use the loan to buy manure and fertilizers for adequate maintenance of his coffee crop.  He also will hire workers for the harvest season.  Eules hopes to produce better coffee to offer to his customers.  This will have a positive impact on his income and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers for adequate maintenance of his coffee crop.

loans.name: Jaime Humberto

texts.es:
Jaime, mayor de edad, soltero y con 1 hijo, originario de Medellín, es un microempresario administrador y propietario de su propio negocio el cual  consiste en la compra y venta de productos de uso personal.

Se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, también con muchos deseos de superación personal, tiene clientes tanto al crédito como al contado que recupera quincenal o mensualmente.

Inicio este negocio con fondos propios debido a la necesidad de trabajar y el deseo de mejorar los ingresos en su hogar, tuvo el compromiso de salir adelante con el esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo que ha realizado durante 2 años en el cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma, uno de sus sueños es poder llegar a tener un gran negocio. 

Desde muy temprano el se levanta a iniciar su venta  y poder sacar adelante a su familia. 

Jaime es un hombre que se caracteriza por ser emprendedor, trabajador y responsable con todos sus compromisos adquiridos, ha venido poco a poco mejorando su negocio. 

El objetivo de este crédito es para poder comprar más mercadería como; cremas, tónicos, sprays, entre otros. 

Jaime se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo económico que Kiva le brinda a las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Jaime, who is elderly, single and has one son, is from Medellín.  He is a small business owner and administrator of his own business which consists of buying and selling personal hygiene products.  He is known for being a very hard-working and responsible man, who also has dreams of bettering himself.  He began this business with his own funds due to his need to work and his desire to increase his household income.  He committed himself to move forward with effort and hard work which has continued during the past 2 years in which he has demonstrated his responsibility by paying on time.  One of his dreams is to have a great business.  He wakes up very early to start his sales and to be able to help his family get ahead.

Jaime is a man who is known for being innovative, hard-working, and responsible with all of his commitments and little by little, he is improving his business.  The purpose of this loan is to be able to purchase more merchandise like: creams, tonics, and sprays, among others.  Jaime feels very grateful for the financial support that Kiva offers to people who need it.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise such as: creams, tonics, sprays, among others.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
“I love that I get to do something that combines my two passions: music and art,” stated Rodolfo.

It was this passion that led him to start his graphic design and music production company, South Psycho Cide Productions, which he established in April 2015.

When he was enrolled in a multi-media graphic design program at a local trade school, he realized that creating logos and unique designs was something that came natural to him. He was able to create different designs and then print them on t-shirts, which were very well received by his classmates.

In addition to his graphic design program, he took business courses through a junior college to prepare him to start his business. He also has more than seven years of experience in marketing and promotions, which he will use to help promote the clothing online and in retail stores.

Currently, Rodolfo is focused on growing the graphic design portion of the business, with hopes to expand and eventually start a music production side of the business. The main focus of his business will be to design logos and prints for various types of apparel, beginning with t-shirts and stickers. The clothing line is targeted at individuals aged 18 to 35 years old, who are involved in the urban culture, such as hip hop, R&B and reggae.

Rodolfo will use his talent to create the designs, and then take the shirts to have them printed by a local printer. He has established relationships with some local retailers who are waiting on product samples before deciding to stock in store or not. He will advertise the business through a new website, promotional flyers, business cards, and social media.

He will use his Kiva loan to purchase design equipment. He plans to purchase a computer for the design work, which is the leading computer in the design industry. In addition, he plans to purchase the Adobe software needed for the actual design work and editing.

loans.use: to purchase design equipment

loans.name: Cessiri Group

texts.fr: Jacque Drissa est le client qui tient en mains les cornes du bélier. Jacque Drissa est un emboucheur Malien des ovins. Il est âgé de 52 ans et n’a pas été à l’école. Il est marié et père de trois (03) enfants qui sont âgés de 11 à 03 ans. Sa femme fait le petit commerce d’arachide et du soja.  Ses rêves et ses espoirs sont de payer des ovins les engraissés et les revendre pour générer des intérêts pour faire les dépenses de la famille : santé, frais scolaires de ses enfants. Il a fait recourt au RMCR pour l’avancement durable de son embouche et fait de grandes choses pour ses enfants dans l’avenir. Il fait ses achats et ventes dans les différents marchés de sa zone. Son bénéfice mensuel est estimé à 8500F CFA.  Ce qui lui plait dans l’embouche est l’intérêt qu’il réalise et de l’anglais organique pour ses champs. Les obstacles auxquels il se heurte est souvent la mévente et la perte des animaux.
texts.en: Jacque Drissa is the client who is holding ram's horns in his hands in the photo. Jacque Drissa is a Malian sheep farmer. He is 52 and did not go to school. He is married with three children aged between 11 and three years old. His wife has a small business selling peanut and soy. His dreams and hopes are to pay for his sheep, to fatten them up, and to resell them to generate interest to pay for the family expenses: health care and his children's school fees. He turned to RMCR to help his fattening business to develop and endure and hopes to achieve great things for his children in the future. He buys his stock and sells his goods in different local markets. He evaluates his average monthly profit at 8500F CFA. What he likes about fattening sheep is the interest that he makes and the organic fertiliser that he obtains for his fields. The difficulties that he meets are slumps in the sale of his sheep and the loss of some animals.

loans.use: to buy sheep to resell them after having fed them

loans.name: Miguel Hernando

texts.es:
Miguel, en su humilde hogar, intenta ganarse la vida con la venta de flores. Con estos productos intenta salir adelante día a día.

Vive en con su hijo (Ver Foto) al cual trata de darle una buena educación.

Trabaja con una persona que le ayuda mucho en su negocio (Ver Foto)

Con esta actividad ha sobrevivido durante 2 años, y a pesar de los pocos ingresos y lo difícil de su vida, nunca deja su alegría y sonrisa.

Solicita un apoyo económico para realizar la compra de surtido flores y realizar una ampliación y adecuación a su local.

Este préstamo le dará la oportunidad de abastecerse y tener su negocio un poco mas consolidado.
texts.en:
Miguel, in his humble home, strives to earn a living by selling flowers. With these products, he tries to make ends meet day-to-day.

He lives with his son (see photo), whom he tries to provide with a good education.

Miguel works with a person, who greatly assists him in running the business (see photo).

Through his occupation, he has managed to get by for the past two years, and, in spite of his low income and his life's hardships, he never ceases to smile and be cheerful.

He is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of flowers and to expand and improve his shop.

This loan will give him the opportunity to stock up and have a more established business.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of flowers and to expand and improve his shop.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un gran hombre que trabaja con responsabilidad, esmero y mucha dedicación él tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en una de las comunidades del departamento de Sololá.
Para Miguel labrar la tierra es una gran bendición pues de donde le genera sus ingresos, el lleva 30 años de ser agricultor por lo que cuenta con mucha experiencia, Miguel con el paso de los años se ve a la necesidad de poder construir una casa más grande y mucho más cómoda para su familia, es por ello que solicita un crédito para poder comprar sus materiales de construcción como cemento, cal, arena y hierro.
El gran sueño de Miguel es conseguir el crédito para poder construir u ver su casa en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Miguel is a good man who works responsibly and with much care and dedication. He is 58 years old and lives with his wife in a community in the department of Sololá. Being able to work the land is a big blessing for Miguel because it is how he generates his income. He has a lot of experience and has worked as a farmer for 30 years. 

As the years have passed, Miguel sees the need to build a bigger house that is much more comfortable for his family. Because of this, he is asking for a loan to be able to buy construction materials such as cement, lime, sand and iron. Miguel’s big dream is to obtain a loan to be able to build or see his house in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, lime, sand and iron.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana es una mujer de 34 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 11 años, y una hija de 4 años, y su negocio es el servicio de amplificación orquestal.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, solidaria, de buena actitud, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en zona ‘16 de julio’ caracterizada por su feria los días jueves y domingos; considerada las más grande del país, donde se puede encontrar desde un alfiler hasta un tractor agrícola. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Emiliana es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y la menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con los servicios agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el servicio de amplificación orquestal; ella se dedica a brindar el servicio de amplificación amenizando fiestas de colegios, matrimonios, cumpleaños, etc., actividad que realiza durante la semana a toda hora dependiendo del evento, “inicié mi negocio con un equipo pequeño animando fiestas para colegios, actualmente atiendo eventos grandes con orquesta…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que atiende eventos grandes con orquesta, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de instrumentos musicales como teclado o piano. Su sueño es atender eventos internacionales, ella desea realizar la compra de un teclado musical para orquesta. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Emiliana solicita un préstamo para la compra de un teclado musical para el servicio de amplificación para completar los equipos de su orquesta.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a 34 year old married woman with an 11 year old son and 4 year old daughter. Her business is in the service of providing sound equipment. She is a good mother, entrepreneur, independent, caring, with a good attitude, responsible and very hardworking. 

Her business is in the "16 de julio" area, characterized by its open-air markets on Thursdays and Sundays, which are considered the largest in the country. There, one can find anything from a pin to a tractor. It is in a cold, dry climate, with a daily temperature that varies from 0-12 degrees Celsius.

Emiliana is of tan complexion with long black hair. Her mother tongue is Aymará, which her family speaks. She speaks Spanish as general knowledge, and to run her business. She shares her life with her husband, who works in the same business, and with her children. Her oldest child is a student, and the youngest is not yet old enough for school. She lives in her own home, built of brick and cement, with a corrugated metal roof and wood floor. The home has running water, electricity and plumbing.

Emiliana's business is in the sound system service. She works to provide sound systems to enliven school parties, weddings, birthdays, etc. She does this work during the week, at all times, depending on the event. "I started my business with a small piece of equipment, livening up school parties. Now, I attend grand events with a music group", she says.

The advantage to her business is that she can attend grand events with a music group. The disadvantage is a lack of capital to buy musical instruments such as a keyboard or piano. Her dream is to attend international events. She would like to purchase a musical keyboard for the orchestra. This is the first sequence of loans in the institution, in her 3 years of working in this business.

It is for these reasons that Emiliana is requesting a loan for the purchase of a musical keyboard for her sound system service, in order to complete the pieces of equipment in her music group.

loans.use: for the purchase of a musical keyboard for her sound system service, in order to complete the pieces of equipment in her music group.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase creams, shampoo, hair clips, scissors.

loans.name: Wilfredo Antonio

texts.es:
Wilfredo tiene 25 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

Wilfredo se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su vehículo (mototaxi), actividad que realiza desde hace más de 03 años, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Wilfrdo espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 25 years old and lives in the Cayalti districts in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on Peru's northern coast. Here, life in the community is quiet and the locals mainly make their living in trade and raising small animals.

Wilfredo makes a living providing transport services in his vehicle (a motorcycle taxi). He has been doing this work for more than three years, and has experience in the sector and very good personal and professional references locally.

This loan will be used to carry out repairs and maintenance on Wilfredo's vehicle, which is currently in bad condition. With this loan, Wilfredo hopes to offer his customers better service, which will earn him a higher income and, therefore, allow him to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to carry out repairs and maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y su menor hijo en el distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

Jaime se dedica a brindar servicio de chofer de transporte público, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 14 años, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado y compra de material de construcción para mejora en la infraestructura de su casa, con esto Jaime espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime, 39, lives with his partner and their younger son in the district of Oyotún which is located in the province of Chiclayo, Labayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. Life in the community is calm, the population mainly works in business and raising small livestock.

Jaime works as a public transport driver, which he has been doing for more than 14 years, he has experience in the sector and with very good personal and professional references in the area. The loan will be used to carry out repairs and maintenance on his vehicle since currently it is in a bad state, and to buy construction materials to improve the infrastructure of his house. With this Jaime hopes to offer a better service to his clients which will allow him to increase his income and as a result will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to carry out repairs and maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Demostenes Amador

texts.es:
Demostenes Amador tiene 37 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Demostenes Amador se dedica a dar servicios de jornalero agrícola, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para mantenimieto y compra de herramientas de trabajo, dicha inversión le servirá para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, Demostenes Amador tiene gran influencia en el negocio; él piensa mejorar productividad de su servicio para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona; lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Demostenes Amador is 37 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives with his family in a rural area of the district of Oyotún, province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. His community is mostly dedicated to agriculture, livestock and commerce.

Demostenes Amador offers agricultural laborer services. He has more than 10 years' experience in the business, which is located in his home. He is asking for the loan to do maintenance and buy work tools. This investment will help him offer a better service to his customers. Demostenes Amador has a lot of influence in the business. He plans on improving the productivity of his service to be able to tend to the different needs and tastes of the customers in the area. This will allow him, after a short time, to improve his income, increase his profits, and therefore improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to do maintenance and buy work tools.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto tiene 58 años de edad , conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en el caserío CHILCAL que pertenece al distrito de OYOTUN, la cual es una zona rural, Región Lambayeque, Costa norte de Perú.

Gilberto tiene su bodega la cual vende productos de primera necesidad, hace 15 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio; solicita préstamo para invertir en capital de trabajo; compra de mercadería para aumentar el stock de su negocio, tales como arroz, azucar, fideo, aceite, entre otros que son muy solicitados, esto con la finalidad de poder satifacer los gustos de sus clientes y asi poder incrementar sus ventas, y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Gilberto is 58 years old. He has a common law wife, and no children. He lives in his own house in the Chilcal village, which belongs to the district of Oyotun, a rural zone in Lambayeque, in the northern coast of Peru.  For the past 15 years, Gilberto has had a store where he sells basic need products. This business is located in his home. He is asking for a loan to invest in work capital. He wants to buy merchandise to increase his business inventory, products such as rice, sugar, pasta, oil, among other items in great demand. This way, he will be able to satisfy his clients needs and increase his sales, and consequently, improve his family's and his own quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and increase his business inventory.

loans.name: Royser Salatiel

texts.es:
Royser tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Aramango que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Bagua, región Amazonas, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Royser se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de piña, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de piña así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Royser espera ofrecer piña de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Royser is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and children in their own house made of basic materials in the district of Aramango which is located in the province of Bagua, Amazonas region, in the North Andes of Peru. Life in his district is quiet and the inhabitants work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Royser works in agriculture, specifically growing pineapple. He has experience in this field and has good personal and work references from the district. The loan that will be awarded to him will be used to buy manure and fertilizer to adequately maintain his pineapple crops as well as paying for labor for the harvest. Doing this Royser hopes to offer his clients better quality pineapples which will have a positive impact on his level of income and in the end improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to adequately maintain his pineapple crops

loans.name: Sebastian Alarico

texts.es:
Sebastián Alarico tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de jornalero agrícola, contando con herramientas propias, contando con experiencia de 25 años,con buenas referencias personales y laborales, además se dedica al cultivo de maíz. Sebastián ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de insumos agrícolas para mejoramiento de su cultivo, y de nuevas herramientas para realizar su trabajo dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas.
texts.en:
Sebastián Alarico is 58, married, and lives with his family in the Oyotún district. The population works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. Oyotun is located in the province of Chiclayo, belonging to the Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru. 

He provides agricultural services as a laborer with his own tools. He has 25 years' experience with good personal and work references, and he also grows corn. He has applied for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of agricultural supplies for the improvement of his crop, and for the purchase of new tools to carry out his work. This investment will allow him to keep his tools and equipment in better condition.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies to improve his crop, and new tools to carry out his work.

loans.name: Abdias

texts.es:
Abdias tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Aramango que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Bagua, región Amazonas, en la selva norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Abdias se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de piña, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de varios años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de piña así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Abdias espera ofrecer una piña de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Abdias is 48 years old, lives with his spouse and son in their own home built of rustic materials. He lives in the Aramango district which is located in the Bagua province, Amazon region in the northern mountains of Perú. Life in this district is quiet, the residents work mainly in agriculture, trade and cattle.

Abdias works in agriculture, specifically growing pineapples. He has various years of experience in this line of work and has very good personal and business references in the area.

The loan that he will get will be used to purchase compost and fertilizers to maintain his pineapple crops and to hire labor during the harvest season. This way, Abdias hopes to offer better quality pineapples to his customers which will have a positive impact in his revenue and, therefore, improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers to maintain his pineapple crops.

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Giovanna tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su menor hijo en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Giovanna se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 8 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Giovanna espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Giovanna, 34, lives with her youngest child in a rural area of the district of Cayaltí, located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  The residents of this area work mainly in agriculture, ranching, and commerce.

Giovanna earns a living raising and selling chickens, hens, ducks, turkeys, and other small animals.  Her business is located in her own home.  She has eight years of experience in the business and very good personal and professional references in her region.

The loan she's requesting is to buy a large quantity of hens, ducks, turkeys, chickens, and other animals.  She's also going to buy balanced feed.

Giovanna hopes this will allow her to offer her customers a better product and earn her more income and, as a result, improve her quality of life and her family's.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of animals as well as balanced feed

loans.name: Abdias

texts.es:
Abdias tiene 29 años de edad, separado tiene dos menores hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Abdias se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de piña, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 5 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de piña así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Abdias espera ofrecer piña de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
29-year old Abdias is separated from his wife. He has two young children and lives in his own simple house in Pucará District in Jaén Province, Cajamarca Region, in Peru's northern mountains. Life in this area is quiet. The local people work for the most part in agriculture, business, and animal raising.

Abdias grows pineapples, a job he's had for five years. He has very good personal and work references from local people. He plans to use the loan to buy manure and fertilizer to spread on his pineapple crop to ensure the fruit grows well. He also wishes to contract labourers to work during the harvest.

 Abdias expects to be able to provide his customers with high-quality pineapples which will have a positive impact on his income. He will be able to improve his own and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: buy manure and fertilizer to spread on his pineapple crop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more 3 cartons of additional medicines

loans.name: Cindy Yohana

texts.es: Cindy es una mujer de 23 años de edad que encontró la manera de crecer comercialmente a través de la venta de calzado, celulares y sus accesorios, closet y juegos de alcobas. Esta microempresaria desde muy joven estuvo vinculada a esta actividad porque su madre es comerciante y cuando se comprometió decidió ayudar a su cónyuge con los gastos del hogar y desde su vivienda ubicada en un sector del municipio de Soledad, aperturó su punto de venta en el que atiende de lunes a domingo en el horario de 8 a.m. a 6 p.m. Su meta a futuro es tener un local más surtido y para aportar a este logró, está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en screen para celulares, películas protectoras en vidrio templado y otros accesorios para celular, también en closet.  Lo que más le gusta a Cindy de su trabajo es la oportunidad de estar junto a su pequeña hijo de tres años a quien le ofrece mucho amor y cuidado, también bienestar fruto de su labor. Su sueño de prosperidad es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
23-year-old Cindy found a way to grow commercially through the sale of shoes, cell phones and cell phone accessories, wardrobes and bedroom sets. Since she was young, this microentrepreneur was connected to this work because her mother was a merchant. When Cindy got engaged, she decided to help her spouse with the household expenses. From her home, which is located in a sector of the municipality of Soledad, she opened her storefront where she works Monday through Sunday from 8 AM to 6 PM.

Her goal for the future is to have a store with a wider range of products. To contribute to this achievement, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in cell phone screen protectors, movies, tempered glass screen protectors and other cell phone accessories as well as in wardrobes. 

What Cindy likes most about her job is the opportunity to be with her young, 3-year-old child to whom she offers much love, care and wellbeing as a result of her work. Her dream of prosperity is to have her own home.

loans.use: to invest in cell phone screen protectors, movies, tempered glass screen protectors and other cell phone accessories as well as in wardrobes.

loans.name: Ubaldo

texts.es: Ubaldo es un artesano por tradición que ha dedicado los mejores años de su vida a la elaboración de pulseras, anillos, prendas de vestir y decoración.  Este habitante de Cartagena de Indias cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en esta actividad y es muy conocido en las Playas de esta ciudad mágica, en donde ofrece a turistas y amantes del arte sus creaciones, todos los días a partir de las 9 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Como su meta a futuro es tener un local comercial bien surtido, el considera que para lograr alcanzar sus sueños debe continuar trabajando muy comprometido y así lograr el sustento para su familia y aportar un granito de arena a su meta. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar piedras, nylon, broches y demás.  Esta inversión permitirá comprar al por mayor y ganar descuentos que le beneficiaran en su negocio y así ofrecerle un mayor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Ubaldo is an artisan by tradition who has dedicated the best years of his life to making bracelets, rings, clothing, and decorations. This inhabitant of Cartagena counts on more than 15 years of experience in this line of work. He is well known throughout the beaches of this magical city where he offer tourists and and art lovers his creations everyday from 9 am until 6 pm. 

His goal for the future is to have a well-supplied commercial location. He knows that to achieve his dreams he must continue with his commitment to hard work. His goal is to do his part to contribute towards the livelihood of his family. His is currently applying for a credikiva, his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to purchase beads, nylon, pins, and more. This investment would allow him to buy bigger quantities at discounted rates, which would benefit his business and provide greater well-being for his family.

loans.use: purchase beads, nylon, pins, and more

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo es estudiante  de la carrera de Zootecnia, Trabaja en una casa de electrodomésticos donde percibe un pequeño ingreso, que le ayuda a cubrir un poco sus estudios. Él desea culminar sus estudios para ayudar a sus padres que poseen animales en el Chaco y dedicarse a lo que le gusta profesionalmente generando mayores ingresos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is studying for a degree in animal husbandry.  He works for an appliance company where he earns a small salary, which helps a bit to cover his educational expenses.  He wants to finish his degree so that he can help his parents, who have animals in El Chaco, and devote himself to professional work that he enjoys and that pays better.

Lorenzo is requesting this loan to pay for his educational expenses so that he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Makuti A Group

texts.en:
Amina who is in her early 40s, is married with four children, three of them are at school and one is grown-up.  She has been running a mamalishe business for ten years now.  She works from 06am to 05pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Amina's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her mamalishe stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan  to restock the best selling items in her mamalishe store.  She dreams of building her own house.  

Amina will share this loan with her loan group  Makuti A which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the best selling items in her mamalishe store.

loans.name: Jhames Stephenson
