texts.es: Jhames es un socio antiguo. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el séptimo ciclo en la carrera de Ingeniería en agronegociacion. El ya esta realizando sus practicas pre-profesionales la cual le ayuda también en su economía. También comenta que el anterior préstamo le ayudo bastante a superarse como un buen estudiante.El préstamo solicito para poder pagar sus pensiones de la universidad; ya se encuentra un año de terminar sus estudios. Agradecen mucho a las personas de Kiva por creer en el y ayudarle a cumplir sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Jhames is a long-standing member. Currently he is in his seventh cycle in his degree in Agribusiness Engineering. He is now doing his pre-professional work experience which is also helping him with his finances. He also says that the previous loan helped him considerably to make improvements as a good student. 

He is asking for the loan to pay for his university fees. He is now one year from finishing his studies. He is very grateful to the people from Kiva for believing in him and helping him to achieve his objectives.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María de 38 años de edad, habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre de 77 años de edad quien por su avanzada edad se le dificulta laborar, su esposo y sus dos hijos de 8 y 13 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado adelante a su familia brindándoles siempre lo mejor. María tiene una venta de comida típica en su casa de habitación tales  como: pastelitos de verdura con carne, papa y yuca frita a la cual llega una gran cantidad de clientes los  que la recomiendan por ser una mujer muy amable y brindar un buen servicio además de que sus productos son exquisitos. María desea aumentar las ventas de su negocio  ya que es el medio por el cual genera sus ganancias con las que brinda todo lo necesario a su familia, por eso solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, carne, pollo, verduras, tomate, cebolla, etc., para mejorar las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en:
María, 38, lives in own house with her 77-year-old mother, for whom due to her advanced age it is difficult to work, her husband and their two children, ages 8 and 13. She is a very hardworking woman who with much effort has gotten her family ahead, always providing the best for them.

María runs a food stand out of her house, selling local cuisine such as vegetable dumplings with meat, potatoes and fried yucca, to which a great number of customers come, who recommend her as a very kind woman who provides good service besides which her products are exquisite. 

María wants to increase the sales from her business, as it is the means by which she generates her earnings, with which she provides for all of her family’s needs. For this reason she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: corn, meat, chicken, vegetables, tomatoes, onions, etc., to improve the sales from her business.

loans.use: invest in corn, meat, chicken, vegetables, tomatoes, onions, etc., to improve the sales from her business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Here is Josefina. She is currently taking over a mineral water business. Her husband, on the other hand, works as a welder. Previously, she had a loan and she faithfully repaid all her dues. With that help from Kiva, she ably improved her business and learned a lot as well.

Josefina wishes to have a barbecue business someday and also dreams of having a better life for her kids. The kids are the main reason why she wants to expand her inventory. Here, she really needs your help.

She envisions a developed business but apparently, she's financially incapable. So, to make a remedy, she would like to ask for a loan from you worth PHP 15,000. She would use this to purchase more supplies of mineral water to sell and if possible, buy another sidecar, which would hasten the distribution process of her containers.

She knows that you'll help her cross this. This is now your time to make an impact on a person's life.

She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of mineral water and buy another sidecar for her mineral water business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.es:
Leonora es una mujer de 39 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tienen 1 hijo de 8 años y 1 hija de 5 años, y su negocio es taller de cerrajería.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, optimista, generosa, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘San Luis II’ área caracterizada por unir varias zonas a través de redes de transporte público, desde este lugar se puede conseguir transporte a zonas alejadas de la ciudad. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados. 
Leonora es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la cerrajería, ella tiene un taller dónde se realizan puertas, marcos para ventanas, portones, rejas, etc., y todo tipo de estructura metálica. Trabajo que realiza en una habitación habilitada como taller, de lunes a sábado durante todo el día, “trabajamos toda la semana y nuestros materiales se nos agotan continuamente, y necesitamos comprar en mayor cantidad…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con una lista de clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de diferentes tipos de metales. Su sueño es construir su casa, ella desea realizar la compra de diferentes tipos de metales por mayor para contar con material constante de trabajo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Leonora solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de trabajo de cerrajería para trabajar y no perder clientes.
texts.en:
Leonora is a 39-year-old woman, she lives with her partner, they have one 8-year-old son and one 5-year-old daughter and her business is a metalworking shop. 

She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, optimistic, generous, loving, responsible and very hard-working. Her business is located in the San Luis II zone, and area characterized by joining various zones through the public transportation network. From this place, one can get transportation to distant areas of the city. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0-12 degrees centigrade. 

Leonora has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair that she wears braided, is short, has a robust physique, dresses traditionally (hat, shawl and pollera [traditional Andean skirt]), and her native language is Aymará which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does. She shares her life with her partner who works in the same business. They live in a room they own, built of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting and a wooden floor which has running water, electricity, domestic gas, and sewer services. Her business is metalworking. She has a shop where she makes doors, window latches, gates, grills, etc. and all sorts of metal structures. She does this work in a room fitted as a shop, from Monday to Saturday all year round. "We work all week long and our materials run out regularly, and we need to purchase them in larger quantity..." she says. The advantage of her business is that it has a list of regular customers, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase different types of metal. Her dream is to build a house. She wants to purchase different types of metal in bulk to have constant working material. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 5 years that she has worked in this business. 

For these reasons, Leonora asks for a loan to purchase working materials for metalworking to work and not lose customers.

loans.use: to purchase working materials for metalworking to work and not lose customers.

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es: La señora Ubaldina de estado civil casada, alcanzó a estudiar  hasta  primaria, la señora Ubaldina vive en el área rural junto a su esposo en una casa de adobe con techo de teja, cuenta con servicios básicos, la señora es una persona trabajadora y con mucho optimismo trabajan día a día junto a su esposo para obtener ingresos económicos para el propio sustento. Se dedica exclusivamente a la agricultura,  en esta actividad lleva muchos años, donde produce y comercializa su producción. Lo que obtienen lo lleva a la venta en ferias provinciales de la región y pueblos aledaños, los productos principales que siembra son papa en mayor cantidad, avena, maíz y otros en menor cantidad generalmente para consumo propio. La señora Ubaldina se ve la necesidad de solicitar el préstamo para la compra de insumos (abono orgánico gallinaza) y semilla de papa, de esta manera poder ampliar su producción, continuar con su comercialización y obtener ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ubaldina is married and studied up to primary school. She lives with her husband in a rural area, in an adobe house with a tiled roof, with basic services. Ubaldina is a hard-working person who works everyday with great optimism, together with her husband, to generate income to pay for their living expenses. 

She makes a living exclusively through agriculture and this has been her occupation for many years. She produces and then markets her product, selling in provincial markets in the region and surrounding villages. Her main products are potato, in larger quantities, and oats, maize and others is smaller quantities, generally for their own consumption.

Ubaldina needs to request a loan to buy inputs (organic poultry manure) and seed potatoes, so that she can expand production, continue to market her produce and generate income to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and seed potatoes, so that she can expand production and generate income to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda works hard to support her family. Emelda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Emelda requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc. for her business.

Emelda has been in this business for 4 years now.

Emelda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc. for her business

loans.name: Bagosphere

texts.en:
In August 2014, Bagosphere borrowed PHP450,000 from Kiva through NWTF so that they could expand their operations of training out-of-school youths to become Call Center/ BPO (Business Process Outsourcing) agents. The loan has enabled Bagosphere to double their impact and increase the number of their trainees in the past year.

This time, Bagosphere is expanding its operations to Bacolod City and will need P600,000 to finance renovations and equip 2 additional classrooms. This loan will allow Bagosphere to extend their reach to out of school youths within Bacolod City and the northern towns of Negros Occidental.  Their target is that upon completion of 2 additional classrooms in Bacolod, Bagosphere will be able to train an additional 250 students in their job acceleration program per year as well as another 250 student in their other programs.

NWTF fully endorses the expansion of Bagosphere as their track record in training quality has been exceptional. To date, at least 80% of their trainees have been hired by local BPOs right after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for expansion of operations and staff enhancement training, and employ additional working capital

loans.name: Judy Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer de 39 años de edad, casada y madre de un menor, dedicada a la elaboración y posteriormente a la venta de ropa, un medio por el cual ha logrado un gran avance como familia y empresaria.
Trabaja todos los días dependiendo la cantidad de trabajo que tenga.

En el momento no cuenta con mucho material de trabajo para la elaboración de la ropa, por esto solicita un crédito con el cual comprara insumos como telas, hilos, estampados y otros.

Se deseo es formalizar su negocio y en un futuro dejárselo a sus hijos, pues es son el motivo por el que esta mujer y su esposo luchan día a día.
texts.en:
Elena is 39 years old, married and the mother of a young child. Her occupation is making and then selling clothing, and this has allowed her to make substantial gains for her family and for her business. She works every day depending on how much work she has.

At present, she does not have a large supply of materials for making clothing, and for this reason she is asking for a loan which she will use to buy supplies such as fabric, thread, transfers, etc. Her wish is to formalize her business and leave it to her children in the future. This is the reason why this woman and her husband struggle day to day.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fabric, thread, transfers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a kit of solar lamps that will improve his living conditions and will help him have a healthier environment at home

loans.name: Hagurukukore Group

texts.en:
HAGURUKUKORE is a group led by Therese who is 61 years old. The group name means “Standup and work” in English.She is married with 7 children aged between 14 and 32 years. Four of them go to school. 

She owns a shop and has been doing this for 10 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar,salt and biscuits for sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve their standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt and biscuits for sale in her shop

loans.name: Kallon Drive Group

texts.en:
Aminata is a forty-five years old business woman and a member of Kallon Drive solidarity group and has four members of which are all women.  Aminata sells charcoal and has been in this business for the past fifteen years.  She opens her business six days in a week from 8am to 6pm. 
Aminata established her business to help support her children in school.  She pays school fees, buy learning material and provide food from the profit she gets from her business.  See Marie (in the left of the group picture).

Aminata and her group members needs a loan totaling 4,000,000 SLL of which Aminata is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL which she will use to buy 100 bags of charcoal for her business.
She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Aminata is married and has 3 children of which some are school going children.

In the feature, Aminata plan to save more money to provide for her children’s university education and to build a house for her retirement age.
Aminata will be very appreciative to anyone that can help.

loans.use: to buy 100 bags of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Sayuri

texts.es: Sayuri de 29 años. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el noveno ciclo de la carrera de Contabilidad. Ella decidió estudiar esta carrera porque le encanta los numero como sacar cuentas, control de impuestos, balances generales, repartición de ganancias y todo lo que concierna a la contabilización en una empresa. Comenta que quiere especializarse en Finanzas. Ademas de ser una joven muy aplicada en sus ratos libres le encanta tocar guitarra y aveces jugar con sus hermanitos. Para poder obtener algún ingreso trabaja esporadicamente como asistente en una pequeña empresa. Ella solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de la universidad. Se siente muy agradecida con los socios de Kiva por creer en ella y apoyarla.
texts.en:
Sayuri is 29 years old. Currently she is in her ninth cycle in her Accountancy degree. She decided to study for this degree because she loves sums, such as doing accounts, tax controls, general balance sheets, distribution of profits and everything which relates to a business's accounting. She says she wants to specialise in Finance. 

As well as being a very diligent student she loves to play the guitar in her spare time and sometimes play with her young siblings. In order to make some income she works sporadically in a small company. 

She is asking for the loan so she can pay her university fees. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders for believing in her and supporting her.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Maria Dora Alicia

texts.es: María de 52 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su hijo de 10 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años y con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos de los gastos de su hogar. María desea hacerle una mejora a su hogar pero no tiene capital suficiente para poder realizarlo por eso solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder comprar materiales para construir una galera en la entrada de su vivienda la cual necesita para protegerse de que el agua se le filtre al interior de su casa en tiempos de lluvia  y así podrá a la vez brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. con el monto comprara: lamina, polines y pines.
texts.en:
María, 52, is a single mother who lives with her 10-year-old son. For several years, she has been making and selling pupusas from her home. With the earnings she obtains, she is able to cover some of her household expenses.

María wants to make some improvements to her home but does not have sufficient resources to be able to do so. For this reason, she is requesting a FUSAI loan so she can buy materials to build a covered patio at the entrance of her house. She needs this to keep the water from leaking into the interior of her house when it rains. With this, she will be able to provide better quality of life for her family. 

With this amount, she will buy sheet metal, beams and fasteners.

loans.use: to buy sheet  metal, beams and fasteners.

loans.name: Orfilia

texts.es:
Orfilia es una mujer campesina de 55 años de edad, trabajadora y humilde, que desde niña aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 

Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee cultivos de café y plátano, cultivos que atiende todos los días y las cosechas son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Fresno, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de su familia.

Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado en la Corporación Interactuar, comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor como abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros, con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, más productiva y asi mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos.

Orfilia, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Orfilia, 55 years old, comes from a rural area. She is a hardworking, humble woman who learned from childhood all the tasks of farming thanks to her parents' guidance. This has allowed her to make progress, and nowadays she owns coffee and banana crops. 

Every day she tends to her crops, and the harvests are sold in the municipal marketplace of Fresno. This is how Orfilia adds to the income with which she provides for her family's wellbeing.

She has requested the loan from Interactuar to buy agricultural inputs in bulk, including compost, pesticides, fertilizers and more. She will use these to maintain the crops and obtain a better, more abundant harvest, and thus she will get better income from her sales.

With her enterprising spirit, her drive and tenacity, Orfilia wants to keep striving to achieve her dream of having her own plantation, where she can grow a greater variety of produce, thereby improving the profitability of her business and securing financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs in bulk, such as compost, pesticides, fertilizers and more.

loans.name: Paula Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es una mujer con 36 años de edad, que desde hace poco inicio con su propio negocio, un taller de confecciones, el cual ubico en la sala de la casa donde reside.

Quiere seguir creciendo con su negocio y desea generar empleo a las personas que más lo necesiten, solicita un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de tela, hilo y una mesa para corte.

Sus suelos son muchos pero el mayor es poder pagarles la educación a sus hijos, pues son el motor que une a esta familia.

Andrea espera de su ayuda, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Andrea is 36  years old and started her own clothing-making business a short time ago. She operates out of her home. She wants to continue to grow her business and create employment opportunities for the people who need it the most. 

She is asking for a loan which she will use to invest in buying fabric, thread, and a cutting table. She has many dreams, but the biggest one is to be able to pay for her children's education. They are the driving force that binds this family. Andrea is hoping for your help - please make a loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and a cutting table.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro es un hombre de 48 años de edad, es un mecánico del pueblo de Urrao  que lleva casi 15 años de operación.

Es un hombre casado, fruto de su matrimonio nacieron dos hijas la mayor de 13 y la menor de 7 años de edad.

Inicio su camino como independiente persiguiendo un sueño de comprar una vivienda propia y en el camino encontró un propósito mayor el cual es pagar la educación de los seres que más ama en la tierra que son sus dos hijas. 


Ahora que tiene una familia más amplia ya que la pueblo ha llegado competencia Alejandro piensa que es el momento de invertir y mejorar su servicio por ello acude a la ayuda de un préstamo que le permita comprar algunos insumos y herramienta que le hacen falta y que son de diario usar en su negocio como lo son parches vulcanizados radiales, copas para pistola. 

Este préstamo ayudara a ser competitivo y tener disponibilidad de herramienta e insumos para atender cualquier eventualidad de menor grado.
texts.en:
Alejandro, age 48, is a mechanic in the town of Urrao.  He has been engaged in this business for almost 15 years.  He is married, and they have two daughters, ages 13 and 7.

He started on his road as an independent by pursuing his dream of buying his own home.  Along the way he found a greater purpose, which is to pay for the education of those who he loves more than anything on earth, his two daughters.

Now that he has a bigger family, and now that competition has come to the town, Alejandro thinks it is the time to invest and to improve his service.  That is why he looks for the help of a loan that will allow him to buy some supplies and tools that he needs.  Things like vulcanized radial patches, sockets for an impact wrench, and speakers are used every day in his business. 

This loan will help him to be competitive and to have tools and supplies available to tend to any situation that arises.

loans.use: to buy vulcanized radial patches, sockets for an impact wrench, and speakers.

loans.name: Irma Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, es madre de dos hijos de 7 años de edad y 3 años de edad.

Mariela, tiene un puesto en el mercado de venta de pan horneado, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a está actividad, ella es una mujer emprendedora.- Ella analizo el mercado y se dio cuenta que faltaba un puesto de venta de pan, por lo que tomo la decisión de colocar un puesto, también vende pasteles, panes con pollo, etc. El recorrido que realiza es de un kilómetro vendiendo y su horario de ventas es de 8:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos, ya que ha tenido gastos y se ha quedado descapitalizada para trabajar, con este préstamo podrá continuar su negocio.

Sus sueños son, tener su casa propia y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
26-year old Mariela has a grade 9 education. Her partner works in agriculture. She has two children of seven and three years of age. 

Mariela has a stall in the market where she sells bread, a job she's had for four years. She is an enterprising woman; she analysed the market and realized that there was no stall selling bread, so she opened one. She also sells pastries, chicken sandwiches etc. Her place of work is one kilometer from her home, and she works from 8 am to 3 pm.

Mariela needs a loan to buy ingredients as she also had other expenses and is short of money. With this loan she will be able to continue her business.

Her dreams are to have a house of her own and to increase sales.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her bread and pastry business

loans.name: Emerita Arely

texts.es: Emérita de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la siembra de maíz desde hace 10 años, su esposo le ayuda asistir el cultivo, vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Emérita, age 38, lives in her own home with her husband and child. She has planted corn for ten years. Her husband helps her with the cultivation. She sells her products in the neighbouring villages and with her earnings is able to get ahead. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, manure, and pesticides, and to improve the land shown in the photo in order to continue with her work and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more rice, cassava and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Susanita

texts.en:
Susanita is 42 years old and has three children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Susanita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Susanita has been in this business for four years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Susanita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vilma, de 38 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora, está casada, tiene dos hijos que estudian en la escuela de la comundad, su esposo actualmente no vive con ellos, porque debido a problemas económicos tuvo que emigrar hacia otro lugar para buscar un mejor porvenir para su familia.

Vilma, se dedica a la agricultura junto a su hijo y también se dedica a la elaboración de pan artesanal, todo lo aprendió gracias a su madre; también vende pupusas en su casa.

El crédito lo necesita para ampliar su pequeño negocio de venta de pupusas, porque la demanda es grande y necesita más sillas, mesas y utensilios para prepararlas.

Sus planes para el futuro son, que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y que un día no muy lejano pueda estar junto a su esposo nuevamente.
texts.en:
Vilma is 38 years old. She is a very hard-working woman, and her two children study at the local school. She is married but her husband does not currently live with them because due to financial reasons he had to emigrate to another place in search of a better future for his family. 

Vilma works as a farmer together with her son, and she also makes artisanal bread, all of which she learned from her mother. She also sells pupusas (corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, meat or beans) from her house. She needs a loan so she can expand her small pupusa business because the demand is high; she needs more chairs, tables and utensils to prepare the pupusas. 

Her plans for the future are that her children finish their studies and that one day in the not-too-distant future she will be able to be with her husband again.

loans.use: to expand her small business selling pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas).

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: En una comunidad de Olanchito, Honduras donde viven Carlos y su familia, no hay acceso a energía eléctrica, él tiene 47 años y  durante muchos años  han tenido que iluminarse con velas y lámparas a base de Kerosén. Carlos se ha dedicado  a la agricultura y ganadería durante toda su vida  lo que le ayuda con lo esencial para proveer lo necesario para su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. El aspira en un futuro llegar a tener su vehículo propio y de esa  manera desarrollar mejor sus actividades. Carlos está solicitando  financiamiento para adquirir de Soluz Honduras un Kit de Lámparas Solares con el cual la calidad de vida mejorara, ya que su salud no estará expuesta a humos o gases contaminantes, producidos por las velas o el Kerosén, además tendrán acceso a tener siempre con carga su teléfono celular, asimismo podrá levantarse más temprano para ir a sus labores diarias ya que la agricultura y ganadería requiere las primeras horas del día para una mejor producción, esto último siempre se le ha  dificultado debido a la falta de iluminación, por lo cual es  necesario para Carlos adquirir estas lámparas solares.
texts.en:
Carlos, 47, and his family live in a community in Olanchito, Honduras. They have no access to electricity and for many years they have had to rely on candles and kerosene lamps as their only sources of light. All his life, Carlos has worked in agriculture and cattle raising, helping him to provide for the basic needs of his wife and four children. He hopes to one day have his own vehicle and in this way expand his business.

Carlos is requesting a loan from Soluz Honduras to buy a kit of solar lamps which will help to improve their quality of life, since they will no longer be exposed to the harmful gases and smoke from the candles and kerosene. In addition, they will always have access to a fully charged mobile phone and be able to wake up earlier to begin their daily tasks. This is important, since for better production in agriculture and cattle raising, you must be up during the early hours, which has always been difficult due to the lack of light. It is for this reason that Carlos needs to acquire this kit of solar lamps.

loans.use: to buy a kit of solar lamps for his home

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
This is Sharofat, from Shahrinav. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of four children. Sharofat is a very kind woman. Because of financial problems, her husband went to work in Russia and Sharofat brings up their children and looks after the house. She has been engaged in animal husbandry for many years. She gets tired, but for the sake of her family, she does everything. 

Currently Sharofat is not receiving financial help from her husband. Therefore, she decided to take a loan to expand her cattle raising activity. She asked for a loan to develop the business and get a few calves since this can provide a decent income even if the price of the animal feed has been increasing a bit.

loans.use: To purchase a few calves

loans.name: Augusto

texts.pt:
O cliente Augusto de 36 anos de idade, e casado, trabalhador, pai de 4 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino secundário, e três frequentam o ensino primário , vive em casa própria.

Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar, cimento, ferros, arames, barrotes, para dar continuidade da sua obra.
O cliente tem como sonho, concluir e ampliar a sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família, construir casas para seus filhos para quando eles forem maiores de idade, pretende também futuramente abrir um novo negocio para aumentar a renda familiar.
Os principais desafios são financeiros, tem estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes o credito para superar as suas dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos.
texts.en:
Augusto is 36 years old, married, has work and is the father of 4 daughters, one of which goes to secondary school and the three others to primary school. He lives in a house he owns.

With the value of this loan, he plans to buy cement, iron, wires and bricks to continue the building work on his house.

He dreams of completing and expanding his house to offer a better home for his family, and building houses for his daughters when they grow up. He also plans to in future open a new business to increase the family's income.
His main challenges are financial. He has been working hard and intends to ask for further loans to help him overcome his difficulties and reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, wires and bricks to continue the building work [on his house]

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey is very thankful to Kiva for the loan granted to him in the amount of PhP 20,000 in which he bought 10 kilos of pork, 5 kilos of chicken, vegetables, and seasonings which adds more menu to his eatery and increased his income. Up to date Joey was able to pay his loan on time and the revenue of his income was used to provide support to his children education in which one is in college and the other is in high school.

It is also his determination to increase his income to provide a better life for his family.
 
Joey's eatery now has had more customers in it and he wanted to add more menus to his eatery, to cook more soups and menus with broth, soups and sauces since its more in demand this rainy season.

Joey is now requesting a loan amounting to PhP 20,000 to buy more kilos of pork, chicken, vegetables, and other ingredients to the menu of his eatery.

The loan will enable him to increase his income more to provide for his children continues education.

loans.use: To buy more kilos of pork, chicken, vegetables, and other ingredients to the menu of his eatery

loans.name: Marvelina

texts.en:
Marvelina and her spouse are both engaged in the farming business. She is now 46 years old and still managing their ricefield. She also raise hogs as additional source of income. She wanted to improve her crops and in need for enough sustenance to do so. 

She is now asking for loan of P20,000 to invest in her rice field. She will buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides use in farming. This will help nourish her crops for better yield upon harvesting. She will save additional revenue as family's emergency funds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides use in farming

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora finds passion in growing ornamental flowers in her backyard. The weather in their area in Davao City is quite favorable for her hobby cum livelihood. It’s been her focus of attention since she was separated from her husband. Now she tries to sustain her everyday needs and extends occasional support to her grandchild. She looks forward to her future by saving some money in case of emergencies. 

As she continues to nurture her garden, she needs supplementary capital of PhP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and materials for flower arrangement. She supplies nearby flower shops and some individual buyers. Your generous assistance will surely make her business prosper, and will somehow ensure her future. 

Leonora regularly meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and materials for flower arrangements

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, pepper, magi and oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase different types of medicines/drugs for her business

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit lives in Gugarq village with his parents. He is involved in transporting different products to a neighbouring country using his own truck. 
Davit asks this loan to purchase a refrigerator for installing it to the truck and transporting vegetables and fruits to a neighbouring country. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
Davit hopes for lenders support and have a dream of enlarging his business and providing his parents with good living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a refrigerator for installing it to a truck and transporting vegetables and fruits to a neighbouring country

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Nyange Group

texts.fr:
Vénérande fait partie du groupe Nyange  et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a 48 ans et est mariée à Bruno, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 12 à 22 ans, tous  étudient. 
Elle  a sous sa charge 2 orphelins  qui étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  bière   depuis 3 ans. 

Elle est à son quatorzième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de caisses de bière  à revendre  pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Vénérande, age 48, is a member of the group Nyange and she lives in Gitega. She is married to a merchant named Bruno, and they have four children ages 12 to 22 who all go to school. In addition to her own children, she is taking care of two orphans who also go to school. 

Vénérande started selling beer 3 years ago. This is her 14th loan cycle with Turame, and she will use the funds to bolster her capital. She plans to purchase a large supply of cases of beer to sell and increase her profits.

loans.use: to bolster her capital in order to purchase a large supply of cases of beer to sell and increase her profits.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past eight years, selling household consumables. She mentioned competition in her place of operation from other competitors.
 
With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and mineral water for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and mineral water for her business.

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en:
Natasha is from Vedi town of Ararat region where she lives with her husband and four children. Natasha is a hairdresser working for already 10 years in that field. She receives her clients in her house where she has a special room designed as a beauty salon. 

Natasha now asks this loan to purchase tools, materials and a special chair for providing hairdressing service. 

Natasha has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
Natasha hopes to receive lenders' support and provide better quality service to her customers.

loans.use: to pay for tools, materials and a special chair for providing hairdressing service

loans.name: Je Ka Baara Group

texts.fr: Sitan est une malienne âgée de 58 ans. Elle a quittée  l’école en 3eme année au primaire.C’est la femme qui tient la corde du bélier sur la photo. . Mariée, elle est mère de 6 enfants dont une fille. Ménagère, son mari est un cultivateur. Sitan dit: "Mon rêve est d’acheter une paire de bœufs et une charrue pour ses deux enfants, afin de garantir leur avenir dans l’agriculture et avec comme espoir le prêt que je prends au R M C R m'aidera." Elle prend le prêt au RMCR pour acheter des moutons pour l’élevage. Son premier prêt au RMCR fut 25000 FCFA.  Elle paye les moutons  au marché environnant et vend au même marché après l’engraissement. Le bénéfice récolté sur la vente des moutons la permet de prendre en charge : la santé, la nourriture et l’habillement de ses enfants. Elle déclare n’avoir pas eu de problème avec le prêt du RMCR et  s’encourager dans son activité d’élevage et faciliter l’agriculture afin de satisfaire suffisamment sa vie et celle des membres de ma famille.
texts.en:
Sitan is a woman from Mali, aged 58. She left school in the third level of primary. She is the woman who is holding the rope of the ram in the photo. She is married and the mother of six children, one of them a daughter. Sitan is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. Sitan says "My dream is to buy a pair of oxen and a plow for two of my children so as to guarantee their future in agriculture, and hopefully the loan I am taking from RMCR will help me." 

Sitan is taking the loan from RMCR to buy sheep to raise. Her first from RMCR was 25,000 FCFA. She will buy the sheep in a nearby market and resell them at the same market after fattening. The profit she earns on the sale of the sheep will allow her to cover health expenses, food, and clothing for her children. She declares that she has not had a problem with the loan from RMCR and wants to foster her activities in livestock-raising and improve agricultural activities so as to have enough for her life and that of her family members.

loans.use: acheter des moutons pour elever puis vendre

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Sinaly est l’homme qui tient la corne du mouton dont sa main est levée. Il est marié âgé de 39 ans, père de 6 enfants dont 2 enfants fréquentent l’école ; Ses enfants sont  âgés de 1à16 ans. Il est éleveur de moutons, analphabète.  Il prétend avoir d’autres prêts dans le souci  d’acheter beaucoup de moutons pour son élevage. Il a une bonne réputation dans le village. Il achète et vend ses moutons dans le marché local.
texts.en: Sinaly, with a hand raised, is the man holding the sheep’s horn in the photo. He is 39 years old and the father of six children, of whom two are in school. His children are aged 1 to 16 years old. An illiterate man, Sinali is a livestock farmer of sheep. Concerned about purchasing many sheep for his livestock business, he claims to have other loans. He has a good reputation in the village. He buys and sells his sheep at the local market.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to sell later

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
In this present generation, computers are obviously a relevant part of our lives. Figuratively, computers are like the oxygen everyone needs - from an individual to the biggest institutions within the society. This is why Edna, 39 years old, a resident of Las Pinas City, has chosen to make computers the center of her current business. She is married to Joel, and a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

So how is she running her business, then? In the Philippines, you will notice that most of the population cannot afford to buy their own computer units. To address this, entrepreneurs like Edna offer PC rentals with automatic access to the internet, basically per hour at a given cost. Usually, the price ranges from Php 10.00 to Php 15.00 per hour, which is a hook to the people for its very inexpensive price.

However, what income Edna gets from her current business is not quite enough to provide for all their needs. Now, she is planning to expand her business for a profit increase. With this, she is humbly requesting a Php 10,000 loan, which she will utilize to purchase additional computer units and other materials needed for the renovation of her shop.

In advance, she would like to say her thanks and deepest appreciation to those who will help her in this vision. Edna hopes to have a sustainable livelihood in the near future. At the same time, she prays that her children will have a secured future through finishing their schooling. She is also looking after the unity and joy within their family. She regularly meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional computer units and other materials needed for the renovation of her shop.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Here is Glenda from Davao City. She is a 38-year-old college graduate who nurtures her family. She is married to a civil engineer and they have children. Her independent woman nature drives her to venture into direct selling and ice cream making. It gives her a sense of productivity and fulfillment.

Direct selling business is common in the Philippines especially for housewives who want to be productive. Working people who want to earn extra money usually engage in this business also. It’s easy to venture into direct selling business since it typically requires low capital to begin with. Then the entrepreneur or direct selling representative will just enhance the business by expanding her network and target consumers and proper rolling of capital.

Now that it’s the rainy season, a lean season for ice cream making, Glenda aspires to enhance her direct selling business. She applies for PhP 20,000 loan that she will use to buy more clothes, shoes, cosmetics, pillows and other Avon and Dakki collections. She will sell it to her friends, neighbors and other networks. She’s positive that this additional capital will give her more profit to supplement her husband’s income. Most importantly, she aspires to pay monthly contributions to SSS (Social Security System) and PHILHEALTH. These are government mandated benefits/insurances for employed workers but Glenda wants to avail of these even as a self-employed worker. Somehow it will ensure her pension at the age of sixty.

Glenda dreams to have a stable space or a showroom for her business someday. She also desires for a good future for her children and harmonious relationship among her family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, shoes, cosmetics, pillows and other Avon and Dakki collections

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.en: Florence is a group leader. She is 31 years old, married and has three children, ages 2 to 9 years. Two of her children go to school. The group is called Tuzamurane, which means “support each other” in English. They sell different products and wish to expand their businesses for a better future. Florence sells foodstuffs and has been running a business for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, maize, cassava, and bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more rice, maize, cassava, and bananas to sell.

loans.name: San Fernando Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Fernando es un grupo nuevo, el cual esta dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una de ellas, luchando por mejorar, una de las integrantes es la Sra. Justina, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir esta en un nivel medio de vida.
Ella tiene una carpintería donde siempre ofrece un excelente servicio a sus clientes que quedan conformes con el buen trabajo que siempre hace. Tiene muy buena clientela y quiere poder seguir mejorando, es por ello que se esfuerza cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar maderas variadas, para poder seguir haciendo la fabricación de todo tipo de productos como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The San Fernando group is a new group within the elimination of poverty program.  Each member is striving to better her circumstances.  One of the members is Justine.  Her latest survey indicated she was at a stage 2 poverty level, which is the middle (or poor) level on the scale.

She has a carpentry shop where she offers excellent service to her customers, who are satisfied with the good work she always offers.  She has a very good clientele and would like to keep improving.  For that reason she works hard every day.  She seeks this loan in order to buy various woods, in order to continue constructing all types of products as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Binba Group

texts.fr: Abibata est une jeune femme mariée, âgée de 35 ans et mère de 05 enfants dont 03 sont scolarisés. Elle exerce son activité il y a de cela 20 ans. Son commerce est situé a un carrefour et bien exposé.Ce qui attire les clients. Elle à déjà bénéficié plusieurs fois d'un prêts ACFIME qu'elle à bien payé. Elle veut le crédit pour s'approvisionner en fruits et légume et en pagnes.
texts.en:
Abibata is 35 years old, married and mother to five children.  Three of her children currently attend school.  She has been running her business for twenty years at a busy crossroads.  This helps her to attract many customers.

Abibata has already had several loans from the field partner, ACFIME, which she has always repaid correctly.

She plans to use this loan to buy fruit, vegetables and pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing), fruit and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Peace-Shalon Group

texts.en:
This group is based in the community called Teshie in the greater Accra region and are beginning its 1st loan cycle with ID-Ghana, Teshie branch. The group consists of seven members and its representative, Bernice. The members are involved in different businesses including smoked fish, grocery, head gear, charcoal, second hand clothing, vegetable and cooking oil.

The loan they are seeking will benefit small business owners including Bernice. She joined ID-Ghana by invitation through her friend, who is member of this group. Her current business is selling smoked fish which she learned about on her own several years ago.

The loan is for her to increase her work capital to buy wholesale fish from fishermen in the city of Accra. She will sell her customers in the city. Through her work she is able to generate an income to support her family economically. She lives with her husband and one child.

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana she says it is the training provided by the institution.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish and sell to customers

loans.name: Kisaigi Tugumisirize Group

texts.en:
Annet, from Kisaigi runs a drug shop, is a single mother and aged 30, who has applied for a loan of ugx1,000,000. She was into farming from 2010 but it was too seasonal due to the prolonged drought and other challenges.

She approached Ugafode through a group of 6 members to access such a loan in order to restock the drug shop business, now that the demand has increased and also wants to improve her living standards. She dreams of a family and more children because she currently has one, aged 1.
Annet faces problems like competition and would like funders to continue supporting small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To boost her drug shop by buying more stock of drugs

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is from Stepanavan where he lives with his mother. He is involved in installation of heating systems in the housing and providing different construction works. Ashot, as the only breadwinner in the family, has to work also as a taxi driver to meet his family's basic needs. 

He has now applied for this loan to purchase  tools and materials for construction works. This loan will greatly help Ashot to improve his work and provide better service to his customers. 

Ashot has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for construction works

loans.name: Ruaka Witethie Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Anne, 56 years old, married and blessed with 3 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the trainings especially enterprise development. 

She is involved in poultry, dairy and pig farming. She also does bead work to supplement her income. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more poultry hence meet customer’s demands which will help her earn more income to pay for family's daily expenses e.g. food.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more poultry hence meet customers demand and earn more income to pay for family's daily expenses e.g food

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a sari-sari store owner from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is 57 years old, married, and has five children. The oldest child is 35 years old and the youngest child is 20 years old. Since her children are old enough, Leila is focusing on her business for the future.

Aside from the sari-sari store, Leila is also running a hog-raising business. She is asking for a loan to buy feed and to buy assorted goods such as coffee, sugar, powdered juice, powdered milk, candles, candies, chips, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, spices, soft drinks and milled rice. Leila is aiming to expand her business and to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, and coffee, sugar, powdered juice, powdered milk, candles, candies, chips, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, spices, soft drinks, and milled rice for resale.

loans.name: 95 United Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Margaret, 24 years old, married and blessed with 3 children whereby 2 are currently in primary school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the trainings especially enterprise development.  

She does vegetable farming e.g.cabbages, kale and potatoes. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer and manure to boost vegetable farming production hence increased income. This will enable her pay for her children's education. 
 
Margaret is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.  She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and manure to boost vegetables production for increased income to pay for children education.

loans.name: Ramzi

texts.en:
Ramzi is a 30-year-old married man from Dier Al-Balah, the besieged Gaza Strip, where unemployment is very high. Ramzi lives with his wife and daughter in a small humble house.

He has been transporting goods using his rickshaw. Ramzi has a small business buying the products wholesale and reselling them for a small profit margin. Ramzi has taken out a USD loan from FATEN, which will help him to buy more products to resell. As part of this business, he must buy items in bulk (large quantities) and deliver them to his customers using his personal vehicle.

He has a dream that he owns a car in the future. Ramzi’s loan will enable him to buy more inventory and goods to resell, and eventually increase the size of his business and his income. Ramzi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell.

loans.name: Jema

texts.en:
Jema, aged 22-years-old, lives in Gairo district. Jema managed to complete her first loan which helped her to increase products in her grocery store. Jema also volunteers as a Camfed Learner guide; she teaches life skills and problem solving skills to her nearby secondary students to improve their performance.

She has requested a second Kiva loan to increase commodities in her grocery store. The profit will help Jema to buy household expenses for her family such as food, clothing, and health necessities.

loans.use: to increase commodities in her grocery store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 51 years old, married, and blessed with five children; two of her children are currently attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 so as to benefit from the trainings, especially enterprise development.

She is involved in poultry farming and operates a grocery store where she sells assorted fruits and vegetables. She has borrowed a Kiva loan to buy poultry feed, hence boost poultry production for increased income.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed, hence boost poultry production to increase her income and pay for her family's basic needs.

loans.name: Famille Shebe Group

texts.fr: C'est depuis 1988 que Shebe et Espérance, son épouse, se sont lancés dans les travaux champêtres assistés par les membres de leur famille. Ce qui les plaît dans la riziculture est le fait qu'elle est pratiquée par tout le village. Le non respect de l'entretien est, selon eux, l'obstacle majeur à cette activité. Ils souhaiteraient que dans l'avenir les cultivateurs relèvent les défis de l'ignorance de l'agriculture à travers les institutions de microfinance de la place et l'accroissement de la production en variant d'abord les semences. Pour sa famille, ils espèrent que cette activité pourra améliorer de plus en plus leurs conditions de vie et scolariser leurs enfants. Ils posent ensemble sur la photo .
texts.en:
SInce 1998, Shebe and his wife Espérance work as farmers, with the help of their relatives.  They grow rice because this  is what everyone in their village does.They say that a major challenge is cultivating the land properly. Their wish is for farmers to have recourse to the help of local microfinance institutions in order to learn more about the principles of agriculture, which will help  increase crop yield, for example, by varying seeds used. 

Shebe and Espérance hope to improve their family's quality of life and be able to send their children to school. Shebe and Espérance are shown together in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for weeding,  fertilizers, phytosanitary products, security and labor costs for harvesting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of charcoal to sell to clients.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 44 years old, married, and supports a family of four children. Her has been practicing the business of farm supplies for the last five years earning KES 5,000 per month.

Gerald has applied for KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply an increase in income.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and to supply more income.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN, la socia Julissa continua  con el negocio de restaurante, la socia continua elaborando almuerzos para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, menestras, carnes entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican al transporte, maestro constructor, venta de comidas, tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Julissa belongs to the communal bank "Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastian". She continues with the restaurant business, preparing lunch for her customers who request it. She is a responsible and earnest person who wants to continue working and continue to help her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, beans, meat, and other items. She is grateful for the credit granted and agrees to comply with the established re-payment plan.

The other members make a living in transportation, construction, selling of food, and a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, meat, and other items.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Benard. He is a hardworking mixed farmer based in Siongiroi, which is a small rural town in Kenya. He has been practicing farming for 5 years. His primary income sources are milk, maize and vegetation produced on his farm.  

Benard is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. His hobby is milking early in the morning and late in the evening. He chops fodder in between during the day and fills water in troughs for the cows to drink. He regularly inspects his animals to ensure they are healthy and the milk quality is great. 

Benard finds farming enjoyable, lucrative and full of growth opportunities. His biggest challenge is the poor roads leading to the market. This makes it expensive and time-consuming to ferry farm produce. With your loan, Benard seeks to improve his family's living standard. He fully understands the loan obligations and is committed to paying his debts fully.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is Mary who is married with children. She operates a small open air stall in Nairobi. She wakes up very early to buy goods from the large wholesale market where farmers from Nairobi environs come to sell their goods. She buys her produce and divides it into small portion though 500 gms and 1 Kilograms plastic containers and sell to residence around her stall. The income from her business she uses to educate her children and take care of her household. 

She desires to increase her fruit and vegetables in order to sell more varieties to her customers and with a Kiva Loan she will buy more.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Suzana

texts.es:
Suzana es una mujer de 30 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 4 años, y su negocio es la artesanía en colitas para matrimonios y prestes.
Ella es buena madre, generosa, optimista, solidaria, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Illimani’ área central caracterizada por conectar a varias zonas mediante desvíos, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Suzana es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa suelto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su madre que trabaja, viven en una casa propiedad de su madre, construida de adobe con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. La necesidad por iniciar a su hijo en la escuela la llevó a solicitar un préstamo. Su actividad es la artesanía en colitas para matrimonios y prestes; las colitas son recuerdos en forma de; copa, anillos, bebe, etc. según el tipo de acontecimiento, que los dueños o padrinos de la fiesta regalan a sus invitados enganchándolos en la solapa de su abrigo, “inicié mi negocio después de trabajar en una tienda de cotillones, donde adquirí experiencia…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con diferentes tiendas que compran su producto, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de material de trabajo, como; cerámica fría, tela, cintas, cartón, cartulina, y otros. Su sueño es darle una casa propia a su hijo, ella desea realizar la compra de material de trabajo para la creación de recuerdos artesanales para fiestas. Este es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Suzana solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de trabajo para la creación de recuerdos artesanales para fiestas populares.
texts.en:
Suzana is a 30 year old woman. She is single and has a 4 year old son. Her business is hand made crafts in the form of "tails" for weddings and "prestes".  

She is a good mother, generous, optimist, supportive, responsible and very hardworking. She runs her business in ‘Illimani’, a central area characterized by connecting to different areas through detours. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies between 0-12 degrees centigrade during the day.

Suzana has dark skin, brown eyes, long, black hair that she wears loose, short stature, and a thin build. Her mother tongue is Aymará, which she speaks in the area and she speaks Spanish in the general culture and for business. She shares her life with her mother, who works. They live in a house her mother owns, made from adobe with a wood floor and a metal sheeting roof. It has potable water, electric energy, gas and plumbing. The need to start her son in school led to her asking for a loan. Her activity is artisanal crafts from ribbons for wedding and "prestes". The ribbons are in the shape of cups, rings, babies, etc., according to the occasion. The hosts or the godparents of the party give them to the guests, hooking them onto the lapels of their coats. “I started my business after working in a store for cotillions, where I acquired experience," she remarks. The advantage of her business is that she has different stores that buy her product The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy work materials, such as cold ceramics, fabric, cardboard, box board and more. Her dream is to give her son a house of his own She wants to buy work materials to create artisanal souvenirs for parties. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 4 years that she has been doing this activity.  

It is for these reasons that Suzana is asking for a loan to buy work materials to create artisanal souvenirs for popular parties.

loans.use: to buy work materials to make artisanal souvenirs for popular festivals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in snacks, packages of minutes and catalog orders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bedding, towels and plastic items.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y su negocio es la confección de tejidos de lana. 
Ella es emprendedora, sincera, generosa, comprensiva, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en las ferias cercanas al área central, situada al este de la ciudad, reúne a gran parte de los edificios administrativos, comerciales y sedes de organizaciones sociales. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Julia es de piel morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de tejidos de lana; su trabajo consiste en comprar diferentes variedades y colores de lana, la cual se dispone a tejerla en una máquina de tejer. La labor es netamente artesanal, “inicie mi negocio trabajando como costurarera en los talleres de buenos aires, gané experiencia y retorné a abrir mi taller de tejidos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que viaja a otras ciudades a vender toda su mercadería, la desventaja es la falta de una máquina de tejer industrial y lana para tejer. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de tejidos, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina de tejer industrial y lana por mayor para confeccionar tejidos y venderlos por mayor en otra ciudad. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que lleva realizando esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Julia solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de tejer industrial y lana por mayor para confeccionar tejidos y venderlos por mayor en otra ciudad.
texts.en:
Julia, 24, lives with her partner and has no children.  She has a business making woven woolen products.

Julia is enterprising, sincere, generous, understanding, patient, responsible, and very hardworking.  She sells her products from place to place in the markets in an area located east of the city, where there are a lot of administrative offices, shops, and headquarters of social organizations. This area has a cold and dry climate, with a daytime temperature that varies between  0 and 12 degrees Celsius.

Julia has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair tied back, a short stature, and slim physique.  Her native language is Aymara, which she speaks in her area.  She also speaks Spanish in the general culture and in her business.  She shares her life with her partner who also works.  They live in a home that her family owns that is built of brick and cement with a tin roof and wooden floor.  The home has drinking water, electricity, and sewer services.  She has a business making woven woolen products.  Her work involves purchasing a variety of colors and types of wool, which she weaves using a loom.  Her work is purely artisanal, " I started my business working as a dressmaker in some workshops in Buenos Aires.  I gained experience, and then I returned to open my own weaving workshop," she comments.  

The advantage of Julia's business is that she travels to other cities to sell her merchandise.  The disadvantage is that she lacks an industrial loom and wool to weave.  Julia's dream is to open a store to sell woven items.  She wants to buy an industrial loom and wool at wholesale to make woven items and sell them at wholesale in another city.  This is the first time she has taken an loan with the institution in the 3 years that she has been doing this work independently.

This is why Julia is requesting a loan to buy an industrial loom and wool at wholesale to make woven items and sell them at wholesale in another city.

loans.use: to buy an industrial loom and wool at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a pupusa press and propane gas, corn, cracklings, beans, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Mathrita

texts.en:
Mathrita is a 34-year-old, married woman supporting a family of four children. She has been practicing sewing for the last six years, which enables her to earn approximately 14,000 KES per month.

Mathrita has applied for her first loan in the amount of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for additional income. She plans to use the anticipated profits from the loan to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to generate additional income by purchasing a dairy cow for milk production and supply

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a hardworking female entrepreneur with eleven children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as soap, milk, canned goods, and eggs. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like rice farming.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Violeta dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional items to sell (e.g., soap, milk, canned goods, and eggs)

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is a 23-year-old single mother with two dependents. She relies on the agricultural sector to support her dependents.

Theresia is requesting a Kiva loan to launch a charcoal business. Apart from farm agriculture work, Theresia volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, where she leads life skills' sessions for students in secondary school in the nearby Kilombero district.

She plans to use the profits she expects to accumulate from the Kiva loan to build a house and to buy basic needs for her and her dependents. Her dream is to be a charcoal wholeseller.

loans.use: to launch a charcoal business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in cement, brick, sand, rebar and gravel to be able to build a room that she will use as a kitchen.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 57-year-old married woman who supports four children.

She has been selling fruits and vegetables to clients for the last 37 years. She explains that her business allows her to earn approximately 5,000 KES per month.

She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya in the amount of 25,000 KES to purchase more stocks of fruits and vegetables, such as onions and tomatoes, for sale to clients and to thereby meet both her clients' and family's needs. She plans to use the profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan to repay the loan and to purchase a dairy cow for milk production, which will provide her with a daily milk supply and which should help finance her children's education. Her hope is to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fruits and vegetables (e.g., onions and tomatoes) for sale to clients

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 39-year-old married woman who supports one child.

She has been a shopkeeper for the last 10 years. She explains that her business allows her to earn approximately 4,000 KES per month.

She has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya, in the amount of 25,000 KES, to purchase more stocks of products, such as soap, maize flour, salt and cooking fat, for sale to her clients. With the loan proceeds, she believes she can meet both her clients' and family's needs. She plans to use the profits she expects to generate from the loan to repay the loan and to purchase a dairy cow for milk production. In turn, she should be able to have a daily milk supply for her clients and to educate her child. Her hope is to expand her business and to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory (e.g., soap, maize flour, salt and cooking fat) for sale to clients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to get a better a harvest for family use and to sell the surplus in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more computers and photocopying papers so as to offer better and faster computer services to clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in brick, concrete, iron, gravel, and labor for the construction of a bedroom.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 54 años de edad, es una persona muy luchadora, desde pequeña se ha dedicado a trabajar haciendo petates y ayudando a sus padres en trabajos agrícolas, su madre también se dedicaba a coser en máquina y ella también aprendió ese trabajo.

Rosa, actualmente se dedica a tejer, hace camisas, blusas, pantalones, faldas, ropa para todas las edades.- Para comprar los materiales camina una hora hasta el lugar donde aborda el bus que la lleva a un pueblo, después de eso camina una hora para llegar a su casa.- Rosa, tiene contrato de hacer los uniformes de la escuela de su comunidad, pero el pago de ese trabajo se lo hacen tardado, en ocasiones se han llegado a tardar hasta seis meses para pagarle y por el momento no tiene dinero para comprar los materiales.

Rosa, solicita el crédito para comprar tela, hilo, botones, zipper y para pagarles a otras personas para que le ayuden a hacer todos los uniformes, porque solo ella no los terminaría a tiempo.

Ella sueña con ver a su hija graduada de una carrera universitaria, pero también sueña con tener una pequeña empresa de corte y confección.
texts.en:
Rosa, 54 years old, is a hard working person. From a young age, she has worked making sleeping mats and helping her parents with farming jobs. Also, her mother worked sewing by machine and she learned this job as well.

Rosa currently sews for work. She makes shirts, blouses, pants, skirts and clothes for all ages. To buy the materials, she walks for an hour to the place where she boards the bus which brings her to a village. Afterwards, she walks an hour to get home.

Rosa has a contract to make uniforms for a school in her community but they make late payments for that job. On occasion, they have been up to six months late in paying her. She does not currently have money to buy the materials. 

Rosa is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and to pay other people to help her make all of the uniforms because she alone would not finish them in time. 

She dreams of seeing her daughter graduate from university but also dreams of having a small business making clothes.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons and zippers and to pay other people to help her make all of the uniforms.

loans.name: San Francisco De Asis De Huasac Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN FRANCISCO DE ASIS DE HUASAC, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Caicay, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Magdalena tiene 54 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia leva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a  su negocio, a la vez la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican al transporte, maestro constructor, venta de comidas, tienda de abarrotes.
