Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde  a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en: Magdalena belongs to the San Francisco de Asis de Huasac communal bank. The bank is located in the Calcay district, in the province of Paucartambo and department of Cusco. She is 54 years old, has three children and is married. This member alternates her daily activities, dedicating herself to agriculture and to the raising of small domestic animals. She has been in this business for some time and has done well thanks to the effort she puts in every day. She wants to be able to continue in this way to keep helping her family. Magdalena is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to complying with the established schedule of payments. The other members of the group are drivers, a master carpenter, or they are in the business of food sales or grocery stores. The two members in the thumbnail photo asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
This is Sharon, who rents a grocery shop in Embakasi of fruits and vegetables. She is married with children. She goes to the local market where she chooses different vegetables and fruits in bulk and comes back and breaks it down to smaller quantities to retail them out. 

She enjoys what she does, as it enables her to take care of her family. She started with one small shed and now her business has grown to two stalls. She desires to expand her business to serve more variety. With a Kiva loan she shall be able to increase her groceries in her stall and create employment by employing someone to assist her.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up her business with grocery store products, cold cuts, dairy, meat, grains and to purchase undergarments to sell.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés es una experimentada mujer de 61 años de edad, una persona que a lo largo de su vida ha batallado por salir adelante. No tiene hijos ni pareja, con lo único que cuenta es con su tienda de productos de la canasta familiar, la cual inició en el año 1995 como medida para contrarrestar la difícil situación económica que atravesaba en aquel momento. Ahora aspira a que su negocio se convierta en un mini-mercado, que genere el sustento para vivir cómodamente lo que le reste de vida. 

Inés quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de víveres, abarrotes, verduras y refrescos, insumos que marcarán el progreso y aumento de mercancía en su negocio, permitiéndose llegar a un nivel más avanzado con el cual será más competitiva, con el  objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos para cumplir su sueño de vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Inés is an experienced 61 year old woman. A person who has battled to get ahead throughout her life. She has neither children nor a partner. All she has is a store of basic necessities which she started in the year 1995 as a way of counteracting the difficult financial situation she was going through at that time. Now she aims to convert her business into a mini marketplace which generates a comfortable livelihood for the remainder of her life.

Inés wants to request a loan to buy a supply of snack foods, groceries, vegetables and beverages. These supplies will indicate the advancement and increase of merchandise in her business. This will allow her to get to a more advanced level where she will be more competitive with the goal of improving her income to fulfill her dream to live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy a supply of snack foods, groceries, vegetables and beverages.

loans.name: Junta De Saneamiento Colonia 21 De Julio Group

texts.es: La junta de Saneamiento Colonia 21 de Julio fue creada en el año 1994 y desde la fecha hasta hoy en día provee del líquido imprescindible a los vecinos de la zona de la compañía. Actualmente la junta de saneamiento cuenta con seis pozos y 4 tanques propios, facilita la distribución de agua potable a todos los usuarios de 6 barrios que cuenta la compañía, lo que permite ayudarles a tener este servicio importante. Gracias a esta Junta más de 3200 personas, y 1.072  familias pueden abastecerse de agua.Su Presidente es el Sr. Teodocio y el Vicepresidente el Sr. Rutilio, solicitan este préstamo para la compra de medidores para unos 500 usuarios con lo cual desean fomentar el uso racional del liquido vital. Esta Junta está ayudando a las personas con este servicio imprescindible y es por eso que piden este crédito para poder ir creciendo y que más personas tengan acceso a este servicio.
texts.en: The Sanitation Council 21 de Julio was created in 1994. From that date until now it has supplied the indispensable liquid to the neighbors in the area. Currently, the Council has six wells and 4 water tanks of their own. It facilitates the distribution of drinking water to all the user in the 6 neighborhoods that belong to the Council, which allows them to have this important service.  Thanks to the Council, over 3200 people and 1072 families can have access to water. Their President is Mr. Teodocio and the Vice President is Mr. Rutilio, who are asking for a loan to buy water meters for about 500 users, which will help them promote the rational use of the vital liquid. This Council is helping people with this indispensable service and that is why they are asking for the loan, to be able to grow and to allow more people to have access to this service.

loans.use: To buy water meters.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is a smallholder farmer from Central Kenya. He is married and has two children who are under 10 years old. To provide for his family, Gideon practices various forms of farming including cow, goat, sheep, poultry, pig, and maize farming. He also has over 200 trees and a small retail shop on his 1.5 acre farm.  

Gideon is seeking a loan to buy farm supplies such as seeds in preparation for the planting season. Buying these supplies beforehand gives him an advantage in terms of reduced prices and room for proper planning. The income that he generates from other activities will be used for loan repayments when the loan is still in the initial stages. 

He hopes that at the end of this season, the harvest will be abundant, and he will have a high return on his investment of time and resources. Having additional income will help him to provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Benabina 2 Group

texts.fr: Alima  est une femme mariée de 42 ans avec 04 enfants. il ya 08 ans qu'elle est dans le commrece. sa force est le reseau de distribution qu'elle possède. En faite elle tisser des relations commerciaux avec les associations. Elle est leur principal fournisseur.Elle est a son 6 crédits et paie toujours bien. Elle veut le crédit pour acheter 10 paquets de 07 complets et 100 ensemble de 2 pagnes.
texts.en:
Alimta is  married, 42 years old, and the mother of four children. She has been working as a vendor for eight years. Her strength is in her distribution network. In fact, she builds business relations with associations, becoming their main supplier. She is now  on her sixth loan and has always been making her payments on time. 

She is seeking this loan to buy 10 packs with seven outfits each, and 100 2-piece sets of traditional "pagnes" wrap fabric.

loans.use: to buy clothing and traditional fabric for resale.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 25 años, estudia la carrera de contabilidad, actualmente trabajo en la parte administrativa de un establecimiento ganadero, lo que me permite poder adquirir experiencias y conocimientos acorde a su carrera.
Su objetivo es ser un buen profesional para poder progresar cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Carlos is 25 years old, and he is studying Accounting.  Currently he is working in the administrative section of a cattle farm, allowing him to acquire experience and knowledge related to his career.

His goal is to become a good professional so as to be able to get ahead every day.

He is requesting this loan to pay the fees for his career, and thus be able to continue with his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Arnolis Maria

texts.es:
Ella es Arnolis es una mujer cabeza de familia, toda una guerrera que ha criado y educado a un pequeño que hoy tiene 9 años de edad, generando recursos con su cría y venta de ganando porcino, actividad que aprendió de sus padres y la cual espera transmitirle a su hijo para que continúe esta noble profesión familiar.

Arnolis ha soñado toda su vida con mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, de brindarle educación a su pequeño, de sacar a flote todo ese potencial y empuje que caracteriza a las personas del campo, pero la falta de capital ha sido su principal impedimento por ende quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar materiales con los que mejorar sus chiqueras, como lo son adobes, cemento, madera, compra de una cría de cerda y alimento.

Ayuda a esta noble y trabajadora mujer a potenciar su negocio, un préstamo puede hacer la diferencia.
texts.en:
This is Arnolis. She is the head of the family. She is a warrior that has raised and educated a little boy who is now 9 years old. She generates resources with breeding and selling swine, a job that she learned from her parents and hopes to transfer to her son to continue this noble family profession. 

Arnolis has dreamt all of her life of improving the conditions of her home, of giving her son an education, and of bringing out all the potential and drive that characterizes the country people. But lack of income has been her main obstacle, so she wants to ask for a loan to buy materials to improve her pigsty since it's made of adobe, cement and wood, and to buy a baby pig and food. Help this noble and hard-working woman to maximize her business. A loan can make a difference.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve her pigsty since it's made of adobe, cement and wood, and to buy a baby pig and food.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Trabajar por mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, tener sus propios terrenos, una finca, mantener en óptimas condiciones a sus padres quienes le dieron no solo las enseñanzas en la cría de ganado,  brindaron la oportunidad de iniciar su empresa regalándole una vaca para que generara sus propios recursos, siendo este suceso el desencadenante de una nueva etapa  en la vida del joven Sebastián, que a sus 21 años quiere dar un gran paso en su carrera al éxito y necesita de tu apoyo para lograrlo. 

Sebastián quiere solicitar un préstamo, la razón es que necesita comprar 8 lechones para potenciar su labor e independizarse laboralmente de sus padres, demostrándoles su capacidad para salir adelante y los frutos de las buenas semillas de conocimientos y valores que plantaron en él.
texts.en:
Sebastián is 21 years old and wants to take a big step in his career towards success and he needs your support to do it. He works to improve the conditions of his home, to have his own land, a farm, and to keep his parents in good health. They not only taught him how to breed cattle, they also gave him the opportunity to start his own business, gifting him a cow so that he could generate his own money. This event was the trigger to a new stage in his life. 

Sebastián wants to apply for a loan. The reason being that he needs to buy 8 piglets to maximize his work and to become occupationally independent from his parents, showing them his capacity to get ahead and the fruits of the good knowledge seeds and values that they planted in him.

loans.use: to buy 8 piglets to maximize his work and to become occupationally independent.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in brick, cement, and sand for the construction of a water basin.

loans.name: Dora Elena

texts.es:
Dora es una mujer de 31 años de edad, una mujer sensible, carismática, trabajadora que se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de confección y junto con su esposo velan por el cuidado y futuro de sus dos hijos menores de edad.

Dora inicio su trabajo con una convicción la cual darle esperanzas, generarle oportunidades de progresos a sus muchachos, no quieren que vivan una vida en el campo, quiere que se conviertan en la primera generación de universitarios de la familia, ese es su gran sueño.

Pensando en su trabajo, en fortalecerlo, darle variantes Dora desea solicitar un préstamo, para la compra de insumos con los que iniciara la confección directa, necesita telas, hilos, agujas, lo que busca es ofrecer prendas a sus vecinos más económicas y captar el mercado del pueblo.
texts.en:
Dora is 31 years old. She is a sensible, charismatic, and hard-working woman who makes a living offering her dressmaking services. With her husband, she watches out for the care and future of her two younger children. Dora started her job with a conviction that gives her hope. It gives her children opportunities to progress, as she and her husband do not want them to live a life in the country. She wants them to be the first generation university students in the family. That is her big dream. 

Thinking about her work, of strengthening it and giving it variation, Dora wants to ask for a loan to buy supplies to start direct dressmaking. She needs fabric, thread and needles. She is looking to offer cheaper clothing to her neighbors and to capture the town market.

loans.use: to buy supplies to start direct dressmaking, such as fabric, thread and needles.

loans.name: Juan Camilo

texts.es:
A Sus 20 años de edad El joven Juan Camilo ha pasado por diferentes circunstancias y dificultades en su vida, solo por mencionar una de ellas, su estado civil en estos momentos es separado, pero si coraje, perseverancia y ganas de salir adelante hacen que se levante todos los días a trabajar en su negocio de cría de aves el cual le genera el capital para apoyar a sus padres y pagar un  curso de belleza.

Juan Camilo tiene un agudo sentido de responsabilidad, busca independizarse rápidamente para tener sus propios activos, desea un casa, vehículo, conocer el mundo, deseos que con trabajo y esfuerzo piensa cumplir.

Desea solicitar un préstamo para la compra de aves y materiales para mejorar el galpón, tales como, madera, cercados, bombillos, paja, y tejas para un techo.
texts.en:
At 20 years old Juan Camilo has gone through various circumstances and difficulties in his life, just to mention one of them, his marital status right now is separated. But his courage, perseverance and desire to succeed make him get up every day to work on his poultry business, which generates the capital to help his parents and pay for a beauty course.

Juan Camilo has a keen sense of responsibility, he seeks to become independent quickly in order to have his own assets, he wishes to have a house, car, and to travel the world, wishes that with his work and efforts he plans to fulfill. 

He wishes to apply for a loan for the purchase of birds and materials to improve the chicken coop, such as wood, fences, lightbulbs, straw, and shingles for a roof.

loans.use: buy birds and materials to improve the chicken coop, such as wood, fences, lightbulbs, straw, and shingles for a roof.

loans.name: Banco Mujer En Busca Del Exito Group

texts.es: Banco Mujer En Busca del Exito es un grupo formado hace más de cinco años y con excelente trayectoria en la Fundación. En todos los créditos anteriores han mostrado excelente puntualidad y responsabilidad en las fechas pactadas de pago. Se organizaron para cumplir objetivos en común que tenian éstas socias de la comunidad de Astúa Pirie. Han salido algunas de las señoras fundadoras pero sin embargo siempre se ha mantenido el grupo con las integrantes necesarias. Cumplen con los requisitos para pertenecer en el programa de crédito grupal. Doña María es una señora con 43 años de edad, divorciada y con una hija menor de edad que cursa la secundaria académica. Emprendió su negocio hace varios años, desde el momento que se divorció de su esposo. Ella cuenta con un pequeño aporte de pensión alimentaria, la cual no le alcanza para satisfacer las necesidades de ellas dos, por eso inició sus ventas de ropa de mujer y hombre, asi pudo generar ingresos y salir adelante junto con su hija. Gracias al buen trato que le brinda a sus clientes le va muy bien y ha podido superarse y crecer debido a varios financiamientos que han recibido por parte de la Fundación. Ella junto con dos socias más van a invertir en las ventas por catálogos y la cria de pollos para su respectiva venta después. Todas buscan lograr los mismos objetivos para bien de ellas y sus familias.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer En Busca del Exito [Women in Search of Success] is a group that formed more than five years ago, with an excellent record in the Foundation. In all of their previous loans, the members have shown excellent punctuality and responsibility in agreed upon payment dates. These members from the community of Astúa Pirie organized to achieve their common objectives. Some of the founding members have left, but the group has always maintained the necessary number of affiliates. They meet the requirements to participate in the program for group loans. 

Doña María is a 43-year-old divorced woman with a minor child who is attending secondary school.  She began her business several years ago after she divorced her husband. She receives some assistance from a food program, which isn't enough to take care of needs of the two of them. For this reason, she started her sales of men's and women's clothing. María has been able to generate income and get ahead, along with her daughter. Thanks to the good service that she gives her clients, her business is going very well. She has been able to succeed and grow her business due to several loans that the group has received from the Foundation. María and the two other members will invest their respective loans in catalog sales and in raising chickens for sale. All of the group members want to achieve their objectives for the good of themselves and their families.

loans.use: purchase clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida es una mujer de 50 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hijo independiente, y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es emprendedora, sincera, buena oyente, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, la región de mayor crecimiento, representada mayormente por la producción agropecuaria y forestal, es la zona más importante de producción hidrocarburífera. Situada a una altura de 437 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-34 grados centígrados.
Adelaida es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello largo marrón lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Debido a su impulso de superación solicitó un préstamo para mejorar su negocio. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; majadito (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito), locro (sopa de carne deshidratada, carne cortada en pedacitos, yuca y huevo), Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), Chicharrón (Chanchitos de monte frito), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno de papa y plátano),  actividad que realiza para la hora de almuerzo de lunes a sábado de forma ambulante, “cocino en mi casa, para luego cargar las ollas y platos en un carrito de 2 ruedas para salir a vender…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la comida se vende totalmente, la desventaja es la falta de mobiliario para abrir un puesto fijo de venta. Su sueño es tener su negocio propio, ella desea abrir un puesto de venta de comida en las afueras de su hogar. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Adelaida solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para abrir un puesto de venta de comida y dejar de ambular.
texts.en:
Adelaida is a 50 year old woman. She is married and has one independent child. Her business is making and selling traditional food. She is entrepreneurial, sincere, a good listener, patient, responsible, and very hard-working. Her business is located in the southern area of the city, the region with biggest growth. It is represented mainly by the agricultural and forestry production, and is the most important area for hydrocarbon production. It is situated at a height of 437 meters above sea level, with a hot, tropical climate and a temperature that varies throughout the day between 21-34 degrees Celsius. 

Adelaida has dark complexion, with brown eyes, long brown hair that she ties back, a short stature, and a robust physique. Her native language is Guaraní which she speaks at home and she speaks Spanish in general and in her business. She shares her life with her husband who is employed. They live in their own home built of bricks and cement, with a tin roof and cement floor, and drinking water, electricity and sewerage. 

Due to her drive to excel, she asked for a loan to improve her business. Her business is selling traditional foods such as: majadito (dehydrated beef, rice, fried egg, and fried plantain), loco (dehydrated meat, meat cut into small pieces, yucca, and egg soup), sopa de remojada (bone soup), chicharrón (pork rind), and cogote relleno (chicken neck, potato filling and plantain). She does this at lunch time from Monday to Saturday on the street. "I cook in my house and later carry the pots and dishes on a 2-wheel cart to go sell..." she says. The advantage of her business is that the food sells out. The disadvantage is lack of furnishings to open a permanent place to sell. 

Her dream is to have her own business. She wants to open a food stall outside of her home. This is the 3rd loan with the institution in the 8 years that she has been doing this work. For these reasons, Adelaida is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs to open a food stall and stop selling on the street.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to open a food stall and stop selling on the street.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
José es un orgulloso agricultor de 52 años de edad, una persona pujante, dedicado a cultivar el producto simbólico de Colombia, el café, que inicio su negocio en el año 2012, persiguiendo un sueño de comprar vivienda.

Anteriormente José se desempeñaba como mayordomo en diferentes fincas, generaba los recursos suficientes para mantener su hogar, pero no le alcanzaba para nada más, es por ello que tomó la decisión de independizarse y tratar de alcanzar ese sueño que por momentos veía perdido.

Con la clara intención de progresar, de transformarse en un importante cultivador de café de la zona, José quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, tales como, abono, riegos, fungicidas y materiales para cercar y marcar sus terrenos, alambres, madera y pagar la respectiva mano de obra para que le realicen el trabajo.
texts.en:
José is 52 years old and a proud farmer. He is a vigorous person, dedicated to growing Colombia's symbolic product: coffee. He started his business in 2012, chasing a dream of buying a house. Previously, José served as a butler on different farms. He gained the sufficient money to maintain his home, but he didn't get any further. For that reason, he made the decision to become independent and try to reach his dream that at times seemed to be lost. 

With the clear intention of progressing and transforming himself into an important coffee producer in the area, José wants to ask for a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, irrigation, fungicides, and materials such as wire and wood to enclose and mark his land, and to pay the respective labor so they do the work.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, irrigation, fungicides and materials to enclose and mark his land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply to his area for more income gain

loans.name: Baraka Kanouya Group

texts.fr: Marie est une jeune femme agée de 39 ans. Mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle à 6 ans d'expérience dans la restauration.Sa force est la qualité et la diversité des ses plats en plus de la propriété et de l'accueil client. Marie est a son 07 crédit à ACFIME. Elle paie bien, elle respecte ses engagements.Elle veut le crédit pour payer 03 sacs de riz, 3 bidons de 20 litres, 2 cartons de spaghetti, du thé(lipton,nescafé...)
texts.en:
Marie is a young 39-year-old woman, married with four children. She has six years' experience in catering.

Her strength is in the quality and variety of dishes she serves, in addition to the cleanliness and welcoming of customers. Marie is on her seventh credit loan with ACFIME. She reimburses well and fulfills her commitments.

She wants the loan to buy three bags of rice, three 20-liter cans of oil, two boxes of spaghetti, tea (Lipton, Nescafe,...)

loans.use: buy three bags of rice, three 20-liter cans of oil, five boxes of spaghetti, tea

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production to supply in his area for more income gain.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 22 years old married and supporting two children. She has been practicing tea farming for the last five years, earning KES 18,000 per month.

Nancy has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 as her first loan and plans to use it in buying farm inputs.

With the anticipated profits, she intends to pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to become wealthy in life.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Rutche

texts.en:
Rutche works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Rutche has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Chrislie

texts.en:
Chrislie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

Chrislie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Chrislie has been in this business for six years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Chrislie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married with five children and aged 35 years. She comes from Muzira cell. She has a retail shop as a major source of income and has a side income of produce. 

She requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to assist her to boost her business. She hopes to construct a permanent house for her family, since she is the bread earner, using profits she gets from the business. Her challenge is competition in the area and yet people are few.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell in her retail shop

loans.name: Ernilah

texts.en:
As a dedicated member of CCT Credit Cooperative for almost seven years, Ernilah gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories about their lives and businesses. She herself is also a blessing to her group, her family and her community in General Santos City by being warm and supportive to her colleagues.

Ernilah is a loving wife to her husband, Fernando, a driver, and a caring mother to their three children. She complements her husband’s hard work by earning additional income for the family through her business. She operates a variety store that offers usual everyday needs of an individual such as toiletries, snack items, canned goods, repacked condiments, and many more. 

But since her income from this business varies from time to time, she decided to add another enterprise, which is chorizo and embutido making. Embutido is a processed meat combined with hot dog, cheese, raisins, carrots, and other ingredients. She’s correct that this product is quite sellable in their community. A lot of customers are placing their orders, but she cannot meet their demand due to lack of capital. 

She aspires to improve her business and convert her store into a big grocery store with sufficient income that will sustain their everyday needs and her children’s education. One step to attain this is to acquire additional capital of PHP 22,000 to buy additional items for her inventory and more raw ingredients for chorizo and embutido making. She is hoping that you can be God’s instrument to help her, and praying that more blessings be returned to you.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her inventory and more raw ingredients in making chorizo and embutido.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
It all starts with a dream.

Wanting to invest someday for a house and lot, expand her business and eventually establish a bigger shop, Alicia, 54 years of age, is now doing her very best to excel at her craft.

Luz resides in Las Pinas City, Philippines. She is married to Teotimo, who is busy operating a finishing and furniture business. They have four kids. Currently, Alicia is operating her sari-sari store business. She is selling different kinds of products, basically commodities. The profit they get from both businesses covers their family expenses.

To further improve the business, she wants to ask for a 10,000 PHP loan, which she will use for buying more products to sell associated with her inventory. With this, she can surely gain more income and part of what she will gain, she will save for future investments and part will be used for their everyday living.

You’ll be a great blessing in advance. Thanks for your heartfelt generosity and goodness.

Alicia meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell associated with her inventory.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 56 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Elizabeth has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gbebre Group

texts.en:
Oho is a 39-year-old woman. She is the married mother of four children.

She has been in business since 2005, that is more than 10 years. Her success is based on quality and the particular way in which she prepares her beverage.

She is on her fifth credit loan and has always repaid promptly. She wants the loan to stock up and store the raw material which is millet, and use it when it is expensive.

loans.use: buy millet to store and use in the preparation of a traditional beverage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This loan is used to buy cement, sand, bricks, and zinc as well as to buy fish.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
This is Maria Elena who is praying right now for your kind hearts to help her. She was a new join-in to CCT in 2015 and there was a little hope aroused in her heart when she discovered Kiva.

For several years in Intramuros, Manila, it has been her daily routine to take charge every day of her Piso-net shop business. It’s just a little admirable how she manages to be a full-time mother and a businesswoman simultaneously, despite her age of 45. However, it’s never a matter to her because she really wants to support her husband, Virgilio (taxi driver), in building their family's condition.

Being in this business requires a lot of effort even though the income is really not stable. It depends on the customers’ demand. But, since Filipinos love surfing and more, her business has a very good potential for business expansion.

But she cannot do that without you. She needs PHP 10,000, which she will spend to maintain her computer business, buy additional equipment to renovate her shop and buy additional PC units as well.

She is aspiring that you won't hesitate to help her. She is assuring you that she will not waste your trust and preserve this kind of generosity that you will give to her.

Someday, she dreams of having a more affordable kind of life for her family. And, of course, she wants her kids to finish their schooling. She promises to do everything just to give them a good educational background. Also, she wishes that her business will grow as she pursues it more.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to maintain her computers, to buy additional equipment for renovating her shop and to buy additional PC units as well.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 29-year-old woman from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is married and has two children, ages 4 and 3 years old. Her husband is a driver, while she is running a sari-sari (variety) store. She has been in this business for three years. 

Aside from the sari-sari store, she also engages in other business like food vending and being a load (mobile phone credits) retailer. Laila and her husband work hard for their children. She dreams to send her children to school and have a better future. 

Laila is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy pork and vegetables for her food-vending business and to buy grocery items such as spices, coffee, sugar, candies, chips, biscuits, chocolates, and milled rice for her sari-sari store.

loans.use: to buy pork, vegetables, spices, coffee, sugar, candies, chips, biscuits, chocolates, and milled rice

loans.name: Komen

texts.en:
Komen and his family live in a rural home in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. He enjoys dairy farming because it generates regular income and provides milk for his family's breakfast. Komen started farming many years ago. He sells his farm produce at a local market near his home. 

Komen is seeking a loan to further grow his business. The borrowed money will be used by Komen to buy an additional dairy cow which will reproduce calves and produce more milk for him to sell. 

Your loan investment will help Komen grow his business and income from the dairy farm, which will help him to elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Pio

texts.en:
Pio is an individual client aged 51 years. He is a permanent resident in the rural areas of Uganda, and an expert in growing maize and sweet potatoes. 

Pio is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for his gardens. He faces the challenge of prolonged droughts.  Besides that, he is a hard working person.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique, a 54-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Intramuros, Manila City, has been operating his transportation business for eight years now, and he makes a good income from this. He has a kid to support, which is why he is determined to work harder.

He has been into several businesses for a long time and for sure, he already knows the tricks of the trade. He has a tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to him. In his business, the regular customers are the local community.

Enrique wants to apply for a PHP 20,000 loan to continue operations of the business. He will be using the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and to maintain the motorcycle.

Enrique dreams of having more tricycle units someday and investing in a house to own.

He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories and to maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: resupply with two bales of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her capital by buying her products in bulk.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is currently handling and managing a food stall business.

This is a very good choice of business for Leticia since most of the Filipinos today really love eating from sidewalks. Aside from this, she ably supplies the daily necessities of her family at once.

She is already 54 years old by now and has two kids. They live in Las Pinas City where she pushes her cart all day long to sell fish balls and other known street foods.

With her full-blown potential in business handling, she is confident enough to borrow a loan worth PHP 10,000, which she will use to buy additional ingredients and raw products for her business. With her eight years in this industry, she assures you she will repay faithfully with all that she can.

In addition to her house rental business, she also oversees an egg-vending business, which, some time in the future, she dreams of expanding.

Today, she is really striving to save money for her children's education. She wants them to finish their schooling and earn good jobs in due time. At the same time, she's looking forward to the success of her business.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and raw products for her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 37 years old, married to Joseph, and she supports five children. She has been a dairy farmer for the last two years and the business earns her KES 5,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to get a better a harvest. The crops are for family use, and the surplus will be sold in the market. 

Martha plans to use the profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to sell to clients, and to educate her children to higher levels of education. Her hope is to eradicate poverty in her home and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to get a better a harvest - for family use and to sell the surplus in the market.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Imagine putting all your efforts investing in farming and reaping nothing at the end of the day. This is the sad story of Anderson, a youthful 41-year-old Mzee (old man), and a wise farmer who neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. He farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills near Nkubu, in the central region of Kenya where he grows maize and keeps dairy animals. He also does a side hustle business (timber-cutting) to supplement the merger income he earns from farming. Anderson's farming experience dates back to 2008. Like many other farmers in the region, maize is a cash crop, which he has been planting for as long as he can remember. With time, the fertility of his land has started to dwindle and whenever he plants maize, the yields go down with each growing season. Anderson has also been affected with weeds.

Today, Anderson requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and good quality seeds. Through this loan, Anderson is going to increase his crop production and improve his income. This loan will permanently change the living standards of Anderson and there is no doubt that he can find rewarding employment in farming.

Support the entrepreneurial dreams of a Kenyan with a loan today!

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and good quality seeds.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 53 years old, married, and blessed with five children, one of whom is still in secondary school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from the trainings, especially enterprise development.

Her economic activity is poultry farming. She also does bead work and operates a retail shop. She has taken out a Kiva loan to buy more chickens in order to boost her poultry farming business. With increased income, she will be able to pay for her child's tuition fees. 

Grace is very happy and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and boost her poultry farming business, in order to pay child's tuition fees.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet has been a sari-sari store owner for 18 years. She is a 51-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. Aside from her sari-sari store, Janet has a small eatery in her place and she also has a farm. For this, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and to buy assorted goods for her sari-sari store such as chips, biscuits, candies, powdered juice, powdered milk, coffee, sugar, spices, cooking oil, laundry soap, bath soap, canned goods and noodles. Janet works hard for the future that she may be able to use when she gets old. She is planning to improve and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chips, biscuits, candies, powdered juice, powdered milk, coffee, sugar, spices, cooking oil, laundry soap, bath soap, canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 41 years old, married and supports a family of four children. He has been operating a retail business for the last eight years, earning KES 31,000 per month.

Samwel has applied for KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production to supply for more income gain.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production to supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of products such as cooking oil, baking flour, and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Avzalbi

texts.ru: Ей 39 лет. Ее зовут Авзалби. Она уроженка района Дангара. Народ Дангары славится своим чувством юмора и гостеприимством. Авзалби хорошая хозяйка и настоящая мастерица. У нее большой талант в области шитья женской одежды. Она не давно начала работать в этой сфере деятельности, но поняла, что это ее профессия и она будет заниматься швейным бизнесом еще на долго. Авзалби просит ей помочь купить компьютерную машинку. Ее нынешняя машинка старая, ручная и не удобная. Авзалби не имеет больших средств на новую машинку и просит Вас помочь ей совершить покупку. Она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
Avzalbi is 39 years old and a native of the Dangara district of Tajikistan.  The people from this district are famous for their sense of humor and their hospitality.  Avzalbi is a good homemaker and a skilled craftswoman.  She is particularly talented when it comes to sewing women's dresses.  She started working in this field not long ago but soon realized that this was going to be her profession and that she would be involved in it for much longer.

Avzalbi is requesting some support to buy a computerized sewing machine.  Her current hand-operated sewing machine is old and inconvenient.  Avzalbi doesn't have enough money to buy a new machine and she needs your help to make this purchase.  She is hoping for your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба благодарит кредиторов KIVA за поддержку, которую они оказали ей. Она смогла приобрести необходимые ткани и расширить деятельность. Насиба  уверена, что во второй раз они ее поддержат. Она решила отремонтировать дом. Ее дом много лет не ремонтировался и нуждается в капитальном восстановлении. Насиба просит помочь ей купить стройматериалы и отремонтировать свое жилище, чтобы ее дети чувствовали себя комфортно. Насиба не сомневается, что ей помогут, и заранее выражает благодарность.
texts.en: Nasiba thanks Kiva lenders for the support that she has received.  She was able to buy some much needed fabrics and to expand her activity.  She is now confident that she will receive support a second time.  She has decided to renovate her house, which hasn't been repaired for many years and needs a major restoration.  Nasiba is requesting your support to help her buy some construction supplies and renovate her home, as she wants her children to live comfortably.  Nasiba has no doubt that she will receive some support.  She thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to renovate her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meats, vegetables and flour, and to invest in chairs and tables.

loans.name: Lerna

texts.en: Lerna is a 51-year-old married woman from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She has seven children: the oldest child is 31 years old and the youngest child is 14 years old. Her husband is a farmer while she runs a sari-sari store business. She has been in this business for 23 years. Lerna and her husband work hard for their children to give them a better life. She is asking for a loan for additional capital to buy grocery items such as biscuits, candies, chips, spices, mineral water and soft drinks. In the future, Lerna is planning to expand her business to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, candies, chips, spices, mineral water and soft drinks.

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en: Khitam is a 45-year-old married woman from Nablus City, which is an ancient and beautiful city in the West Bank, where her economic situation is bad. She has been selling goods in her small retail shop for a small profit margin. Khitam has taken out a USD loan from FATEN, which will help her to buy more products to resell. Khitam's loan will enable her to buy more inventory and goods to resell, and eventually increase the size of her business and her income. Khitam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell

loans.name: Sasmwel

texts.en:
Sasmwel is 25 years old, married and supports a family of two children. He has been practicing farming for the last three years earning KES 4,500 per month. 

Sasmwel has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gains. He plans to use the anticipated profits to plant trees for sale in the market and to educate his children. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gains.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 31 years old, married and supports five children. She has been practicing farming for the last four years, earning a profit of KES 5,000 per month.

Janeth has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 from VFK Kapsabet branch to purchase fertilizer and seeds for planting.

This being her first loan with VisionFundKenya she plans to use the profits to improve her children's education. Her future dreams are to expand her business and have a good home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a smallholder farmer from Kapsumai village in North Rift Kenya. He makes a living from dairy and horticultural farming. He sells produce from his farm at a local market and uses the money to pay for expenses arising in his business and family.  

Through hard work and sacrifices, he has been able to maintain his dairy farm through rough economic times. He is seeking a loan to buy a heifer which will give him more milk for sale and calves in the future.  

Your loan investment will help Ben to grow his business and income. In the long-run, his family's living standards will be much improved.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosilla

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosilla works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from egg vending. Rosilla is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Rosilla has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more contianers of coocnut wine to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rowena is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rowena has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: Denis al enfrentar una difícil situación sentimental con su cónyuge,  tuvo que cambiar su estilo de vida y empezar a buscar medios para sustentar a sus dos hijos.  Después de la separación hace 25 años, empezó su negocio de comercialización de toallas, sábanas, cremas corporales y perfumes, que ofreció a crédito a sus conocidos y amigos.  En la actualidad cuenta con una amplia clientela que disfruta de los productos que Denis comercializa, ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en toallas, tendidos de cama y cremas corporales.  Esta inversión incrementará su inventario y las posibilidades de venta. Su meta a largo plazo es tener más clientes e incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
When facing a difficult emotional time with her partner, Denis had to change her lifestyle and seek new ways to support her two children. Following her separation from her partner 25 years ago, Denis started a business selling towels, sheets, body creams and perfumes, which she sold on credit to friends and acquaintances.

Denis now has a large customer base that enjoys the products that Denis sells. Denis is applying for a Kiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Doming, in order to buy towels, bed sheets, and body creams.

This investment will increase Denis' stock and sales potential.

Denis' long-term goal is to have more customers and to increase sales.

loans.use: to buy towels, bed sheets, and body creams.

loans.name: Greda Group

texts.en:
Augusta is the representative of her group, Greda traders. Her group is located in Teshie, an area dominated by fishing activity. She and her family are living in a rented place in Teshie. The group members are into palm oil, onions, yams, chickens, beans, firewood and welding services.

Augusta is excited to be taking her second loan from ID-Ghana. She started her business with her savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying palm oil and onions. She sells these commodities from door-to-door. She will use the profits to re-invest in her business and to provide for the needs of her family. Augusta dreams of having a successful business and living in her house. She thanks Kiva investors for their support! 

They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and onions which she sells to customers.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin, at heart, is a resourceful, loving man. His fatherly love has been enough to show him that he needs to work hard to help his family get ahead with excellent values and foundation. 

Martin is a 32-year-old, smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is a small agricultural center near the famous Rift valley. He owns a small piece of land together with his lovely wife, and they have been blessed with a lovely family. On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for ten years. Their main income sources are milk and crops. They recently ventured into a small personal business, or side hustle, as they like to put it. 

From Kiva lenders, Martin is seeking a loan worth KES 40,000 to grow his horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to afford Martin access to a loan that will aid him to grow his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. 

With your loan, Martin’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is 27 years old, married, and lives with her husband in Pangani district. 

Nuru is a Camfed learner guide who volunteers working with students in a secondary school. She teaches them life skills and problem solving skills to help them improve their learning performance. Nuru also has a clothing business, and she sells women's clothes. She is requesting a Kiva loan to increase her capital by buying her products in bulk to increase profit. She will also use the loan to renovate a shop for her business. 

Nuru plans to use the profit she will earn to provide her parents with decent meals and health care.

loans.use: to increase her capital by buying her products in bulk to increase profit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 27 years old and supports two children. She has been a livestock keeper for the last four years and the business earns her KES 4,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable her to sell milk to clients. She plans to use the profits gained to repay the loan and add more cattle for milk production.

Her hope is to expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable her to sell milk to clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and a bull for milk production and supply.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens for egg production and supply in the market.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is a smallholder farmer from a rural home in South Rift Kenya. Dairy farming to Raphael is not only a source of income, but also a livelihood. He has been dairy farming for years and he is still committed to the growth of his farm.

Raphael is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a dairy cow. He plans to spend 5% of the loan amount on the cow’s insurance to protect his family from slipping into poverty in case the cow dies.

The impact this loan will have on Raphael and his family includes financial inclusion, business growth, wider asset base, and increase in income.  His ultimate goal is to elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Abizeranye Subgroup B

texts.en: Josiane is a group leader, aged 29. She is married with one child who is 9 . The group is called ABIZERANYE meaning “TRUST” they sell different products but they have common goal of changing their better future. She sells clothes and has spent ten years in the business. With the loan, she would like to buy more trousers and shirts for sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more trousers and shirts for sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 41 years old, widowed, and has three children. She operates a retail shop and has been in the business for fifteen years.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and she intends to use the loan to buy more stock of flour, rice, milk, cooking oil and soap detergents to sell and hopes this will enable her to serve more customers and make more income. She will use the profits generated from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her retail shop to wholesale and become more financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, rice, milk, cooking oil and soap detergents to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the stock in her shop by buying in bulk

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine and her nice family live in Harij village of Shirak region. Narine's parents in law and elderly retired and unemployed. Narine herself, with her husband's help has been running family farm for 10 years. They keep two cows, calves and hens and also cultivate wheat, potato, cabbage, garlic and growing walnut trees. 
Narine's farm is beautiful and reach with the harvest and due to their hard work, they are able to gather income for family's living. 

Narine has applied for this loan to ask lenders help her with purchasing forage for feeding the livestock. Narine's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living. Shirak is considered to be a poor region, with a high unemployment rate, and low living standards. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs makes a number of difficulties for people to develop their business in the Shirak region. Narine thanks her Kiva lenders and anticipates their support. She is sure that working with Kiva lenders will be productive and profitable for her farm.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Pertunia

texts.en:
Pertunia is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This is her story:1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
Bachelor of Arts in business Administration marketing management, career strategies and business communication skills are the classes I enjoy the most.
2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
My goals after graduation are getting a well-paid job so that I can continue with my studies. Secondly, I’d like to do my MBA part time while I’m working. My MBA will enlarge my capacity and grow more to become a more successful leader. I would like to work as a salesperson. I would work in any city my job takes me.
3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?
I was born and raised in Soweto. I was born and raised by my mother, a single parent. I have one sister and a daughter. I’m staying with my family and my mother is not working. We are stay in a RDP house and we are renting one bed room out to help us with finance and all sharing one room. I’m not married. My daughter and sister receive a grant, which helps us afford food. I’m raised by a mother who is always supportive in my life.
4.	What do you like to do in your spare time?
I study a lot in my spare time. I love studying because it makes things easier for me in classes. I always make sure that I am ahead on my school books. I love reading novels and magazines. I’m always seeking for the opportunities to progress in life. I involve myself in reading in everyday life.
5.	How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?
Kiva loan will help me with my school transport money because it is not easy to have transport money to school every day. This has brought a negative record in my school attendance. I will bring a significant change in my family as my mother will stop stressing about my transport money.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Mutanga Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Racheal. She is 34 years old, married and blessed with four children who are all attending school. She is a member of Mutanga Women Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from training, especially enterprise development and financial management.

Racheal practices mixed farming; poultry,dairy and vegetable farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy animal feed to boost her dairy farming. She intends to use the increased profits to buy clothes for resale in the festive month of December.

Racheal is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy animal feed to boost her dairy farming.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 43-year-old married woman with five children from the town of Badian in Cebu. Her oldest child is 17 years old and her youngest child is 6 years old. 

Marites has been running a sari-sari store for 12 years. She sells basic commodities like snacks, cooking oil, toiletries, canned goods, seasonings and candles. She earns about PHP 8,000 per month from this business. Marites is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy assorted goods such as noodles, chips, candies, biscuits, powdered milk, powdered juice, coffee, sugar, canned goods, cooking oil and spices. 

Like other mothers, Marites' only wish is to give her children a better life. She hopes that all her children will get a degree and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, chips, candies, biscuits, powdered milk, powdered juice, coffee, sugar, canned goods, cooking oil and spices for her general store.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert has been a farmer for a long time and knows what it takes to succeed. He is a hard worker who always says “I eat from my sweat.” He lives in Kilima, a rural village in the rich highlands of Kapsowar. He is happily married and has been blessed with angelic looking children. He has farmed for ten years, and has never regretted it. His primary source of income has been milk, eggs, and crops. Most of the small-holder farmers in Kilima village own approximately ¼ acre of land per household, and this has made them work extra hard to fully utilize their farms. He has been able to earn a decent and honest living by selling milk and eggs. These ventures have enabled him to send his children to school and feed his family. Albert has planted many trees on his compound and also has Napier grass, which is high in protein and is used to feed his dairy cow. This enhances his milk-selling profits. Because of increased demand, Albert requests a loan to buy a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is a very profitable venture, and he wants to take full advantage of the ready market for dairy products. Through the loan, Albert is sure of satisfying the demand for milk in his area. Through increased profits, Albert is sure that he will repay the loan on time and also be in a position to comfortably take care of his family. Albert, with his entrepreneurial spirit, strength and tenacity, would like to continue fighting so that he can achieve his dream of owning his own business and empowering society by being a source of employment. Juhudi Kilimo, through its training, has helped Albert save more effectively. He plans to add value to his milk through packaging. He also hopes to one day start manufacturing milk products such as yoghurt and cream. 

Albert will be able to continue farming and succeed with your help!

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and dairy feed so as to get more milk to sell and make more income to educate her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 36 years old, married and supports a family of 2 children. She has been growing cash crops for sell and has been in this farming business for the last 3 years and it has been profitable. 

Jackline has applied for her first loan of KES. 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply and hopes this will enable her to get more income and support her family. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay a loan and to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her farming business, make more income and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply and hopes this will enable her to get more income and support her family.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 42 years old, married, and supports a family of five children. She has been practicing farming for the last four years, earning KES 7,000 per month. 

Christina has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply, for more income gain. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more juice, bread, and milk to sell.

loans.name: Sanie

texts.en:
Sanie has been scheduled for eye surgery and she is seeking your compassion to help her financially pay for the surgery.

Sanie is 55 years old and married with two children, living in the city of Korca, in the southeast of the country. She is on a disability allowance and receives $77 per month for it, in addition to her husband’s monthly income of $150. Some years back she had an accident which resulted in dysfunction of her right hand. She was cutting wood using an ax when the ax severely cut her hand instead. The doctor then did not stitch it right, unfortunately. Nowadays, not only does she not use her right hand for all the functions, but she also has cataracts in both eyes.

loans.use: to pay for eye surgery that has been scheduled.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is 34 years old, married to Daniel and supports one child. 

Consolata has been selling tomatoes in the market for the last four years and the business earns her KES 3,000 per month. She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more stock of tomatoes to sell to clients and meet client needs. 

She plans to use the profits gained to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to meet client needs.

Her hope is to expand her business sector.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of tomatoes to sell to clients and meet client needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gains.

loans.name: Dariah

texts.en:
Dariah is 28 years old, married and supports a family of three children. 

She is a farmer and has been growing cash crops such as maize and vegetables to sell, and the business has been profitable. She will be using the loan to buy a dairy cow so as to get milk to sell and hopes this will enable her to make more income to support her family. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children, buy another dairy cow and repay the loan. 

Her future hopes are to improve her farming business, make more income and support her family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to get milk to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply.

loans.name: Jeriah

texts.en:
Jeriah is 43 years old, married to Isaac and supports three children. She has been a dairy farmer in the market for the last three years and the business earns her KES 4,000 per month. 

Jeriah has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk supply to meet both client and family needs. 

She plans to use the profits gained to repay the loan and educate her children. Her hope is to expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk supply to meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Marry

texts.en:
Marry is 60 years old and supports a family of three children. She has been practicing farming for the last 30 years and the business earns her an income of KES 10,000 per month.

Marry has applied for her first loan of KSH 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more fertilizers and chemicals to spray her firm for better production to meet the demand of her clients as well as family needs.

She anticipates to use the profits gained to repay her loan and the surplus to buy a dairy cow and educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to eradicate poverty and improve the welfare of her family.                  .

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizers and chemicals to spray her firm for better production to meet the demand of her clients as well as family needs.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is from Dalaguete, Cebu. She is a 53-year-old married woman and has two children. The oldest is already an adult while the youngest child is 13 years old. Her husband is a farmer while she buys and sell vegetables. They work hard for their family. 

Cristita is asking for a loan to buy assorted vegetables such as squash, eggplant, cabbage, beans and christophene. With a variety of vegetables, she can expect to attract more customers in the future. Eventually, she plans to include other vegetables that she has not previously carried for better sustainability.

loans.use: to buy squash, eggplant, cabbage, beans and christophene to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a smallholder farmer from a rural home in the South Rift area of Kenya. Simon enjoys dairy farming because it generates regular income and milk for his children to drink. He has been a dairy farmer for most of his life and has not lost the determination to grow the business even after all that time. 

Simon is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. He plans to spend 95% of the loan on a heifer and the remaining 5% on insurance of the cow. From the cow, he expects an increase in cash flow into the business and calves in the future. 

Through this loan, Simon and his family will be financially included, grow their business, broaden their asset base, and increase their income.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cheruiyot

texts.en:
Cheruiyot is a smallholder farmer from a rural home in South Rift Kenya. Dairy farming to Cheruiyot is not only a source of income but also a livelihood. He has been dairy farming for years and he is still committed to the growth of his farm.

Cheruiyot is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a dairy cow. He plans to spend a small part of the loan amount on the cow’s insurance to protect his family against a sudden loss of the cow. 

The impact this loan will have on Cheruiyot and his family includes financial inclusion, business growth, wider asset base, and increase in income. His ultimate goal is to elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase spare parts such as nuts, side mirrors, brake pads and engine oil so as to keep his motorcycle in good condition and make more income.

loans.name: Abizeranye Sub Group C

texts.en:
Pauline is 26 years old. She is a group leader of ABIZERANYE which means TRUST in English. The members of the group sell different items and they wish to improve their welfare for a better living. 

Pauline owns a salon and has been in business for the past two years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more vitamins, lotions and chairs to sell. The profit from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more vitamins, lotions and chairs to sell.

loans.name: Bonifasi

texts.en:
At a tender age, starting a new family and home with a small piece of land is a challenge for people in the Kitale area of Kenya. Bonifasi, a lovely family man overcame this and has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. His primary source of income has been selling eggs, milk and some personal business he engages in to supplement his meager income. 

Bonifasi passionately loves poultry farming and feeding his poultry makes him very proud. Waking up every day in the morning to collect eggs from his poultry makes him feel fulfilled. Although this humble father makes a profit through selling poultry, the biggest challenge he faces is meeting the demand of the market that is available. He is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is an institution that serves poor, small-landholding farmers, Bonifasi has acquired both financial and technical training. With the loan, he intends to increase his egg production from one crate a day to three crates a day. A crate of eggs goes for 450 KES, and with three crates, he will be making 1,350 KES per day. With the loan, he will be able to increase his income and move from subsistence to more commercial farming. With this loan, he will be able to improve his living conditions and enhance his food security and that of his community.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a smallholder farmer from a rural home in Siongiroi, Kenya. Dairy farming to Michael's family is not only a source of income but also a livelihood. He has been dairy farming for years and he is still committed to the growth of his farm.

Michael is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to buy a dairy cow. He plans to spend KES 19,000 on the cow and KES 1,000 on its insurance. From this investment, Michael expects to generate more income from milk sales which he will use to repay the loan. The new cow will also give birth to calves which will broaden his asset base and improve his eligibility for bigger credit services in the future. His ultimate goal, however, is to elevate the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, powdered milk, coffee, powdered juice, sugar, chips, biscuits, candies, noodles, spices and canned goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: start a clothes business.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 46 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and pensioner father-in-law in Telavi district. Tamar and her husband work at a local restaurant and they are paid monthly. Tamar decided to start her own business and requested a loan. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan and pay a lease for a restaurant. She and her husband will run it and they will purchase new inventory like plates, knives and spoons and so on. Tamar is experienced in this field and thinks that it will be profitable and they will have stable income. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay a lease for a restaurant and run it with her husband in order to generate income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, diaper, school supplies, chips, biscuits, candies, noodles, canned goods, powdered milk, coffee, powdered juice, sugar and spices.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is a mother of three school-aged children, and lives in Horom village in Shirak region. Together with her husband, she has been running their family farm since a young age.

On the farm, the couple keeps livestock (cow, calves, sheep, hens) and also cultivates wheat, barley and potatoes in the family yard. Gayane is asking for a loan to invest in her farming business and develop it. She plans to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and two piglets. 

Gayane's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living. Shirak is considered to be a poor region, with a high unemployment rate, and low living standards. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs makes a number of difficulties for people to develop their business in the Shirak region. Gayane and her family thanks their Kiva lenders and anticipate their support. They are sure that working with Kiva lenders will be productive and profitable.

loans.use: pay for forage for feeding the livestock and two piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a 35-year-old married mother of two children, and lives with her husband in Kilombero district. 

She has requested a Kiva loan to start a clothes business. Christina also volunteers as a Camfed Core trainer working with Kilombero`s Learner guides to cascade life skills knowledge to secondary students. Christina plans to use the profit she will earn to take her children to school and cover house hold expenses such as rent and food.

loans.use: to start a clothes business.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
