Over last 10 years, Liana has been running a grocery store in Yerevan town. Liana lives with her husband and their 23-year-old son, who help her in the store. Liana has requested this loan to purchase refrigerators for keeping vegetables and fruit needed for the store. She needs this investment to be able to bring more fruit and keep it fresh, so customers will be satisfied with the quality of products. 

This is Liana's second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions previously, was very difficult to pay back, and Liana faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, she and her husband were able to run their small retail business in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, Liana has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Please support Liana and her husband with this loan and help them to sustain their store.

loans.use: to pay for refrigerators for keeping vegetables and fruit needed for the store.

loans.name: Adjorman Group

texts.en:
Adjorman group is more of a pioneer group in ID-Ghana, Teshie branch, and is starting their 10th cycle with ID-Ghana. It is made up of three members represented by Mary. The businesses of the members, amongst them are: licensed medicine shop, soft drinks, vegetables, foodstuffs and charcoal.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit all of these micro-entrepreneurs, Mary amongst them. She says that she joined ID-Ghana, Teshie branch five years ago on the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling medicines both herbal and orthodox. She indicated that she started operation the chemical shop with her husband, but he has since died, so she is in full charge now.

The loan that Mary is receiving will be used to increase her working capital (buying both herbal and orthodox from the wholesalers) that she will acquire from wholesalers in the city of Accra and later sell in her shop. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is a widow and has one dependable child. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana she replied that she likes the training and the health services that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy both herbal and orthodox medicine from wholesalers to sell to customers.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna, pictured here with her husband, Felipe, is an artisan from Nicaragua who specializes in ceramic vases and vessels. She would like to purchase oxides to be used in the painting of her pieces.

Digna has been selling through NOVICA since 2013. This is her story:

"I'm Digna Mercedes Ampio. When I was still in primary school, a teacher took us on a field trip to a ceramics workshop. It had a great impact on me because we got to work the clay with our hands. My last teacher became my husband. I'm teaching our children, friends and acquaintances who come to us with a desire to learn. I'm very careful when making agreements and doing business. I remember when my husband and I launched our workshop. I had to look after the children and also design our ceramics. But our desire to provide them with a better life was the fuel we needed to continue giving it our best effort. I like to keep shoppers happy with the attractive designs we create. My husband and I work together in the workshop.  Our children help us, and can craft pieces. Several young people from the community also help us with the carving, sanding, applying underglaze and painting. In this way, we all know our own small part in the workshop processes."

"This microcredit is a huge blessing to our business. Thank you for your support and for helping us to grow in our craft."

Use the link below to view Digna's ceramic vases and vessels on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/9120

loans.use: to invest purchase oxides to be used in the painting of her pieces.

loans.name: Nyomo Bei Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Nyomo bei which was established several years ago in Teshie, Accra. It is made up of three members who came together because they thought it would be easier to get financing as a group since they don't have collateral to borrow from a state bank. That is why they express their gratitude to ID-Ghana for bringing this type of loan system.

All of the members are going to invest in buying school bags, hardwood, ply-wood, grocery, diapers, slippers, cosmetics and tea. They have experience trading and are very customer friendly.

Samuel is 54 years old, married, and has two children. He needs to cover his personal expenses and those of his family. There are two more members who are going to invest in various businesses. 

Samuel sell school bags, hardwood and ply-wood. They have joined together so that they can improve the living conditions for themselves and their families.

loans.use: buy and sell school bags, hardwood and ply-wood to customers.

loans.name: Otinkorang Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Otinkorang which has begun its 9th loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The groups is composed of three members, with Rosemary as the representative. There is a variety of businesses maintained by the members of the group, including fried yam, chicken, fresh fish and barf loaf.

The loan they’re taking out will benefit small micro businesses, one of which is Rosemary's. She says she joined ID-Ghana because of a large promotion at the institution. Currently, she sells fried yams and fried chicken. She wants people to know that she learned this business on her own 20 years ago.

The loan she will take out will be used for increasing capital for the purchase of wholesale yams, cooking oil, charcoal and chicken wings to fry and sell to the customers in her area. This kind of work allows Rosemary to generate resources to support her family economically, since she’s single and has one dependable child.

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the savings and training that the institution offers.

loans.use: purchase yams, cooking oil, charcoal and chicken wings to fry and sell to the customers in her area.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат сильная женщина из района Шахритуз. Ей 64 лет, замужем и мать двоих детей. Её муж мастер по ремонту квартир, а дети находятся на заработках в России. Сама Мухаббат занимается животноводством. Она очень подвижный человек не сможет сидеть без дела, хотя в таком возрасте ей нужно отдыхать. Но так как жизненные условия у них не так хороши, Мухаббат приходится заниматься своим любимым делом, даже если устаёт. Из-за кризиса ей пришлось продать всех своих животных, и у неё не осталось ни одного. Мухаббат не расстроилась, потому что она верит, что благодаря Вашей поддержке она сможет купить несколько телят, расширит бизнес и снова обеспечить семью молочными продуктами.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is a strong woman from the Shahrituz district of Tajikistan.  She is 64 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  Her husband works as a handyman and renovates apartments, while her children are currently working in Russia.  Muhabbat herself works in animal husbandry.  She is a very active woman who can't stay without doing anything, although at her age she should be resting more.  But since the family's living conditions are difficult, Muhabat  has no choice but to stay involved in her favorite activity, even when she's tired.  

Because of the economic crisis, Muhabbat has had to sell all her farm animals, so she doesn't have any left.  She's not too upset, though, because she knows that, thanks to your support, she will be able to buy a few calves, which will allow her to expand her business and once more provide her family with dairy products .

loans.use: to purchase a few calves.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 51 years old and she is mother of three. All her sons are adults and they are living on their own.

Sandra is living in La Paz with her parents and her aunts in her family's house. Sandra has been s a school teacher for 20 years but now she is working selling clothes.

Now we are at a different season and Sandra is selling shoes. She needs a loan to buy women's shoes because she detected a great demand so she wants to be ready.

She hopes you can help her again Sandra works hard and she will do anything to sell all the shoes.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.en:
Yesenia is married. She has a little son and her husband works as a mason.

She and her family live at her father's house. She makes and sells cheese. She goes with her products every Sunday to visit the local fair at her town.

Yesenia needs a loan to buy a milking cow because it is very important to have another cow to let the other animals rest if she wants milk with excellent taste.

She hopes you can help her. She is the main support of her family and she works hard.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
As a human resources professional for more than 15 years, Von has interviewed hundreds of people and has mastered the art of asking the right questions and active listening. Because of her intuitive nature, she knew she found her calling when she discovered life coaching.

She began coaching in the corporate world to gain experience, and she also received her Master’s in Human Performance Improvement.

Von also has two years of experience operating a nonprofit, which focused on group coaching workshops that educated, empowered, and encouraged women to career, health, and financial literacy.

Originally from Chicago, Von has personal life experience that allows her to be empathetic about the unique challenges of transition.

Phoenix Rising Coaching is unique because it offers customized coaching and is specifically geared towards helping clients tap into their own personal power to bridge the gap between where they are and where they want to be. Mother of one, Von creates a safe, non-judgmental, collaborative partnership that is centered on action.

Von will use the Kiva loan to her build her website, and to pay certification fees associated with becoming a certified life coach. She would eventually like to write a book and do speaking engagements.

loans.use: to her build her website, and to pay certification fees associated with becoming a certified life coach

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is aged 54 years and married to Thomas, and she supports four children.

She has been selling timber for the last 3 years and the business earns her KES 6,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase trees for making timber to make more stocks of timber to sell to clients and meet both client and family needs.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate her children.

Her hope is to expand her agricultural sector and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase trees for making timber to make more stocks of timber to sell to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехре 45 лет. Она замужняя женщина. Гулчехра с мужем, сыном и невесткой живут на районе Конибодом. Гулчехра с мужем бок о бок около 15 лет занимаются животноводством и земледелием. На данный момент они имеют 2 гектаров земли. На один гектар они посеяли пшеницу, а на другой кукурузу. Гулчехра с мужем много старались и в итоге добились еще 2 гектаров земли. Радости Гулчехри нет придела. Теперь землю нужно очистить и подготовить для посева. Они потратят заемные деньги на приобретения топливо для трактора, минеральные удобрения и селитру. Гулчехра сама обратилась за кредитом, потому что МДО "Хумо" поддерживает женщин клиентов и упрощает процесс кредитования для них. Гулчехра не сомневается, что есть чудо и ее поддержат. Спасибо!
texts.en: Gulchehra is 45 years old. She is a married woman. Gulchehra, her husband, son and daughter-in-law live in the Konibodom region. Gulchehra and her husband have been rearing animals and growing crops side-by-side for about 15 years. At the present time they have two hectares of land. On one hectare they have planted wheat, and on the other corn. Gulchehra and her husband have worked hard and as a result they have got another two hectares of land. There is no limit to Gulchehra's joy. Now she needs to clear the land and prepare it for sowing. They will spend the borrowed money on acquiring tractor fuel, miner fertilizer, and nitrate. Gulchehra has applied for a loan herself because MLO Humo support female clients and simplifies the loan process for them. Gulchehra has no doubt that there is a miracle and she will find support. Thank you!

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer, nitrate and tractor fuel.

loans.name: Marcellah

texts.en:
Marcellah is 29-years-old, married to Vincent and she supports 3 children. 

She has been selling clothes for the last 2 years and the business earns her 3,000 KES per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more stocks of clothes for sale to clients. 

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her hope is to expand her agricultural sector and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes for sale to clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain

loans.name: Wilson Norbey

texts.es:
Wilson es un hombre de 41 años de edad, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos, una de 15 y otro de 14  en una zona rural de abejorral.

Trabaja en su negocio 10 horas, 6 días a la semana, su cultivo lo heredo de sus padres y espera en algún momento poder cedérselo a su muchacho para que continúe con la noble tradición familiar de cultivadores.

Wilson como todo hombre tiene metas y sueños, lo de él está muy enfocado en su actividad y es que quiere tener una finca, no solo destacarse como agricultor, sino tener animales que le ayuden a masificar sus ingresos para dejarle un buen legado a sus muchachos.

Solicita un pequeño monto de capital para comprar insumos agrícolas, como, abonos, riegos, pesticidas, fungicidas, insecticidas, insumos que tiene un precio elevado que en el momento no puede cubrir y son indispensables para el mantenimiento de sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Wilson is a man of 41 years of age. He lives in a rural part of Abejorra with his partner and their two children, one 15 and the other 14.

He works at his business 10 hours, 6 days a week. He inherited his crops from his parents and hopes to leave it to his son so the noble family tradition of farming can continue. 

Like every man, Wilson has goals and dreams, which he keeps in mind as he works. His goal is to have a farm, not only to establish himself as a farmer, but also to have animals that will help increase his income so that he can leave a good legacy for his sons. 

He's requesting a small amount of money to buy agricultural supplies, such as fertilizer, irrigation, pesticide, fungicide, and insecticide; supplies that have a high price which, at the moment, he cannot pay and which are essential for maintaining his land.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, such as fertilizer, irrigation, pesticide, fungicide, and insecticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es:
Con el ánimo de salir adelante, de cambiar su futuro la señora Luz Mary inicio con su negocio de cría de cerdos, negocio que adopto por necesidad económica, pues buscaba generar recursos para alimentarse.

Luz Mary es una zona muy afectaba por la pobreza, por la desigualdad, donde hay problemas de orden público, pero ella con su negocio trata de salir adelante y ser un ejemplo para su comunidad, busca en parte incentivar el emprendimiento para todos su vecinos cambien la cara de Sincelejo.

Para apoyar su labor tiene como aliado a Interactuar que está dispuesto a ayudarla a cumplir sus sueños, por ello confió en su labor y está dispuesto a desembolsar un préstamo que usara para la compra de cerdos y Luz Mary quiere que toda la comunidad Kiva apoye su negocio y evidencie las ganas que tiene está comunidad por cambiar y ser un ejemplo
texts.en:
With the desire of getting ahead, of changing her future, Luz Mary began her pig breeding business. She adopted this business for economic necessity searching for resources to feed herself.

Luz Mary is in an area affected by poverty, by inequality, where there are problems of public disorder. But she tries to move her business ahead and be an example for her community. She does her part to encourage entrepreneurship for all her neighbors to change the face of Sincelejo.

Supporting her work, she has as an ally Interactuar who is willing to help her fulfill her dreams, trusted in her work and is willing to disburse a loan to be used to buy pigs. Luz Mary hopes that all the Kiva community supports her business evidencing the desire she has for this community for change and to be an example.

loans.use: to buy pigs and Luz Mary hopes that all the Kiva community supports her business evidencing the desire she has for this community for change and to be an example.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en:
Ezra is a 35-year-old married man with five children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

Ezra owns a bar and does farming growing tea, which adds to his income. He is faced with the hardship of customers delaying payments to him, which lowers his profits. 

Ezra is accessing credit to expand his tea farming project. He is working very hard to make sure he will be able to construct rentals in the future.

loans.use: to expand his tea farming project.

loans.name: Soklay

texts.en:
Soklay is 30 years old, married with two small children and lives in a village in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She has cultivated vegetables to sell since 2005. Her husband is a 28-year-old construction worker and one of her two children attends school. Soklay and her husband make a daily income of $7(USD). 

She would like to make more income, therefore she is now requesting a Kiva loan through Kredit MFI and she will use it to buy piglets to fatten and buy construction materials to build a piggery. This loan will help her improve her family’s finances. In the future, she hopes to expand her piglet fattening, save money to build a new house and support her two children in earning higher education.

loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten and buy construction materials to build a piggery

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is aged 54 years, married to Thomas and supports four children. She has been raising livestock such as goats for the last two years and the business earns her 4,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month. 

Priscah has applied for her first loan of 25,000 (KES) from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so she can sell milk for extra income. She plans to use the profit to repay the loan and educate her children. Her hope is to expand her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a 60 years old, separated and has 2 children to provide for. To earn a living she engaged in a buy & sell of lumber. She buys lumber and sells it. She wants to give her family a good living so she decided to take a loan to buy more stocks of lumber so that she can sell more lumbers that will generate more income.

Anecita plan for the future to save money out from her business income to improve her family house.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of lumber for sell.

location.town: Happy Valley  Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Xienglaekhok Group

texts.en: Bounyame is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Bounyame and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Bounyame and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Bounyameand his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Bounyame and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more additional stocks for household goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pre-paid mobile load.

Chona dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel is a 39 years old, married and has two children to provide for. To earn a living and be able to help his wife, who is a teacher, in providing for  their children's needs, he engaged in a  buy and sell sand and gravel business. This business really helps them in their needs. He wants to increase his income so that he can give more for his family needs, so he decided to take a loan to buy more sand and gravel for sale The more he has stocks of sand and gravel, he is able to supply more to his customers that will result in a better income.

Arnel plans for the future to save money and sustain the educational needs of his children.

loans.use: To buy more sand and gravel for selling

loans.name: Cresi

texts.en:
Cresi is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 27,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional fish nets and gasoline for her fishing business.

Cresi has been in this business for five years, earning her income from buying and selling fish. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish nets and gasoline

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús tiene 25 años de edad, vive muy feliz en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos varones de 1 y 5 años de edad. Jesús se dedica a la comercialización de pan dulce como son las ricas quesadilla, marquesote y salpores de arroz, con su trabajo y esfuerzo logra sostener la economía de su hogar y suplir las necesidades de la misma. Jesús está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ladrillos, cemento, hierro, grava, arena ya que desea construir un cuarto dormitorio en el cual podrá brindarle  mayor protección y una mejor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Jesus is 25 years old, she lives happily in her own house together with her partner and their two sons of 1 and 5 years old. 

Jesus earns a living selling sweet breads such as tasty quesadillas, marquesote and rice salpores. With her work and effort she has been able to sustain her house economically and supply the necessities herself. 

Jesus is asking FUSAI for a loan in order to buy brick, cement, iron, gravel and sand as she wants to build a bedroom in which she will be able to offer better protection and more comfort to her family.

loans.use: to invest in bricks, cement, iron, gravel and sand to build a room

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is 32 years old and married with four children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy stock for her store like mineral water, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Janette has been in this business for two years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her general store

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es una mujer de 39 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 11 años y 2 hijas de 3 y 8 años, y su negocio es la confección de ropa deportiva.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, optimista, paciente, amable, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Manco kapac’ área central situada al este de la ciudad, reúne a gran parte de los edificios administrativos, comerciales y sedes de organizaciones sociales. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Maruja es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos; los 3 mayores estudian en la escuela y la menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de ropa deportiva; ella compra tela por cortes para la confección de buzos, chaquetas, shorts, etc., la venta la realiza por mayor en la feria ‘las mañaneras’ caracterizada por salir a vender de 6 a 9 de la mañana, “comencé trabajando en una empresa donde me pagan por mano de obra, luego conseguí un capital de trabajo para empezar a confeccionar ropa…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es las ventas son por mayor, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una máquina de coser overlock y dobladora industrial. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maruja solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser overlock y dobladora industrial para confeccionar ropa deportiva y venderla por mayor.
texts.en:
Maruja is a 39-year-old woman, single, who has 2 boys ages 6 and 11 and 2 girls ages 3 and 8, and her business is sewing athletic clothing.

She is a good mother, enterprising, optimistic, patient, loving, responsible, and hard-working. Her business is in the Manco Kapac zone, a central area located to the east of the city, where there are a lot of administrative and commercial buildings and headquarters for social organizations. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0-12 degrees centigrade. 

Maruja has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair she wears braided, is short, has a robust physique, her native language is Aymará which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does. She shares her life with her children, the three older ones go to school and the youngest isn't of school age yet. They live in their own room, built of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting and a wooden floor which has running water, electricity, domestic gas and sewer services. Her business is making athletic clothing. She purchases lengths of cloth to make track suits, jackets, shorts, etc. She sells them in bulk at the "Las Mañaneras" fair, characterized by going out to sell from 6 to 9 in the morning. "I began to work in a business where they paid me for my labor, later I got working capital to begin to sew clothing..." she says. The advantage of her business is the bulk sales, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase an overlock sewing machine and an industrial serger. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 6 years she has done this work. 

For these reasons, Maruja asks for a loan to purchase an overlock sewing machine and an industrial serger to make athletic clothing and sell it in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock sewing machine and industrial serger to make athletic clothing and sell it in bulk.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Luis de 33 años, reside en Cartagena de Indias en donde laboró por un tiempo como empleado de una venta de comidas rápidas, sin embargo su espíritu emprendedor le permitió iniciar su propio negocio, cuenta con un año y cinco meses de estar funcionando y ha logrado cautivar a los transeúntes del sector a quienes les brinda sus servicios de  martes  a domingo a partir de las 5 p.m. hasta la 1 p.m.  Su carta de comidas es bastante diversa; hamburguesas, perros calientes, pizzas y picadas, él prepara sus platillos con mucha dedicación y con ingredientes de calidad para garantizar un buen resultado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar harina, carnes, salsas, recipientes de icopor y bebidas. Su meta a futuro es comprar su casa y mantener surtido su negocio para poder responder a la demanda.
texts.en:
Luis is 33 years old, he lives in Cartagena de Indias where he worked for a while as a fast food employee. 

However his enterprising spirit allowed him to being his own business. He has now done this for 1 years and 5 months and has attracted passers by from the area to whom he has provided his services from Tuesday until Sunday from 5am until 1pm. 

His menu is quite diverse, hamburgers, hot dogs, pizzas, ground mince. He prepares his dishes with a lot of attention and with quality ingredients in order to guarantee a good result. 

At the moment he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan made by the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy flour, meats, sauces, polyester containers and drinks. His future goal is to buy a house and to maintain the supply of his business in order to respond to the demand.

loans.use: to buy flour, meats, sauces, polyester containers and drinks

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y con sus 2 hijos un niño de 2 años de edad y una niña de 7 años de edad en su humilde vivienda. El presta  sus servicios en una peluquería la cual está ubicada  en el municipio de su residencia lo cual gracias a sus ingresos le ha permitido sostener la economía de su hogar, además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa que se dedica a la venta de quesadillas y marquesote lo cual sale a ofrecer a sus vecinos por la tarde. Oscar está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: puertas, balcones, ladrillo para piso, cemento, arena y otros, ya que desea  terminar de realizar las mejoras a su vivienda lo antes posible y así poder brindarle a su familia mejor seguridad y protección.
texts.en:
Oscar is 29 years old and lives with his life partner and their two children, a 2-year-old boy and a 7-year-old girl in their humble house.

He works in a hair salon which is located in the municipality where he lives and which, thanks to his income, has permitted him to sustain the household economy. In addition, he has the support of his partner who works selling quesadillas and marquesote cake, which she goes out to sell to the neighbors in the afternoons. Oscar is asking FUSAI for a loan to purchase doors, window grilles, brick flooring, cement, sand, and more, since he wants to finish doing the improvements on his house as soon as possible and, so, to be able to offer his family better security and protection.

loans.use: to purchase doors, window grilles, brick flooring, cement, and sand to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: El Gran Progreso Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL GRAN PROGRESO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena ella es casada y tiene 42 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo ya que en su trabajo no les quisieron dar el permiso a la hora que se realizo la reunion.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The memebers belong to the communal bank 'El Gran Progreso', it is located in the Santa Ana district, belonging to La Convencion province in the Cusco department. 

The partner is Elena, she is 42 years old and is married with 3 children. She works in her own business cultivating fruits, from 6am until 5pm. Elena has a plot of land where she cultivates bananas, coffee, mandarins and orange. She has spent many years in the business and it is going well. Her dream is to be able to expand her plot of land for cultivation. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. 

The partners in the group photo took it after the meeting because they asked for permission for work reasons, given that in their work the didn't want to give them permission at the time of the meeting. The other members earns a living selling animals, an agriculture business, a grocery shop and business restaurant. 

The partner is grateful to those who make up a part of this dream, and promises to comply with the payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: The partner is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 50 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 30 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, generosa, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘alto lima’ un barrio alejado del centro de la ciudad, su desarrollo inminente impulsó a los vecinos a organizarse para hacer un pueblo emergente y con grandes perspectivas de desarrollo. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4 -15 grados centígrados.
Martha es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que se dedica al transporte, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida; ella prepara comida a diario para la hora de almuerzo, está la divide en varios platos; primero sirve la entrada (es una pequeña ensalada acompañada con pan), luego viene la sopa (puede ser de verduras, arroz, chuño, etc.), el plato principal generalmente es una porción de carne con arroz o fideo y ensalada, al último se sirve el postre que puede ser una fruta o gelatina, refresco, etc., “inicié mi negocio como ayudante de mis hermanas, luego me independicé y ahora cuento con mi propio restaurante de almuerzo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que alrededor del mismo se encuentran instituciones que son sus clientes diarios, la desventaja es la falta de capital para ampliar el menú de comida. Su sueño es poder realizar platos extras por la noche, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina espiadera de pollo para vender pollo al espiedo por las noches. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Martha solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina espiadera de pollo para vender pollo al espiedo por las noches.
texts.en:
Martha is a 50-year-old woman, single, who has a 30-year-old son and her business is selling food. 

She is a good mother, enterprising, patient, generous, reliable, responsible, and very hard-working. Her business is in the Alto Lima zone, a neighborhood far from the city center, whose imminent development pushed the neighbors to organize themselves to make an emerging town with great prospects of development. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day from 4-15 degrees centigrade.  

Martha has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair she wears braided, is short, has a robust physique, dresses traditionally (hat, shawl and pollera [traditional Andean skirt]), her native language is Aymará which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does. She shares her life with her son who works in transportation. They live in their own room built of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting and a wooden floor that has running water, electricity, domestic gas and sewer services. Her business is food sales. She prepares the food daily to serve at lunch time, and divides it into various dishes. First, she serves the appetizer (a small salad accompanied by bread), then comes the soup (it could be made of vegetables, rice, freeze-dried potatoes, etc.), the main dish generally is a portion of meat with rice or pasta and salad, and at the end she serves dessert which could be fruit or jello, a soft drink, etc. "I began my business as an assistant to my sisters, later I became independent and now I have my own lunch restaurant..." she says. The advantage of her business is that nearby there are institutions who are her daily customers, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to expand the menu of dishes. Her dream is to be able to make extra dishes at night. She wants to purchase a chicken roaster to sell roasted chicken at night. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 3 years she has been doing this work. 

For these reasons, Martha asks for a loan to purchase a chicken roaster to sell roasted chicken at night.

loans.use: to purchase a chicken roaster to sell roasted chicken at night.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Gilda has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Gilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net.

loans.name: Adriana Gabriela

texts.es: Adriana tiene 31 años, es casada y vive en la ciudad de México, es una persona muy activa y con un gran interés en superarse tanto personal como económicamente, es una mujer emprendedora que siempre ha querido trabajar por su cuenta. Desde hace algunos años su esposo y ella abrieron una tienda en línea de venta de ropa de hombre y mujer, accesorios y maquillaje. Ella pretende hacer crecer la tienda tanto como se pueda y de ser posible abrir nuevas sucursales. Su principal dificultad es que a veces sus proveedores no cumplen con la fecha de entregas de ropa, por esta razón ella solicita un préstamo de MXN 15,000 para poder comprar un plotter para recorte de vinil y así ella pueda fabricar sus propias prendas. Ella agradece mucho a todas las personas que la apoyaran con la adquisición del plotter y harán crecer su tienda.
texts.en: Adriana is 31 years old. She is married and lives in Mexico City. She is a very active person who is very interested in getting ahead personally and financially. She is an enterprising woman who has always wanted to work for herself. Several years ago, she and her husband opened a store online selling men's and women's clothing, accessories and makeup. She intends on growing the store as much as she can and if possible open new branches. Her main problem is that sometimes her suppliers don't deliver the clothes in time. That is why she is asking for a loan of  MXN 15,000 to cover the cost of buying a vinyl cutter so she can make her own clothes. She is very thankful to the people who have supported her with the acquisition of the cutter, they will make her store grow.

loans.use: to buy a vinyl cutter.

loans.name: Elsy Celina

texts.es: Elsy de 42 años de edad, habita en vivienda propia junto a sus hijos de 2, 16 y 18 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que se esfuerza mucho para brindar todo lo necesario a su familia, ya que posee un centro de ciber café y venta de productos escolares con el que ha logrado una gran cantidad de clientes en su comunidad que la conocen y recomiendan, además es miembro de la directiva comunal por lo que siempre está en busca de proyecto con los cuales mejorar y apoyar la calidad de vida en sus vecinos. Elsy anteriormente solicito un crédito para poder iniciar la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio pero debido a que el monto no le fue suficiente ella desea terminar de construir su cuarto de habitación en la que uno de sus hijos se independizará junto a su prometida, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: madera, clavos, arena, cemento, pintura etc., para terminar de construir el cuarto.
texts.en:
Elsy is 42 years old, and she lives in her own house along with her children, ages 2, 16 and 18. She is a woman who makes a great effort to provide her family with all of the necessities. She has a Cyber Cafe and also sells school supplies, and through this she has managed to get a large number of customers in her community that know her and recommend her. In addition, she is a member of the communal board and she is always is search of projects to improve and support the quality of life of her neighbors.

Elsy previously took out a loan to be able to begin construction on a bedroom. However, the loan wasn't sufficient, and she would like to finish the room which will be used by one of her children, along with his fiancé, to become independent. For this reason, she is requesting a loan with FUSAI to buy lumber, nails, sand, cement, paint, etc. to finish building the room.

loans.use: to buy lumber, nails, sand, cement, paint, etc to finishing building a room.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor de 41 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 23 años y 10 años de edad que son su mayor alegría. Víctor tiene una tienda de productos básicos  en su domicilio desde hace doce años y es con ello que ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y sostener la economía de su hogar. Víctor desea hacer mejoras en su vivienda haciendo un pequeño  muro de contención al frente de la vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillos, arena malla de alambre, cemento  y de esa forma dar una mejor presentación a su negocio, brindar mayor seguridad a su familia y  al mismo tiempo mejor su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Víctor, 41 years old, lives in his own house with his life partner and two children, ages 23 and 10, who are his greatest joy. Victor has had a store of basic products in his house for the past twelve years and it is with this that he has been able to get his family ahead and sustain the household economy. Victor wants to make improvements to the house, building a small retaining wall at the front of the house for which he is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in bricks, sand, wire mesh, cement, and in this way to give a better look to his business, offer more security to his family and at the same time to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in bricks, sand, wire mesh, and cement to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 39 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos y una nieta. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales desde hace diez años y además recibe la ayuda de su esposo quien aporta para los gastos del hogar, lo cual junto a sus ingresos por las ventas le permite llevar el sustento al hogar. Hilda solicito un crédito anteriormente el cual invirtió en la mejora del piso de una parte de su vivienda, por lo que no logro mejorar la parte del corredor, gracias a la buena experiencia anterior solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI que le permita invertir en: lamina, madera y ladrillo de piso para la ampliación del corredor de su vivienda y de esta manera dar una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Hilda is 39 years old and lives in her own house with her husband, their 5 children, and a granddaughter. She has worked making and selling tamales for the past ten years and in addition gets the help of her husband to contributes toward the household expenses, which along with her income from the sales, allows her to bring sustenance to her home. Hilda asked for a previous loan which she invested in improving the floor of a part of her house, but with which she didn't manage to improve the part of the outdoor walkway. Thanks to her good previous experience, she asks for another loan from FUSAI which allows her to invest in metal sheeting, wood and brick flooring to expand the outdoor walkway of her house and in this way give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, wood, and brick flooring to expand the outdoor walkway of her house.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Vuthy, 32 years old, is living in a community of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a mother of two children. To make a living and support her family, she opened a grocery store to serve people in her community. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day. So far, she has been in this career for five years.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Douglas Antonio

texts.es: Douglas tiene 28 años de edad, habita junto a sus padres  en su humilde vivienda que es acogedora. Él presta sus servicios de fontanería desde hace tres años lo que le ha permitido sostener la economía de su hogar y siempre apoyando a sus padres que son de avanzada edad.  Douglas está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: panel solar, ya que en su humilde vivienda no  se cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica por lo que el buscando dar a su familia una mejor condición de vida y al mismo tiempo proteger al medio ambiente, es por ello que ha decidido instalar el panel solar y de esta manera disfrutar los beneficios de la energía renovable y gozar de luz propia la cual en las noches le servirá de una gran ayuda.
texts.en: Douglas is 28 years old and lives in with his parents in their humble house which is inviting. He has worked in plumbing for the past three years which has allowed him to support the household economy and he is always helping his parents, who are older. Douglas is asking for a loan from FUSAI to purchase a solar panel since his humble house does not have electricity, so he is looking to give his family better living conditions and at the same time protect the environment. For this, he has decided to install the solar panel and in this way enjoy the benefits of renewable energy and enjoy the light itself which will be a great help at night.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a solar panel.

loans.name: La Amistad De Accopampa Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LA AMISTAD DE ACCOPAMPA,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quellouno,provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Evangelina tiene 50 años de edad tiene 05 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de frutas, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
Los socios en general agradecen en el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the LA AMISTAD DE ACCOPAMPA communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Quellouno, province of La Convención and department of Cuzco.

Evangelina is 50 years old. She has 5 children and is married. She alternates her daily activities with selling fruit. She has had this business for some time and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She wants to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family. 

She is asking for the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. The borrowers are thankful for the loan and committed to making their payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maristela

texts.en:
Maristela is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 34 years old, and her four children are in school.

Maristela has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Maristela has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rebecca is 45 years old now.

Rebecca has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more dried fish for her business.

Rebecca has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheet metal, nails, and poles to continue with the improvement of the roof and walls of her home.

loans.name: Banco Del Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Leonor ella es soltera y tiene 33 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su  negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maiz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios en este negocio y le va muy bien,la socia por medio de este pequeño negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de lavandería, negocio de internet, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Banco Del Desarrollo communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, which is part of Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Leonor, she is single and 33 years old and has 1 child. The member works at her business selling grains. She sells corn, wheat and quinoa. The member works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm, she has had this business for some years and it is going very well for her. The member, through this small business, wants to get ahead with her family. The member's dream is to have a retail space to sell the grains. The member asks for the loan to purchase wheat, corn, and quinoa. 

The other members work in a laundry business, an internet business, a grocery store business, and a restaurant.

The member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this platform and promises to make the payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Sokun, 59, lives in a community of Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has ten children, five are single and five are married. 

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland, which is located near her house. She has been in this type of business for twenty years. On average, Sokun is able to make an income of USD 7.00 a day. 

Sokun wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL (Hattha Kaksekar Limited) with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Jhean Carlos

texts.es:
Jhean Carlos es un joven de 19 años, vive junto a su madre en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados.
Jhean Carlos desde hace años atrás se ha dedicado a los negocios, aprendió desde joven ya que su padre también es comerciante. Actualmente se dedica al comercio de ganado, también vende cosméticos y suele trabajar como albañil. Es un joven muy dedicado a su trabajo ya que dice que hacer las cosas bien atrae cosas positivas, él siempre ha trabajado con mucho entusiasmo.
Jhean Carlos es cliente de Fundación Alternativa, este es su segundo crédito, con el primero pudo fortalecer su negocio de cosméticos, pudo aprovechar ofertas y crecer en el negocio. Ahora con este dinero podrá seguir comprando cosméticos en oferta ya que esta es una buena temporada comercial y necesita abastecerse de mercadería para sus ventas.
Agradece a la institución y a Kiva por permitir que jóvenes como él puedan salir adelante con sus negocios, gracias a los créditos y siendo bien invertidos un microempresario se siente feliz como él con el fortalecimiento de sus negocios.
texts.en:
Jhean Carlos is a 19-year-old young man, who lives with his mother in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados. 

For some years, Jhean Carlos has worked in businesses. He learned when he was young since his father is also a businessman. Currently he works selling livestock and he also sells cosmetics and tends to work as a construction worker. He is a young man who is very dedicated to his work since he says that to do things well attracts positive things. He has always worked with a lot of enthusiasm. 

Jhean Carlos is a client of Fundación Alternativa. This is his second loan, with the first he was able to strengthen his cosmetics business, he could take advantage of sales and grow his business. Now, with this money, he will be able to continue purchasing cosmetics on sale since this is a good commercial season and he needs to stock up his merchandise for his sales.

He is grateful to the institution and to Kiva for allowing young people like him to be able to get ahead with their businesses, thanks to the loans and, being well invested, a micro-entrepreneur is happy as he is with the strengthening of their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics on sale and be able to increase his earnings, in this way to continue growing has a micro-entrepreneur and support his mother.

loans.name: Jessan Philip

texts.en:
Jessan Philip is a 26 years old and single. To earn a living and be able to help his parents, he engaged in a swine fattening business. He raises pigs and sells them to the market. He wants to give his parents support for medicine maintenance.

He decided to borrow a loan to buy feed for the pigs so that he can produce a good quality of pigs and be able to sell more pigs in the market.

Jessan Philip’s plan for the future is to save money for his coming preparation for starting a family.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs.

location.town: Lower Usogan, Tambulig, Zambo. Del sur

loans.name: Nalay Group

texts.en: Hom and his fellow group members live in a village that sources much of its drinking water from local wells, streams and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment. Hom and his group are excited that they have been able to buy a water filter on a payment plan that has made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now they can use for other pursuits.  Hom and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families' health and budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years and within this time, filter users, like Hom’s family, will enjoy a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to buy a water filter

loans.name: Virgen Natividad De Lares Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD DE LARES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Lares, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ilaria ella es soltera y tiene 64 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas y tambien la socia se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como pavos y gallinas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos, cafe, mandarinas y naranjas,la socia por medio de este ngeocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabjao.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Virgen Natividad de Lares communal bank. This bank is located in Lares district, which is part of Calca province in Cusco department.

The member is Ilaria, she is single and is 64 years old and has 4 children. The member works in her business growing fruits and also she works in her business raising animals such as turkeys and chickens. The member has a plot of land where she grows bananas, coffee, mandarins and oranges. The member, though this business, wants to get her family ahead. She works from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm. She has had this business for a number of years and it is going very well for her. The member's dream is to expand her cultivated land. She asks for the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

The member who is attached to the group photo took the photo after the meeting because she asked permission due to work.

The other members work at an animal sales business, a clothing sales business, a grocery store business, and a food sales business. 

The member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this platform and promises to make the payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a 33-year-old mother of two children. She works in vegetable farming to earn a living. She plants vegetables and sells them to the market. 

Jovelyn aims to increase her income so that she can provide for her children's needs. To achieve this, she decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm so that she will be able to produce good quality vegetables. Then, she can sell more vegetables in the market and generate a better income.

Jovelyn's plan for the future is to save money from her business income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Jose Hernan

texts.es: José, tiene 30 años de edad, esta casado, tiene un hijo y reside en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Tela, Atlántida, colinda con el Progreso, Yoro. José siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura con el cultivo de maíz y frijoles y palma africana desde hace 15 años. La producción de fruta de palma africana la vende en las plantas aceiteras de la zona. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 25,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos y fertilizantes y para limpieza del  cultivo de palma africana con el fin de mejorar la producción y vender mejor fruta. Su meta es seguir trabajando con su cultivo y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.
texts.en: José is 30 years old, married, has one child, and lives in a village which is part of the municipality of Tela, Atlántida, adjoining Progreso, Yoro. José has always worked in agriculture with crops of corn and beans and African palm for the past 15 years. The production of the fruit of the African palm he sells to the oil factories in the zone. He is asking for a loan of 25,000 lempiras to purchase manure and fertilizers and to clean his crop of African palm with the end of improving the production and selling better fruit. His goal is to continue working with his crops and cover his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, and cleaning for his African palm crop.

loans.name: Rosmiry

texts.en:
Rosmiry is 35 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. Rosmiry works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, milk, spices, soft drinks, etc.

Rosmiry has been in this business for nine years.

In the future, Rosmiry would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, milk, spices, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets so that all of his family can work and increase their income.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery continúa con su negocio de venta de comida. El préstamo que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de mesas y sillas para ampliar su negocio. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo ningún problema. Actualmente sus comidas más populares son; el plato Paceño, el Chairo, el fricasé, la picana y otros, “continúo con mi negocio de comida, mis clientes cada día son más numerosos, no tengo un refrigerador donde almacenar la carne y necesito continuar con la ampliación…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una cocina nueva y un refrigerador donde conservar la carne. Su sueño es continuar trabajando para no ser una carga para su familia, ella desea realizar la compra de una cocina nueva y un refrigerador donde conservar la carne. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosmery solicita un préstamo para la compra de una cocina nueva y un refrigerador para continuar con su negocio y no ser una carga para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosemary continues with her business of selling food. She invested the loan that she got in the purchase of tables and chairs to expand her business. Her payments were punctual because she did not have any problem.

Currently her most popular foods are 'Paceño' [a typical dish in La Paz], 'Chairo' [a typical stew], fricassee, 'picana' [a stew with different meats and vegetables], and others. "I continued with my food business, and I get more customers every day. I do not have a refrigerator where I can store the meat, and I need to continue with the expansion," she says.

The advantage of her business is that she makes daily sales. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy a new stove and a refrigerator to store the meat. This is the third loan cycle with the institution during the three years that she has been engaged in this business activity.

It is for these reasons that Rosmery requests a loan to buy a new stove and refrigerator in order to continue with her business and not be a burden to her family.

loans.use: to buy a new stove and a refrigerator in order to continue with her business and not be a burden to her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish, such as yellow mottled fish, sardines, etc., in larger quantity.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 50 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Rosalie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as chips, milk, canned goods, eggs, spices, etc.

Rosalie has been in this business for six years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as chips, milk, canned goods, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 51 years old and married with ten children. With three children in school, Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as condiments, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Teresa has been in this business for 25 years.

In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as condiments, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 42-year-old married woman. She has four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Virginia has a buy-and-sell eggs business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation) to buy more eggs to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Lyna

texts.en:
Lyna is 36 years old, married and has three children. To earn a living, she engages in a rice production business.

She aims to increase her income because of the increasing demands of her children. She decided to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for the rice farm so that she can produce good quality rice and sell rice in the market and also supply rice for her customers that will generate better income.

Lyna's plan for the future is to save money to improve their living conditions.

English

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the rice farm.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 24 years old and married with one child in school. Ruby works very hard to provide for them.

Ruby runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation) to buy items to sell like candies, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Ruby has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Ruby would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like candies, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old, and her three children are in school.

Julieta has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Julieta has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 53 years old, married and has five children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Carmen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

Carmen has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Carmen would like to save enough money for family home repair and business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Yerlis Arleth

texts.es: Yerlis es una creativa y decidida Cartagenera que inició su almacén de variedades hace 10 años, después de atravesar una situación sentimental difícil, ella necesitaba generar ingresos para su familia y consideró que al comercializar artículos de papelería como cuadernos, colores, lápices, fólderes entre otros, a sus vecinos y transeúntes del sector, le permitiría manejar una buena utilidad para solventar sus gastos.  Hoy en día  tiene la satisfacción de haberles ofrecido bienestar a sus tres hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad y continúa con grandes propósitos en su negocio,  ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para surtir con cuadernos, lápices, colores, y demás.  Aunque existe mucha competencia en el sector, ella continúa ofreciendo un buen servicio, precios de oportunidad y calidad en sus productos.  Su meta a largo plazo es surtirlo más y vender más.
texts.en:
Yerlis is a creative and dedicated woman from Cartagena. She started her warehouse selling a variety of things 10 years ago, after going through a difficult emotional situation. She needed to earn income for her family, and she thought that to sell stationary shop items such as notebooks, colors, pencils, and folders among other things to her neighbors and passersby of the area would enable her to make a good profit and take care of their expenses. Today, she has the satisfaction of having provided well-being to her three children who are now older. She continues to have big ideas for her work.

Yerlis is applying for a credikiva, her first financing with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to stock her store with notebooks, pencils, colors, and more. Although there is a lot of competition in the area, she continues to offer a good service, good prices, and quality products. Her long-term goal is to stock more items and sell more.

loans.use: to stock her store with notebooks, pencils, colors, and more.

loans.name: Lot's Group

texts.en:
Lot, 60, is a farmer living in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province and a married mother of five children.

She has been growing rice as the main source of income for 28 years. She also drives a motor-taxi, an additional business that earns her extra income to better support her family. She can manage to earn about 32,500 KHR per day.

She is facing a challenge in her farming business, which is lacking of capital to buy organic fertilizers and pay plowing fees. Therefore, Lot is leading a two-member group to take out a new loan to save her business. This client has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for five cycles already, and this will be her sixth loan. The previous loan helped her to provide her family members with enough healthy food and improve their living standard.

She will use the new loan to pay for plowing fees and buy organic fertilizers to enhance productivity. She hopes to earn more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and buy organic fertilizers to enhance productivity.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for four years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old, and two of her children are in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 52 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

Lucita has been in this business for 17 years.

In the future, Lucita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Srey Neang's Group

texts.en:
Srey Neang is 31 years old and a married mother of three children. Two of them are in school while the other one is too young to attend school.

She is a cassava farmer, living in Kampong Cham province, and she has been involved in her business for one year already. Drought is the main challenge for her in growing cassava for sale and it can cut down her crop yields.

The grocery store is an additional source of her family’s income to help meet her family’s needs.

Due to lack of funds to support both businesses, she is now leading a group of three to apply for a new loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and fertilizer and to buy more grocery items to generate income to support her family’s living.

For Srey Neang, this is the fifth loan cycle, and those previous loans helped her to improve her living standards and send her children to school. Srey Neang is hopeful that with this new loan she can earn more income and expand her current businesses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to buy more grocery items to generate income to support her family.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en:
Teofilo is 54 years old, married and has two children.

To earn a living, he is engaged in a buy and sell coco lumber business. His wife, a farmer, helps in providing his children's needs.

He wants to increase his income, so he decided to borrow a loan to buy more coconut lumber for sale so that he can sell more lumber in the market and supply his customers enough for their orders.

Teofilo's plan for the future is to use his income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more coconut lumber to sell.

loans.name: Chanthol's Group

texts.en:
Chanthol is a 52-year-old mother of one child. She has been a rice farmer for more than five years. She lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. 

To earn additional income to support her family, she goes to harvest on her co-villager’s farm for a fee. Rice drought is the main challenge for her in her farming business because she grows rice crops dependent on the rain. 

Chanthol has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for one cycle already and has paid back the loan in full. The past loan helped her to have a better living standard. 

Due to not having enough funds to do the farming for this season, she is now leading a group to take a new Kiva loan. She will use her loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer to increase crop productivity. She hopes to earn more income so that she can buy a motorbike to drive her from home to her rice fields, which will enable her to save the cost of transportation.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to increase crop productivity.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 39 years old, married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Elisa has been farming rice for six years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Elisa requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for farmland preparation.

In the future, Elisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for farmland preparation.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 36 years old and single.  

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Josefa requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Josefa has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josefa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Lalyn

texts.en:
Lalyn is 24 years old and has one child.

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lalyn has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 64 years old and married. She has five children. Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, salt, candies, coffee, and other groceries.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, condiments, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Angeline has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation) to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Angeline has been in this business for two years. In the future, Angeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Kim Pov's Group

texts.en:
Kim Pov is 40 years old and a mother of two children, living in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.
