Growing rice and harvesting on her co-villager’s farm have been the sources of her family’s income for twenty-two years. Rice drought is an obstacle for her farming business, which reduces her income. 

Kim Pov does not have enough funds to do the farming for this season, so she decided to lead a group to seek a new Kiva loan via VisionFund. She will use her loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow her rice crops. This is the second loan cycle for Kim Pov. The past loan helped her to upgrade her family’s standard of living. 

She hopes that this new loan will help her generate more income and enable her to buy a motorbike to drive her to her farmland, which will save her time. She can then grow vegetables around her house for her family’s consumption.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow her rice crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es: José es un carismático vendedor de pescado que recorre las calles de los barrios del municipio de  Soledad, ofreciendo una gran diversidad de especies de peces aptos para su consumo humano, cuenta con 13 años de funcionamiento pero una experiencia que data desde su juventud, cuando empezó a trabajar con su padre en esta misma actividad.  Todos los días  sale a realizar ventas en la madrugada y ofrece filete de sierra, mojarra, bocachico, jurel  y corvinas frescas, que entrega a sus clientes listas para preparar en sus comidas.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para incrementar las compras de pescado y poder conseguir mejores precios. Su meta a futuro es incrementar sus ventas para ofrecerle a su cónyuge una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José is a charismatic fish seller who walks the streets of the neighborhoods in the city of Soledad, offering a great diversity of fish species good for human consumption.  He has 13 years of operating this business but experience that dates back to his youth, when he began working with his father at the same trade.  Everyday, he leaves to make his sales early in the morning and he offers fresh swordfish, bream, bass, mackeral, and sea bass, that he delivers to his customers ready to be prepared in their meals.  Currently, he is requesting a Kiva loan and his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to increase his purchases of fish so that he can get better prices.  His future goal is to increase his sales to offer his wife a better quality of life.

loans.use: to increase his purchases of fish so that he can get better prices.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy is a 50-year-old mother of three children and lives in a community of Takeo Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in his type of business for around thirty years. On average, she is able to make an income of 4.00 USD a day.
She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a one. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Handira

texts.en:
Handira is 60 years old, married, and has four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. Handira has been in this business for four years.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Glee

texts.en:
Glee is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Glee requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Glee has been in this business for 23 years now.

In the future, Glee would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Khan's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Sangke district of Battambang province, Khan, 55, is a married mother of eight children, four of whom are dependent on her.

She has been growing cassava as the main source of her family’s income and she has been in her job for 12 years. This year, she cannot earn good income to support her family because the cassava could not produce good outputs for her.

Now Khan is leading a group of two to get a new loan. This is the sixth cycle for her. Her past loan was repaid completely and it has enabled her to improve her living standards.

This time, she will use her loan to pay the plowing fee and to buy organic fertilizers to support the cassava farm. She hopes to earn more income to expand her business by increasing the crop products so that she can earn more income to update her living standards.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fee and to buy organic fertilizers to support the cassava farm.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 55 years old and married. She has ten children, two of whom are in school. Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, dishwashing liquid, soap, dried fish, candies, snack foods and other groceries.

Lourdes requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest of Cambodia. She is 23 years old. She lives in a wooden house with her parents and her young brother. Her family owns 1.5 hectares of cassava fields.

She just came back from Thailand and decided to weave with her parents because she divorced her husband after three years of marriage. In 2015, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise that fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in their villages.

Sophy makes scarves that are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the family's expenses Thanks to the loan, she will buy silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom.

Please support her so she can keep making beautiful, traditional, hand-woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay fees related to loom preparation.

loans.name: Yenis Del Carmen

texts.es: Yenis se ha dedicado por muchos años a la venta mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos, a través de los cuales promueve los artículos de su oferta; esta carismática mujer recibió la propuesta de incorporarse a esta modalidad de comercialización, por medio de una visita que recibió en su domicilio y que le permitió cambiar su estilo de vida, dejando de ser empleada doméstica para convertirse en una empresaria independiente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará artículos del catálogo; cremas corporales, maquillajes, perfumes y demás encargos que le realizaron sus clientes.  Con esta inversión generará un mayor volumen de ventas, pues sus inventarios están a la medida de las solicitudes de compras.  Su meta a futuro es tener más surtido su negocio y ver a sus dos hijos con casa propia.
texts.en:
Yenis has made a living for many years selling products through specialist guides or catologues, which promote the items she offers. This charismatic woman received the proposal to join this marketing business when she had a visit to her home; this allowed her to change her lifestyle, leaving her job as a domestic worker and becoming an independent businesswoman. 

She is currently applying for a loan through Kiva, her first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy items from the catalogue: body lotions, make-up, perfumes and other items ordered by her customers. With this investment she will generate a higher volume of sales as her inventories are in proportion to her purchase requests. Her goal for the future is to have her business well stocked, and see her two children have their own home.

loans.use: to buy items from the catalogue: body lotions, make-up, perfumes and other items ordered by her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase hair products that she needs to perform her work.

loans.name: Herbert Eulices

texts.es: Herbert, tiene 38 años de edad, esta soltero, vive junto a sus padres en el municipio del Progreso, Yoro. El siempre ha trabajado en su propio negocio de barbería prestando el servicio de corte de cabello para caballeros y niños, este negocio lo estableció hace dos años en su comunidad, anteriormente lo tenia en otro país. Solicita un prestamo por 7,000 lempiras para pago de permiso e impuesto municipal del negocio. Su plan es poder establecer otra barbería en otro lugar.
texts.en:
Herbert is 38, single, and lives with his parents in the municipality of Progreso, Yoro. He has always worked in his own barber business, offering hair cutting services for men and children. He established his business two years ago in his community, and before he had the business in another country.
He is requesting a loan of 7,000 lempiras to pay the permit and municipal tax for his business. His plan is to establish another barber shop in another place.

loans.use: to pay the permit and municipal tax for his business.

loans.name: Victor Vicente

texts.es:
Víctor es un señor de 65 años, vive junto a su esposa en casa propia en la ciudad de Santo Domingo., tienen  tres hijos pero ya son profesionales y mayores de edad.
Víctor y su esposa trabajan juntos en el centro de la ciudad, cuentan con un estudio fotográfico ya varios años, son muy conocidos por la calidad de  servicio que prestan. Cuando comenzaron con esta profesión solo recorrían ofreciendo sus servicios fotográficos ambulantes, ahora ya tienen un local donde dan mejor atención y lo han logrado con la constancia y el entusiasmo que ellos siempre le han puesto a su negocio. 
Víctor es cliente nuevo para la institución, con este crédito él podrá comprar una impresora fotográfica más grande y va a adecuar su local ya que necesita hacer varios cambios.
Ambos están felices, agradece a kiva y a la institución porque podrán seguir mejorando con su servicio y  mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Víctor is a 65-year-old man. He lives with his wife in their own home in the city of Santo Domingo. They have three children who are grown and professionals now.
Victor and his wife work together in the city centre. They have had a photography studio for several years now. They are well-known for the quality service that they provide. When they started this work, they did not have a fixed location. They now have a storefront where they can provide better service. Through the constancy and enthusiasm they have always put into their business, they have succeeded.
Victor is a new client of the institution. With this loan he will be able to buy a larger photo printer and improve his location; they need to make some changes.
They are both happy people. They thank Kiva and the institution because they will be able to continue with their service and improve their business.

loans.use: to buy a photo printer and to improve his stall.

loans.name: Buenafe

texts.en:
Buenafe is 61 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, egg, milk, noodles, spices, etc.

Buenafe has been in this business for 2 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, egg, milk, noodles, spices, etc

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth pertenece al banco comunal “Patron de San Sebastian” .
La socia sigue vendiendo diferentes tipos de productos como jaboncillos, pasadores, cremas, cuerdas, lana y otras cosas más, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota,la socia es una persona responsable  y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de cremas entre otros.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Patron de San Sebastian”. She continues to sell different types of products such as soap bars, hairpins, crèmes, string, wool, and other items. Elizabeth is grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments. She is a responsible and industrious person who works in this manner so that her family can get ahead.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan in order to buy crèmes and other products.

loans.use: to buy crèmes and other products.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 57 years old, married and has eight children to provide for. To earn a living and be able to help to help her husband in providing for her children's needs, she engaged in a rice production business. 

She aims to increase her income because of the increasing demand of the family. She decided to borrow a loan to purchase fertilizer for the rice field so she can produce a good quality of rice and be able to sell a lot of rice in the market.

Alicia's plan for the future is to save money to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa mastered the hog raising business 20 years ago. She is 68 years old, and separated from her husband but most of her children lives with her. Rosa lives in Mangidkid, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is as enthusiastic about taking care of her business as she is about her membership to the cooperative. She has availed another loan, this time to buy bags of animal feed and vitamins. In the future she wants to build concrete pig pens.

loans.use: to buy bags of animal feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 67 years old and married with nine children of adult age. She hails from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental.

She has been running a sari-sari store (convenience store) for more than 10 years. Fatima ventured into this type of retailing business because it is easy to sell her products.

Recently, she availed herself of a loan of PHP 30,000.00 to restock her store with canned goods, oil, soy sauce and other consumable items.

Fatima is looking forward to repaying her loan on time so that she can maintain her good record of no default payments.

loans.use: to restock her store with canned goods, oil, soy sauce and other consumable items

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional equipment and materials like chairs, hair dryer, etc. for her beauty parlor business.

Cristy has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from prepaid mobile load.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and materials like chairs, hair dryer, etc.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a photo copy business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy xerox machine ink and an additional photo copier machine.

Emelyn has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy xerox machine ink and an additional photo copier machine

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling vegetables.

Marife dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 49 years old, married and has five children to provide for. To earn a living he engages in cassava production. 

He wants to give his family a good living, so he decided to borrow a loan to purchase fertilizer for his cassava farm so that he can produce a good quality of cassava and can sell more cassava in the market that will generate more income.

Antonio's plan for the future is to save money from his business income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his cassava farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a washable toilet, sheets of laminate, cement, sand, gravel, etc., in order to construct a bathroom as soon as possible.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Irene is 33 years old and has four children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing materials like gasoline, fishing net, bamboo, etc.

Irene has been in this business for four years. In the future, Irene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like gasoline, fishing net, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Niña

texts.en:
Niña is a married woman and 21 years old. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Niña has a fishing business in the Philippines. Niña requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishnets, bamboo, and other materials needed.

Niña has been in this business for one year. In the future, Niña would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishnets, bamboo, and other materials needed.

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Noeme is 26 years old and has one child in school.

Noeme has a buying and selling of fish business in the Philippines. Noeme requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Noeme has been in this business for five years. In the future, Noeme would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl works hard to support her family. Sheryl is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested an PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials like wood, bamboo, paints, etc., for the repair of her fishing boat.

Sheryl has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Sheryl would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wood, bamboo, paints, etc., for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Ida

texts.en:
Ida is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ida is 53 years old now.

Ida has a rice-vending business in the Philippines. Ida requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Ida has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Ida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with five children. She is 44 years old and all five of her children are in school.

Cristina is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a married woman with four children. She is 26 years old and two of her children are in school.

Daisy is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. 

Daisy has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy pipes, paint, cement, and rebar.

loans.name: Sokhen

texts.en:
Sokhen, 38, lives in a small community of Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia. She is a mother of four single children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business, grows rice and sells her agricultural products to the local dealers. Apart from the agricultural business, she makes Khmer Noodles for sale. On average, she can make an income of USD $5.00 per day.

She is facing a challenge with the water utilization. Therefore, she would like to request a Kiva loan to buy a water pump for household use. With the support from this loan, she hopes it will bring a convenient way for her family members to access water. 

She is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a water pump

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more yellow mottled fish for her husband to sell at the market.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 41 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Perla works very hard to provide for them.

Perla runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like firewood, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Perla has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Perla would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like firewood, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle works hard to support her family. She is married and buys and sells mangoes in the Philippines. Anabelle has been in this business for eight years now.

Anabelle requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional baskets of mangoes to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional baskets of mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Floren

texts.en:
Floren is 42 years old and married.

She is in the agricultural business of banana farming in the Philippines. Floren requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Floren has been banana farming for six years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Floren would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rotisa

texts.en:
Rotisa is 31 years old and has one child. Rotisa is married and has one child in school.

Rotisa is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Rotisa requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rotisa has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rotisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. Rebecca is married and has a farming of vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rebecca has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in metal sheets, nails, and wood for building a kitchen.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a 53-year-old married woman with four children. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines.

Josefina requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Josefina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Fortunata is 44 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Fortunata has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Fortunata requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Fortunata has been in this business for four years. In the future, Fortunata would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ceryl

texts.en:
Ceryl is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ceryl has a buying and selling of dried fish business in the Philippines. Ceryl requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Ceryl has been in this business for one year. In the future, Ceryl would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a 67-year-old widow with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Angela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years, and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Genda

texts.en:
Genda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Genda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for four years now.
 
Genda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent a place to sell chickens.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with five children. Gina is 39 years old and two of her children are in school.

Gina is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Gina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a married woman with three children. She is 39 years old and one of her children is in school.

Glenda is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She buys and sells dried fish business in the Philippines, and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Glenda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 42 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Evelyn buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines, and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She has been running her charcoal business for 14 years, and also earns an income from a general store. 

Evelyn borrowed and repaid 38 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct selling of personal collection products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more products from the personal collection to sell.

Jennelyn has been in this business for five years. Jennelyn earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

Jennelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more products from the personal collection to sell

loans.name: Karen Catrina

texts.en:
Karen Catrina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Karen Catrina is 21 years old now.

Karen Catrina has a buying and selling of dried fish business in the Philippines. Karen Catrina requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Karen Catrina has been in this business for two years. In the future, Karen Catrina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Noralma

texts.es:
La Sra. Noralma una mujer de 35 años de edad ella es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos el primero tiene 18 años el cual ya trabaja y estudia por su cuenta ,el segundo de 7 años y el tercero de 3 meses. 
La Sra. Noralma es una mujer humilde y trabajadora la cual día a día lucha y se esfuerza mucho para darles los mejor  a sus hijos, ella trabaja un promedio de 9 horas diarias los días viernes, sábado y domingo en su kiosko en la actividad de venta de pinchos y comidas varias, este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia.
En su vida ha tenido muchos obstáculos pero el mas fuerte fue la mala relación que llevo con su esposo lo cual los llevo a la separación, desde ese momento tuvo que trabajar mucho  para salir adelante con sus hijos por lo que no tiene mucho tiempo libre, pero la Sra. Noralma cada que puede y le queda tiempo aprovecha para pasar buenos momento con sus hijos. 
La Sra. Noralma tiene muchos sueños futuros y uno de ellos ya se está cumpliendo el cual es construir su propia casa en la misma ya se encuentra habitándola, este préstamo ayudara a Noralma a mejorar su calidad vida ya que lo invertirá en la construcción de chancheras  para tener cerdas madres  y vender sus crías, agradece a Fundación Alternativa por la ayuda y la oportunidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Noralma is a 35 year old single mother. She has three children, the first is 18 years old and works, the second is 7 and the third is 3 months old.

Noralma is a humble and hard-working woman who day by day struggles and makes a great effort to provide the best for her children. She works an average of 9 hours per day on Friday, Saturday and Sunday in her kiosk with her business of selling snacks and a variety of food. She learned this business on her own.

She has had many obstacles in her life but the hardest one was the poor relationship she had with her husband which led them to separate. Since this time she has had to work very hard to raise her children so she has not had much spare time. But Noralma takes advantage of every opportunity she has the time to spend some quality time with her children.

Noralma has many future dreams and one of them is fulfilled which is to have her own house, which they are already living in. This loan will help Noralma improve her quality of living as it will be invested in pigpens to raise sows and sell the piglets. She is grateful to Fundación Alternativa for the help and the opportunity to improve her quality of living and that of her children.

loans.use: to construct a pigpen to raise sows and in this way boost her children's education and quality of living.

loans.name: Almirys Paola

texts.es: Almirys con apenas 19 años de edad es propietaria de un salón de belleza, esta idea de negocio nació por su mamá quien tenía una distribuidora de productos de belleza  y decidió abrir una sala de belleza,  pero en vista de no poder administrar estos dos negocios le cedió a su hija este último.  Hoy en día Almirys tiene dos años de experiencia y una clientela fidelizada por sus excelentes servicios; corte de cabello, cepillado, tintes, desrizado, iluminaciones, queratinas y demás. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para mejorar la imagen del negocio al exhibir un nuevo aviso luminoso, publicidad y surtido de productos capilares. Esta inversión permitirá ser más llamativo al público su salón de belleza e incrementar la afluencia de clientes.   Su meta a futuro es ingresar a la universidad y continuar siendo una empresaria independiente.
texts.en:
Almirys, at only 19 years of age, is the owner of a beauty salon.  Her mother, who is a beauty supply distributor, came up with the idea for this business, and decided to open a beauty salon.  However, seeing that she could not manage both businesses, she left this one to her daughter to run.  Today Almirys has 2 years of experience and has a loyal clientele as a result of her excellent services.  She offers haircuts, hair styling, coloring, hair straightening, highlights, keratin treatments, and other services.  

At this time, Almirys is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the funds to improve the appearance of her business, install a lighted sign, pay for publicity, and stock up on hair care products.  This investment make her business more appealing to the public and will increase the inflow of customers into the business.  In the future, Almirys wants to enroll in a university and continue being an independent businesswoman.

loans.use: to make improvements to her beauty salon and stock up on hair care products

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 60 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Mary Jane has been in this business for ten years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more fish

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 66 years old, married and has four children. He wanted to earn an income for his family so he engaged in cassava production and also to utilize his land to become productive. 

He aims for a better income so that he can sustain providing for his children's needs so he borrowed a loan to purchase fertilizer for the cassava farm so that he can produce a good quality of cassava, be able to supply his customers and generate more income.

Benjamin's plan for the future is to save money to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the cassava farm.

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
Cesaria works hard to support her family. Cesaria is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Cesaria requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food-production business.

Cesaria has been in this business for eight years now.

Cesaria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Rosa Miriam

texts.es: Rosa tiene 26 años de edad, es una joven que siempre demuestra su espíritu de superación y habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos pequeños hijos de 9 años y 8 meses de edad, al cual al mayor de los dos está apoyando en sus estudios ya que quiere que en un futuro sea una  gran persona en la vida. Rosa se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos actividad que realiza desde hace un tiempo y le permite mantener a su familia y estar pendiente de sus hijos, el compañero de vida le aporta para los gastos del hogar y así logra mantener la economía del hogar. Rosa desea comprar más pollos para aumentar su producción y seguir creciendo con su negocio, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, concentrado y vitaminas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 26 years old. She is a youth who has always shown her spirit to excel. She lives in her own house with her life companion and her two small children, one aged 9 years and the other 8 months old. She is supporting the oldest in his studies as she wants him to become a good person in his life.

Rosa works raising and selling chickens, a business she has done for some time as it allows her to support her family and take care of her children. Her life companion helps her with the household expenses and in this way she supports the household finances.

Rosa wants to buy more chickens to increase her production and continue to expand her business. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in chickens, concentrated feed and vitamins.

loans.use: to invest in chickens, concentrated feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, and other supplies for making meals.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos un Cantón muy turístico, muchos turistas Nacionales y extranjeros visitan este Cantón por su maravillosas cascadas una de ella es la cascada del amor a la cual hoy en día podemos llegar muy rápido por el teleférico que está construido junto a esta cascada.
En este Cantón vive y trabaja la señorita María José una joven de 23 años ella es soltera no tiene hijos vive en casa de sus padres pero también aporta económicamente porque sabe que el sueldo que gana su padre como chofer de una wincha no alcanza para cubrir las necesidades de casa.
María José se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos listos para faenar a esta actividad le dedica un promedio de 3 horas diarias, aprendió este negocio por iniciativa propia pero su Padre es quien le apoya constantemente para que salga adelante; solicita el crédito para comprar más cerditos. 
Tiene muchos sueños que quisiera realizar uno de ellos es culminar sus estudios secundarios que por falta de recursos económicos no los ha podido culminar.
María José agradece a Kiva por la oportunidad brindada para poder emprender en su propio negocio.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is a heavy tourist canton (Ecuadorian state). Many domestic and foreign tourists visit this canton because of its wonderful waterfalls. One of them is the waterfall of love which these days you can reach very quickly by the cable car built next to it. 

María José lives and works in this canton. She’s a young 23 year old woman who is single and has no children. She lives with her parents, but also contributes financially because she knows that the salary her father earns as a tow truck driver isn’t enough to cover household necessities. 

María José works raising and selling pigs ready to slaughter and spends an average of three hours a day on this activity. She learned this business on her own initiative, but her father is someone who constantly supports her so that she is successful. She requests a loan to buy more piglets. 

She has a lot of dreams that she wants to come true. One of those is finishing her secondary school studies that for lack of financial resources she has not been able to finish. María José is thankful towards Kiva for the opportunity it offers to be able to start her own business.

loans.use: to buy more piglets, this investment will increase her business

loans.name: Fatima De Jesus

texts.es: Fátima de 21 años de edad habita en vivienda propia en compañía de sus padres y un hermano. Ella se dedica a prestar sus servicios como empleada doméstica cuidando a dos niños en el cual ha demostrado ser muy responsable desde, es una labor que realiza hace tres años y es de esta manera como ella ayuda a mantener la economía de su hogar. Fátima desea seguir mejorando su vivienda, ya que anteriormente obtuvo un crédito el cual utilizo para encementar el piso y ahora ella solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para hacer una pila y almacenar agua para uso y consumo diario y mejorar el baño por lo que quiere invertir en: cemento, ladrillo, grava, hierro y alambre para seguir mejorando su calidad de vida para la comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Fátima is 21 years old and lives in her own house with her parents and a brother. She works providing services as a domestic worker caring for two children. She has proven herself to be very responsible as she has had this job for three years. Doing this she helps to support the household finances.

Fátima wants to continue to make improvements on her house as previously she got a loan that she used to cement over the floor. Now she is requesting a new loan from FUSAI to make a wash sink/water tank for daily use and improve the washroom. So she wants to invest in cement, bricks, gravel, re-bar and wire to continue improving the comfort and quality of living of her family

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, gravel, re-bar, wire, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Edelmira

texts.es: Rosa de 41 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños en los alrededores de su municipio de esta manera es como ella obtiene sus ingresos económicos. Rosa vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace varios años junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad que son su mayor alegría. Rosa poco a poco ha logrado mejorar su vivienda, pero aún le falta instalar el techo del pozo de la vivienda para poder ver cumplido su sueño de contar con una vivienda digna, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, polines, pines y alambre para instalar el techo del pozo para seguir con la mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 41 is a hard-working woman who has sold women's, men's, and children's clothing for two years. She sells in the areas surrounding her municipality. This is how she makes a living. Rosa has lived in her own home for several years with her husband and two children ages  6 and 4. Her children are her greatest joy.
Bit by bit Rosa has been able to improve her home. She still needs to install a roof over the bathroom so she can achieve her dream of having a dignified home. For this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in laminate, perlines, wire, and pins to continue improving her home.

loans.use: to invest in laminate, wire, perlines and pins to continue improving her home.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité kuña Guapa se formo con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de  Santaní, son 18 mujeres, todas ellas unidas que quieren salir  adelante y poder ayudar a sus familias.
Mercedes es una de las integrantes de este grupo, una mujer que se destaca por su esfuerzo y su lucha diaria, quiere crecer y mejorar cada día, y es por ello que se unió al programa de comités, para poder crecer y mejorar cada día. Siempre es muy activa en todas las actividades, y comenta que se dedica al humilde trabajo de cría de animales, y que pide este préstamo para poder comprar animales de corral para la cría, como gallinas y cerdos, y también balanceados para los mismos, lo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: The Committee Kuña Guapa was formed when many neighbor women from the city of Santani came together. They are 18 united women, who want to move forward and be able to help their families. Mercedes is one of its members. She excels for her daily effort and her hard work. She wants to grow and improve every day, and this is why she joined the committee programs in order to be able to grow and improve every day. She is very active in all the activities. She comments that she works in the humble job of raising animals and that she is requesting this loan to be able to buy small animals to raise such as hens and pigs, and also balanced feed for them. All this will be of a lot of help.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens to raise, and balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Blanca Lucia

texts.es:
Blanca es una activa empresaria dedica a la cría de pollos, negocio que adopto por la motivación y ganas de salir adelante. Es madre de dos hijos el mayor de 10 años, y el menor de tan solo un año de edad, sus hijos significan un gran apoyo emocional y mental, el solo pensar en el futuro que les quiere brindar, la motiva a trabajar constantemente y con alegría.

Aprendió de su actividad gracias a su esposo, pero con su esfuerzo y su profesionalismo, la hizo independizarse, rápidamente y quiere seguir por esa buena senda de progreso y para ello requiere tu ayuda, necesita comprar inventario de pollos y alimento, para hacer una escalera en su negocio, busca tener rotación de animales para no quedarse sin existencias.
texts.en:
Blanca is an active business woman who earns a living by breeding chickens. It's a business she started due to a motivation and desire to succeed. She is the mother of two children, the oldest being 10 years old and the youngest being just a year old, and they are a great support emotionally and mentally. 

Her only thought is of the future she wants provide for them and this is her motivation to work hard and without complaint. 

She learned her skills thanks to her husband and with determination and professionalism she has quickly become independent. She wants to continue on this path of progress and she requires your help to do this.  She needs to buy some chickens, feed and also a set of cages as she needs to be able to rotate the livestock in order not to run out of supplies.

loans.use: to buy some chickens, feed and also a set of cages as she needs to be able to rotate the livestock in order not to run out of supplies.

loans.name: Ramata's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  a été créé le 11 Juillet 2008 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son treizième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Ramata (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée 43 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons et 02 filles. Elle est vendeuse de produits alimentaires (huile de palme, sucre, thé, patte d’arachide et de poissons fumés.

Avec ce nouveau crédit elle compte acheter 01 bouteille de 20 litre d’huile de palme à 17500f, 01 sac de sucre à 20000f, 01 sceau de patte d’arachide à 11 000f et 06 kg de poissons fumés à 400f le kg pour le revendre en détails dans son village.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte contribuer à la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et prendre en charge ses enfants (habillements, soins médicaux).
texts.en:
The banc villageois was founded on July 11, 2008. This group just started its 13th loan cycle and is comprised of women who all live in the same village. They get along well and have good teamwork. Their primary activity is small business.

Madame Ramata (standing at right with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of four children (two boys and two girls). She sells food items (palm oil, sugar, tea, peanut butter, and smoked fish).

With this new loan, she plans on buying: one 20-liter bottle of palm oil for 17,500 francs, one sack of sugar for 20,000 francs, one bucket of peanut butter for 11,000 francs, and six kilograms of smoked fish for 400 francs per kilogram. She will resell these for retail prices in her village. 
	
With the income she earns, she will contribute to the household expenses and take care of the children (clothing, medical costs).

loans.use: one 20-liter bottle of palm oil, one sack of sugar, one bucket of peanut butter, and six kilograms of smoked fish.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
As a parent of four children, Maria Theresa works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Maria Theresa is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy additional material like nail polish for her manicure and pedicure service business.

Maria Theresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional material like nail polish for her  service

loans.name: Luz Herminia

texts.es:
En ganaderos Orense un recinto del Canton San Miguel de los Bancos vive la Sra. Luz Hermina ella tiene 55 años es madre de 5 hijos los cuales ya todos son mayores de edad e independientes.
Doña Luz se separó de su marido porque tuvo una mala relación desde entonces le ha tocado llevar las riendas del hogar,  tuvo que trabajar muy fuerte para sacar adelante a sus hijos, en la actualidad tiene una tienda, se dedica a la costura y gracias a Fundación Alternativa también acabó de construir unos departamentos los cuales arrienda de estas actividades tiene el sustento de su hogar. 
En las tiendas el horario de trabajo es muy extenso se empieza  muy temprano y se cierra muy tarde empieza a las 6 am y termina a las 8 pm, el negocio de Doña Luz tiene mucha acogida en el sector porque tiene mucha variedad de productos de primera necesidad. 
Este préstamo lo invertirá en su negocio ya que desea surtirlo con más productos debido a la gran acogida que tiene en el sector, la Sra. Luz agradece a Kiva por la ayuda que le está brindando para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Hermina lives in Ganaderos Orenses, a precinct in the canton San Miguel de los Bancos. She is 55 years old and mother to 5 children, all of whom are now adults and independent. Luz separated from her husband as she had a bad relationship; since then, it has been up to her to manage the household and she had to work very hard to get her children ahead. 

She currently has a shop, makes a living sewing and, thanks to the Fundación Alternativa, has also just built some apartments which she rents out; these businesses pay for the household expenses. The hours in the shop are very long as it opens very early and closes very late: Luz begins at 6am and finishes at 8pm. Luz's business has been well received in the area as it has a wide range of essential products. 

She will invest this loan in her business as she wants to stock it with more products due to its good reception in the area. Luz is grateful to Kiva for helping her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her business with merchandise and provide her loyal customers with a good service.

loans.name: Hergelyn

texts.en:
Hergelyn is 33 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additonal sacks of charcoal to sell.

Hergelyn has been in this business for seven years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additonal sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anafe

texts.en:
Anafe is 45 years old and married. She has four children (two children are currently in school). Anafe is in an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to sustain her business.

Anafe requested a 20,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Anafe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 50 years old and married with four children. With three children still in school, Myrna works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, cooking oil, etc.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 63 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Susana runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, eggs, soap, coffee and other groceries. 

Susana has requested a 7,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy items to sell. In the future, Susana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as rice, eggs, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Elena has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish and food vending.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF). She is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her business. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Chrach's Group

texts.en: Chrach, a farmer living in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, is 50 years old and a widowed mother of two dependent children. She has been selling Khmer noodles to earn the main source of her income for 15 years. She cannot find a good place to perform her business and it is difficult to sell out all of her food as there is little demand. These are the main challenges that she faces these days. Chrach decided to request a new loan with a group of two members with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and this is the second time for her. The past loan was completely repaid and it has enabled her to improve her living conditions. This time, as the group leader, she will use her loan to buy Khmer noodles and to build a proper store to sell her foods. She hopes that she can earn more income to update the standard of living better than before.

loans.use: to buy Khmer noodles and to build a proper store to sell her foods.

loans.name: Safietou's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 15 Novembre 2006 à l’occasion de son inauguration, il existe une bonne connexion entre les membres du groupe. Elles  vivent dans le même village depuis plusieurs décennies et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce. 

Madame Safietou, âgée de 47 ans (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons et 02 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente d’habillements pour enfants. Elle achète sa marchandise à Dakar en gros. Elle maîtrise bien cette activité.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter du prêt à porter et des chaussures pour enfants d’une valeur de 150 000f et payer un transport aller retour de 25000f pour ensuite le revendre en détails dans son quartier et les quartiers environnants.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’une part d’aider son mari dans la gestion du foyer (santé, scolarité des enfants etc...).
texts.en:
This group was created on November 15, 2006. There is a good connection among the group members. They have lived in the same village for decades and share values of solidarity and mutual help. Their primary activity is small business.

Madame Safietou (seated at right in the middle row with her hand raised) is 47 years old and is the group’s star borrower. She is married and the mother of four children (two boys and two girls). She sells children’s clothing. She buys her merchandise in Dakar for wholesale prices. She is successful in her business.

With her new loan, she will buy children's ready-to-wear clothing and shoes for 150,000 francs and pay for round-trip transportation for 25,000 francs. She will sell the clothing and shoes for retail prices in and around her neighborhood.

This income will allow her to help her husband with the household expenses (healthcare, schooling, children, etc.).

loans.use: buy children's ready-to-wear clothing and shoes and pay for round-trip transportation.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 38-year-old and is from Bicutan, Philippines from Bicutan, Philippines. Her husband, Pendatun, is a businessman. They have three children;  two attend school. The couple both work to provide for their daily and school needs of their children.

Amina has had a small general store by their house for a number of years. Although her family lives in a country with a poor economy, she does her best to augment their income to meet the needs of her family, especially her children's educational needs. education. Although she is faced with stiff competition, her charming personality makes the people want to buy at her store. She earns a minimum net income of 600 PHP a day. 

She requests 19,000 PHP  to buy canned goods, coffee, eggs, instant noodles, and beverages. She wants to fill her store with essential food items to make her store more competitive. She thanks God and you in advance, your financial assistance will be help to increase her sales and earnings.

Amina's simple dream is to have a bigger grocery store someday. She prays for God to bless her and her family with good health. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work  and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, beverages ,and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 62 years old now.

Porferia has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

Porferia has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed

loans.name: Khern's Group

texts.en:
Khern is a 29-year0old married woman with two pre-school children.  She is a local farmer living in the Kam Rieng district of Battambang province,  She has grown rice and cassava  for ten years. Sometimes, she works for others for a fee to supplement income. 

Her cassava grows slowly and she lacks the capital to improve its growth. She leads a group of two to get a loan.  This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan to pay the plowing fee, buy cassava seeds, and buy organic fertilizer. She hopes that she can earn more income to renovate her house so that her family members can live comfortably.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fee, buy cassava seeds, and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is a 23-year-old married woman with two children, 1 attends school. 

Florida has bought and sold ornamental plants for 3 years and needs 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ornamental plants and other supplies for her business.

She has previously borrowed 5 times  from NWTF to sustain her business.

Florida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ornamental plants and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a 35-year-old married woman with three children, one attends school. Marivic works very hard to provide for them by running a general store for 17 years. She requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase  soap, milk, sugar, eggs, and soft drinks.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase  soap, milk, sugar, eggs, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 54 years old and married with five children. With children in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Sokhoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhoeurn is a 45-year-old woman with two dependent children who lives in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district. 

She grows rice and works on her co-villager’s farm for a fee. She has been involved in her job for twenty-seven years.  Insects destroyed her crop, which reduced her  income. Her business earns about 38,000 KHR per day. 

This is the third loan cycle for Sokhoeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her family’s living standards improved because of her previous loans. She is the leader of a 4-member group and will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay  labor fees. 

She hopes that her farm's yield will increase so that the family’s living standard will improve.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees..

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is married and has been operating a general store business in the Philippines for five years. She works hard to support her family.

Melinda has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, coffee, etc. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es: Guadalupe de 38 años de edad vive con su padre y su hija de 15 años de edad para los cuales se esfuerza para salir adelante como mama soltera. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo desde hace tres años y es de esa manera que logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar ya que cuenta con una excelente clientela que solicitan en gran cantidad sus productos. Guadalupe desea seguir mejorando las condiciones de su vivienda ya que anteriormente inicio con el cambio de láminas de la casa ahora ella solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina, madera, hierro y clavos para poder cambiar el techo y la parte de las paredes de la casa y de esta manera darle mayor seguridad  y protección a su padre e hija y tener mayor.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 38 years old. She lives with her father and 15-year-old daughter, from whom she makes an effort to go forward as a single mother. She decided to sell products by catalog three years ago, and in this way, she succeeds in covering the household expenses. She has excellent clients, who request many products from her. 

Guadalupe wants to continue improving the conditions of her home; previously, she started with changing the metal sheets of the house. She now requests a new loan from FUSAI to invest in metal sheets, wood, iron, and nails to change the roof and part of the walls of the house. In this way, she can offer better security and protection to her father and daughter and have more.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheets, wood, iron, and nails to change the roof and part of the walls of her house.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 48-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has been operating  a food vending business in the Philippines for seven years.

Lucia has requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as flour, sugar, eggs, etc. for her enterprise. In the future, she would like to save enough to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour, sugar, eggs, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 55 years old, married, and has seven children, two of whom are in school. She has been raising pigs in the Philippines for 10 years now.

Having.borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her enterprise, Emma is now requesting a PHP 12000 loan to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Judith requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Judith has been in this business for 15 years now.

Judith would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Sreyda's Group

texts.en:
Sreyda is 40 years old and living in a rural area of Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district. She is the mother of two children, one of whom works at a garment factory and the other who is too young. She sells grocery items as the main source of her family’s income and she sells porridge to earn additional income to support her living standards. She could earn an income of about 33,000 KHR per day and be able to save around 15,000 KHR each day after offsetting her family’s daily expenses. Because her business does not do well during the raining season because of the slippery road in front of her house which is difficult for customers to walk across, it affects her daily selling operation.

For Sreyda, she has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two loan cycles already and she repaid her past loans successfully. She is now leading a group of three members to ask for a new loan because of a lack of funds to support her business. As the leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy more kinds of grocery items to attract more customers. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income in order to expand her current business to upgrade her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of grocery items to attract more customers.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Diosebel

texts.es: Diosebel de 73 años es un empresario independiente que inició su negocio al trasladarse del vecino país de Venezuela  a un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, en donde estaba en furor el negocio de alquiler de lavadoras y decidió invertir en estos electrodomésticos para alquilar a su comunidad.  Tuvo gran éxito en su negocio y hasta el momento ha adquirido 13 lavadoras que abastecen a la localidad donde reside, sin embargo su demanda cada vez es mayor y está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de dos lavadoras.  Aunque su principal desafío ha sido su edad porque es una limitante en el sector financiero, sus deseos de salir adelante y prosperar no se han desvanecido, por el contrario, gracias a esta inversión podrá surgir más y demostrar que la edad no es un obstáculo.
texts.en:
Diosebel, who is 73 years old, is an independent businessman, who started his business to move from the neighboring country of Venezuela to a neighborhood in the municipality of Barranquilla. There, it was all the rage to have a business renting washing machines. He decided to invest in these household appliances to rent to his community. He had great success in his business, and up until now, he has bought 13 washing machines that are located where he lives. 

Nonetheless, his demand is growing, and he is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will invest the loan to buy two washing machines. Although his main challenge has been his age—because it is a limitation in the financial sector—his goals to go forward and prosper have not faded. Instead, thanks to this investment he will be able to rise more and demonstrate that age is not an obstacle.

loans.use: to invest in two washing machines.

loans.name: He Muong 11 Group

texts.en:
Xien is 48 years old and lives in a Thai ethnic traditional house in a small remote village. He lives with his wife, along with his six sons and one daughter. They rely on agricultural production for a living with several activities; cultivating rice, breeding chickens and fish. To provide for the crowded family, he works very hard and recently, he has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to buy piglets to diversify his animal husbandry. He hopes that the production will gradually improve his family's income so that they could have a more abundant life.

Xien dreams of a brighter future for his children. In the picture he is standing the first on the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets to diversify his animal husbandry.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy meat, yucca, cold cuts, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Maria Digna

texts.es: Maria, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio del Progreso, Yoro junto con una sobrina. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio anteriormente se dedicaba a la  elaboración y venta de comidas. Y hace 5 años estableció una pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica como arroz, frijoles, manteca, lácteos, carnes, embutidos, refrescos, y otros. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar mas producto de abarrotería, refrescos y lácteos para aumentar el inventario y ventas. Su plan es crecer con el negocio y ayudar a su sobrina con los estudios.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old, is a single mother, has four children, and lives in a small village in the municipality of Progreso, Yoro together with a niece. She has always worked in business; previously she worked in the manufacture and sale of foods. And five years ago she established a grocery store to sell basic food items like rice, beans, butter, dairy products, meats, sausages, soft drinks, and more. 

The loan that she requests is for 10,000 Lempiras (HNL) to buy more grocery items, soft drinks, and dairy products to increase her inventory and sales. Her plan is to grow her business and help her niece with school.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, dairy products, soft drinks, and other products that she needs to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 45 years old and has ten children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Remedios is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Remedios has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: metal sheets, wood, nails, wire, a gate, and gutters for rainwater.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
O senhor Francisco de 46 anos de idade  é pedreiro, casado pai de 4 filhos dos quais  2  frequenta o ensino primário, e 2 ainda sem idade escolar, sustenta seus pais que vivem com ele na casa própria.
Diz que com valor do crédito irá comprar cimento, varrões, pedra, e pagar a mão-de-obra para dar continuidade da sua obra.
O seu sonho é terminar a obra, colocar energia na sua casa, mobilar para oferecer um lar melhor  a sua família.
Diz ainda que pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concretizar seus planos e espera respeitar o contracto celebrado.
texts.en:
Francisco is 46 years old bricklayer. He is married and the father of four children, two of which go to primary school and the other two are not yet school aged. He cares for his parents who lives with him in his own house.

He says that he will buy cement, rods, rocks, and pay for labor with the amount from the loan in order to continue his work. His dream is to finish the construction, hook up energy in his home and furnish it in order to offer a better home for his family.

He says that he will try to request more loans to solidify his plan and he expects to respect the contract.

loans.use: to buy cement, rods, rocks, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Emerlinda

texts.en:
Emerlinda is widowed. For the past six years she has bought and sold cellphones and their accessories in the Philippines.

Emerlinda has applied for a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy additional cellphones and accessories to sell. She works hard to ensure her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy additional cellphones and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi, 36, is married and has five children, three of whom are in school. For the past six years she has run a water distribution station in the Philippines.

Noemi took out and successfully repaid a previous loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She is now applying for another loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more units of water to sell.

Noemi’s goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more units of water to sell.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina, 21, is married and has a child. The family lives in Takeo Province in Cambodia. Since last year she has been a factory worker. Her husband, 24, works in glass, making glass doors, windows and mirrors, among other things. Sina and her husband earn approximately 13 USD a day.

Sina would like to buy construction materials to renovate her house, so she is applying for a 1,500 USD loan through Kiva's field partner KREDIT. With the loan she will be able to fix up her house, buy more soil to fill the yard and so achieve better living conditions.

Sina would like to save enough money to open a small business and someday see her child graduate from high school.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate her house and buy more soil to fill the yard

loans.name: Kihungya Produce Farmers Organisation Group

texts.en:
Penji whose hand is raised up in a group photograph of Kihungya Produce Farmers Organisation, is a forty five year old man living in Masindi-Uganda. He deals in crop production as his major business and works hard to sustain his family.

He is affected by inadequate capital and will use the loan to help him in planting of crops such as maize,cassava.

loans.use: to help planting crops such as maize and cassava.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her production at her food sales stall.

loans.name: Fuapauna

texts.en:
Fuapauna is 40 years old and partner in 2 years with 4 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes, ice-cakes, chicken buns, etc; in her community and has been doing this for 1 year. 

Fuapauna has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, bags of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, bags of salt, bags of onion, etc. She joined SPBD in July this year 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fuapauna will use it to extend her business to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, spoons, bags of flour, bags of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 37 years old and has a partner for 4 years with 4 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 1 year. 

Veronica has requested a loan to buy bags of sugar, bags of flour, yeast, cooking oil, plastic bags, etc. She joined SPBD in July this year 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Veronica will plan to use it to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, bags of sugar, bags of flour, yeast, plastic bags, spoons, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Sonia

texts.es: Blanca es una mujer de 41 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus dos hijos de 14 y 10 años de edad por los cuales se esfuerza por sacar adelante en sus estudios como madre soltera. Blanca se dedica a la venta de pan francés y pan dulce como: budín, quesadilla, semita, etc. Ella desea mejorar su vivienda y es por ello que desea invertir en  y hacer la instalación y mano de obra de agua potable, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para la inversión de pago de derecho de suministro de agua e instalación del vital líquido ya que no cuenta con este suministro en su hogar, con el monto otorgado piensa comprar: tubos pvc, chorros para agua, mano de obra y otros gastos, pues desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 41 year-old woman and lives her own home with her two children who are 10 and 14 years of age. She is a single mother who strives to help her children succeed in their studies. She sells french bread and pastries such as bread pudding, cheesecake, and marmalade filled tarts. 

She wants to improve her home and for this reason she would like to invest in the manual labor to install running water. She is applying for a loan with FUSAI to invest in paying for water service and the installation of this vital liquid since she doesn't have running water in her home. 

With the loan she plans on purchasing PVC tubes, faucets, manual labor and other expenses. She wants to offer a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to invest in PVC tubes, faucets, manual labor and other expenses to install running water in her home.

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma works hard to support her family. Welma is married and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.
