Welma has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Welma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy color plotters and printing material for her husband 's printing work.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en: Glenda is 52 years old and has operated a sari-sari, or small general store for the past four years. She has applied for a 13,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her shop. She is saving money for further expansion of her store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her sari-sari, or general store

loans.name: Herma

texts.en:
Herma, 33, is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. For the past three years she has sold fish to earn a living in the Philippines.

Herma has applied for a 7,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. She is working and saving money for future expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Paupusi

texts.en:
Paupusi is a 49 years old woman who is married with 6 children. She runs a business of sewing clothes in her community. She has 2 years of experience in this business. 

Paupusi has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, materials, needles, threads, etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business and develop another new business to earn more income. She joined SPBD in 2103 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, a new sewing machine, needles, threads, etc.

loans.name: Osmar

texts.es:
El Señor Osmar es de la ciudad de Santaní, es una persona muy trabajadora que está luchando para poder crecer y salir adelante cada día. Tiene una carnicería que monto con mucho sacrificio, y que hoy ya es el sostén de su familia.
Es una persona trabajador humilde y muy responsable, según comentó desde muy joven empezó a trabajar con su papa en una carnicería, y su sueño de siempre era de tener su propia carnicería, ahora ya cuenta con su propio negocio cuenta con clientela formado con buen ingreso mensuales.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar animales para la faena en su carnicería y así seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
Mr. Osmar is from the city of Santaní and is a very hardworking person who is fighting to grow and succeed every day. He has a butcher’s shop that he sacrificed a lot to start, and today it already is the main support for his family. He’s a hardworking, humble, and very responsible person. According to him, since he was very young he started working with his dad in a butcher’s shop, and his dream was always to have his own. Now he already has his own business, customers, and a good monthly income.

He asks for this loan to be able to buy animals for slaughter in his butcher’s shop and that way continue selling and fighting to improve.

loans.use: to buy animals for butchering and selling in his butcher's shop

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresitato is 67 years old, married, has children who are adult age and live in Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is a fish vendor supported by her fisherman husband. She is making good sales on her business but she experienced downfall when her children goes to college. 

She learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it extends to enthusiastic businesswoman like her. She has turned the tide in her favor and this time she has taken a loan of PHP 50,000.00 to redeem pawned coconut land. Having back her coconut land would mean additional income to her.

loans.use: to redeem pawned coconut land

loans.name: Nigorbi

texts.en:
Nigorbi is a strong woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1961 and is living in big town with her family. She is divorced and has five children. She is tailor and sews traditional women dresses and has three sewing machines. She sews 2-3 dresses a day. She is well known among neighbors and friends. She has regular clients each week. H

Now her daughter is ill. She needs to be treated at a hospital. Nigorbi is willing to get a loan to treat her daughter at hospital. She appealed to Kiva lenders for financial support and hopes to be understood.

loans.use: to treat her daughter at hospital

loans.name: Ngala Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
Tom is a 34 year old male Uganda married and has 3 children who attend school and he is responsible for paying their school fees and providing other necessities, In order to meet these requirements, Tom is usually involved in farming and the sale of produce.

He has through his group of Ngaala Tukwatanise applied for a loan of ugx400,000 to complete his house in order to provide better shelter for his children.He currently stays in a semi permanent house.

He describes himself as hardworking but he says he faces challenges of bad weather and limited capital to access better seeds for farming.
Tom appreciates the support that has been advanced to him and fellow group members- they are committed to work hard and alleviate poverty.

loans.use: To buy cement and paint to complete his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new Juki sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of lottery tickets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in lottery tickets.

loans.name: Xaysawang Group

texts.en:
Chai’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Chai and her group are excited that a better alternative, the TerraClear water filter, was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.

Chai and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families' budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users, like Chai’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

One of the people pictured paid 100% for their filter.  This person did sign the necessary photo waiver.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Ruby Ann

texts.en:
Ruby Ann is 36 years old, married and lives in Cebulin, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She owns motorcycles which are used for transportation business. She is supported by her husband as one of the motor operators. Ruby Ann also owns a sari-sari store (convenience store) that augments their monthly income. 

Recently, she loan PHP 7,000.00 to fully pay for a motorcycle for transportation business.

loans.use: to fully pay for a motorcycle for transportation business

loans.name: Srey Mach's Group

texts.en:
Srey Mach, who is a farmer of Kam Rieng district of Battambang province, is 29 years. She is a mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school and the other one is too young to. 

In order to support her living condition, she grows cassava as the main source of income and she has involved this business for 11 years. She works for others for a fee to earn additional income for her family. 

These days, she lacks in capital to enlarge her cassava business, so she decides to apply for a new loan, which will be her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loan support that enabled her to improve her living condition and renovate house better was repaid back successfully. 

For this new loan, Srey Mach, the leader of ten-member group, will use her loan portion to pay for plowing fees, buy cassava seeds so that she can get more crop products than before. She hopes to earn more income to better support her family’s needs and to renovate her house much comfortably.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees and buy cassava seeds so that she can get more crop products than before.

loans.name: Bunena Vision  Group

texts.en:
Robinah is a thirty eight year old hardworking married woman with 8 children and four of them attend school in Kamwenge Uganda. She grows and sells maize and ground nuts solely for her livelihood. This helps her cater for her family and earn a living. She intends to educate her children and expand her business in a modern farm. She is challenged by bad weather and competition from other farmers.

She is requesting for a loan to buy beans and ground nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a moto rickshaw's body for her brother's transportation services.

loans.name: Sroy's Group

texts.en:
Sroy, 52, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of ten dependent children. For her living, she grows cassava and does rice farm to support her family’s living condition. She has been involved in her business for thirty-two years. 

This is the eighth loan cycle for Sroy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Those previous loans have helped her to have enough consumption to support her family’s living. Due to having not enough funds to support her business, she is now leading a group of two members to take new loan of 2,400,000KHR and another member is seeking of 1,600,000KHR. She will manage her loan portion to buy a plot of land to expand her farming area. She hopes that her crops yields will be increased to provide her more income.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to expand her farming area.

loans.name: Maria Elvia

texts.es:
Al Noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha tenemos el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos  en este Cantón vive en casa de su hija la Sra. María es madre de 5 hijos todos son mayores de edad e independientes,  en la actualidad ella es viuda su esposo falleció hace unos meses pero ha tenido que buscar la manera de salir adelante.  
Casi toda su vida le ha gustado trabajar y tener su propio negocio, en la actualidad tiene un local de lavado y secado de ropa aprendió de este  negocio por iniciativa propia, ella trabaja un promedio de 8 horas diarias ya que tiene gran demanda de clientes que la buscan por su amabilidad y cumplimiento en las entregas.
En este negocio no hay muchas actividades difíciles pero tiene el apoyo de todos sus hijos, actualmente una de ellas le ayuda en el mismo, su más grande sueño es tener un local más grande para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, este préstamo ayudara a la Sra. María a mejorar sus ingresos económicos y ampliar su negocio ya que el mismo se invertirá en comprar más activos para el mismo, María agradece a Kiva por la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
In the Norroccidente region of Pichincha province, there’s the canton (Ecuadorian state) of San Miguel de los Bancos. In this canton, Mrs. María lives in her daughter’s house. She is the mother of five children; all are adults and independent. Nowadays, she is a widow. Her husband passed away a few months ago, but she had to find a way to get ahead. 

Nearly all of her life she has liked working and having her own business. Nowadays, she has a business for washing and drying clothing. She learned about this business on her own initiative; she works an average of eight hours a day. She already has a huge demand from customers who look for her because of her kindness and fulfillment of deliveries. 

In this business, there aren’t many difficult tasks, but she has the support of all her children; currently one of them helps her with it. Her biggest dream is to have a larger facility to be able to satisfy the needs of her customers. This loan will help Mrs. María improve her income and expand her business, since it will be invested in buying more assets. María is thankful towards Kiva for the opportunity to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more assets; with this income her quality of life will improve

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at their home for the improvement of access to sanitation and a water source.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 56 years old, married and lives in Binuangan, Oroquieta City. She is in coco lumber buy & sell business. Elsa sign up for membership with Paglaum MPC under the micro finance program of the cooperative. She had availed various loan products and had maintained her good records without defaults of payments. 

Recently, she has taken another loan of PHP 8,000.00 to purchase additional coco lumber for her timber sales business.

loans.use: to purchase additional coco lumber for timber sales business

loans.name: Abita

texts.en:
Abita is 49 years old, married and lives in Burgos, Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental.

Abita has been in the hog raising business for 5 years. This has given her additional income for her family. Recently, she requested another loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional piglets and bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Rat

texts.en:
Rat is a 32-year-old widowed factory worker with a small child in her care. She lives in a community in the province of Takeo, Cambodia. As a factory worker, she makes approximately USD 7 each day.

Rat is now requesting a loan to buy a plot of farmland for rice cultivation. This loan will help her have enough funds to buy farmland and grow rice crops for her family. Rat plans are to save money to build a new house and help her child in earning a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for rice cultivation

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en:
Adelyn is 31 years old and married with one child in school. Adelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Adelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Adelyn has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Adelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Giselle

texts.en:
Giselle is a woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Giselle is 49 years old and has five children who are in school.

Giselle has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Giselle requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Giselle has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Giselle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Deceril

texts.en:
Deceril is 31 years old, married and has five children, four of whom in school.  

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Deceril requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Deceril has been pig fattening for 7 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Deceril would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 58 years old, married and has eight children. 

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Luz requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins.

Luz has been raising pigs for 8 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.en:
Anacleta is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anacleta is 54 years old now.

Anacleta has a fishing business in the Philippines. Anacleta requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Anacleta has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Anacleta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: At

texts.en:
A resident living in Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, At is 41 years old and a married mother of four dependent children. She grows cassava on two hectares area to support her family’s living. Moreover, she grows cashew and takes some leisure times to works for others for a fee so that she can supplement family’s income. Now, her cassava business, which she has involved for 23 years, earns her little income than before for it has grown slowly and produced lower-than-expected outputs. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she asks for a loan to buy cashew trees to plant so that she can enlarge her cashew farm to earn more income. She hopes that her farm can get more crops products to earn more income to update the living standard and support her children’s studies.

loans.use: To buy cashew trees to plant so that she can enlarge her cashew farm to earn more income.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Savong's Group

texts.en:
Savong is a 53-year-old mother of three children and one among them is a dependent child, living in a remote area of Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district. She does rice farming as the main of her family’s income and duck-raising to earn extra income for her living. She has been with these businesses for thirty-five years. 

For Savong, this is her first time to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the group leader of two members, she is willing to take this loan in the amount of 1,000,000KHR and another member is seeking of 100,000KHR. 

She is going to use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to boost her crop yields. She hopes her business will earn her more income to improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to boost her crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Virgen De Las Gracias Group

texts.es:
Virgen de las Gracias es este grupo formado en la ciudad de Caaguazú, está en su ciclo número 1, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 10 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema, luchando por ir mejorándola.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gloria, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, es decir se encuentra en un nivel medio. Ella vende prendas variadas, y por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder mejorar y crecer cada día, quiere seguir creciendo, es por ello que quiere capacitarse.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, jeans, camisas y otras prendas, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Virgin of Grace is the pictured group formed in the city of Caaguazú, it is in its first stage, they are doing a survey about the elimination of poverty, where ten members find themselves below the poverty line, that is to say extreme poverty, fighting to continue improving it. 

One of the members Señora Gloria, who in her previous survey indicated a level of poverty within level two, that is to say she is at an intermediate level. She sells various clothes, and through her job she has the resources to be able to improve and grow every day, she wants to continue growing, which is why she wants to train herself. She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy more t shirts, jeans, shirts, and other clothing, so she can continue with her sales, fighting to be able to improve every day.

loans.use: To purchase t-shirts, jeans, shirts, and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Visaminda

texts.en:
Visaminda is 50 years old, married and lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She has been a fish vendor for more than 30 years and this gives her additional income for her family.

Visaminda learned about Paglaum MPC and the products & services it offers to small time borrowers like her. She signed up for membership and avails herself of all the services available to clients like her. Recently, she requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 58 years old, separated, has 4 children of adult age, and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a buy & sell business of household things and a sari-sari store (convenience store) on their place. This type of business give her profit that supports her family.  

Recently, she avails another loan of PHP 14,900.00 to restock store with consumable goods like canned goods, soy sauce, oil, vinegar and others.

loans.use: to restock store with consumable goods like canned goods, soy sauce, oil, vinegar and others

loans.name: Edda

texts.en:
Edda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Edda is 39 years old and has two children who are in school.

Edda has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Edda requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Edda has been in this business for three years. In the future, Edda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a married woman with nine children. Avelina is 41 years old and three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Avelina has an egg vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years. Avelina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more eggs to sell.

In the future, Avelina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry birds of a high-quality breed

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is 27 years old farmer who has 5 family members. He lives in Chack Sadho, a native village in Gujranwala, Pakistan. He has over 10 years of experience in farming. His parents passed it down to him. He mobilized the farmers of his village to form a group to approach financial institutions for their financial needs on farming business.
He is the leader of his group of three, he is raising his hand in the photo. He is an honest farmer that grows rice and wheat in his land. He meets his family’s day to day expenses through the sale of his crops in nearby grain market.
He is asking a loan to buy 2 sacks of quality seeds, 15 sacks of fertilizer and pesticides for his rice crop. He has to prepare his land for rice crop. He wants to use the profits to expand his business. He also plans to take care of his family and to pay for his children's tuition fees. He promises to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Elphas

texts.en:
Elphas is an ambitious 20 year-old smallholder farmer based in Nandi Hills, a rain-fed and fertile area in Kenya. He is single and to his right in the photo is his mother. He makes a living doing livestock and crop farming. After selling his farm’s produce at a local market, he uses the income to run his business and meet his family’s basic needs.

The challenge common to rural smallholder farmers that Elphas is facing is the expensive cost of transporting goods to the market. Most farmers resort to dealing with brokers and end up being exploited.

Elphas is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain and can handle the rough terrain found in rural areas. With this asset, Elphas will be able to transport his produce to formal markets where he can get a fair value for his produce.

Your loan investing into Elphas' business will elevate his family’s livelihood and generate more income for them to meet their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is a married father, he is 48 years with 4 family members. He is standing in the middle of the photo and raising his hand. He is a resident of “Bhudary”, a village in District Gujranwala, Pakistan. He is a poor and honest farmer. He mobilized a group of three farmers and he is the group leader. He cultivates rice and wheat in his land to meet his family’s day to day expenses.

He has been in the farming business for 25 years. He buys agricultural supplies in the neighboring market. He is requesting a loan to buy 25 bags of fertilizer and 10 boxes of pesticides for his rice crop. He hopes to have good harvest from his farm.

He would like to use his earnings to support his business and meet the needs of his family. He dreams to have a better house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Cayetano está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, haciendo la encuesta para ir superando la situación de pobreza de cada una.
Una de las integrantes, que se destaca por ser una persona sacrificada y luchadora, es la Sra. Felicia, quien cuenta con la venta de comestibles, ella misma se levanta desde temprano a hacer sus comidas, que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante, y es por ello que pone todo de si para capacitarse y mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano group is in its 3rd cycle of the women's committee program, which is a part of the poverty elimination program. They work to improve the poverty situation for each individual.

One of the members is Felicia, who is distinguished by being a selfless and determined person. She sells food for a living. She wakes up early to prepare the food herself, and then she heads out to make sales door-to-door. She is a very hardworking and determined person who wishes to move ahead in life, and so she gives her all to training and improving herself. 

Felicia is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for the food she makes, such as vegetables, meat, condiments, greens, etc., so that she can continue her sales and fight to get better every day.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, greens, etc.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 54 years old, married and lives in Mohon, Aloran-Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. He is a corn grower at their place. Aside from being a corn grower, he also owns a rice farm. This farming system gives him additional income for the family needs. 

Philip learned about the programs and services offered by the cooperative to farmers like him and signed up for membership. Currently, he is taking a loan of PHP 7,000 to pay labor costs for land preparation of the corn farm.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for land preparation of the corn farm

loans.name: Kikoni Ii Twimukye Group

texts.en:
Ceasar is a 53-year-old, hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a father of five school-going children. 

Ceasar operates a retail shop alongside cattle rearing and crop growing. He does this to increase his income and support his family. Ceasar’s goal is to educate his children and expand his shop to a wholesale store, but he is limited by competition and bad debtors in his business. 

He is accessing credit to buy more sugar, soap and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 52 years old farmer. He is a hardworking and humble man. He has nine family members. He is standing in the middle and raising his hand in the photo. He is a resident of “Kotli Malian”, a village in District Gujranwala, Pakistan. He is the leader of a group of three farmers. He cultivates rice and wheat in his farm.
He has been working in his land for 25 years. He buys his supplies in the neighboring market. He is requesting a loan to buy 24 bags of fertilizer and 8 boxes of pesticides for his rice crop. He hopes to have a good harvest from his farm.
He would like to use his earnings to support his business and meet the needs of his family. His dream is to have a better home and thus have a more stable life. With your support, He can continue pursuing his dream.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Kleber Rodrigo

texts.es:
Kleber es un joven ecuatoriano tiene 28 años de edad, nació en la ciudad de Latacunga parroquia La Matriz  en una zona rural de la provincia de Cotopaxi vive en casa de los padres de su esposa, la misma se llama Clara terminó sus estudios pimarios con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio de ellos, a pesar de la mala situación económica que atraviesan , y al no poder  seguir dándole para que siga estudiando Kleber  tuvo que buscar primeramente trabajo y es así que ahora tiene su propio taller de electromecánica  desde hace ya varios años.
Pese a que  tiene su trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, la esposa es quien ha sido su apoyo incondicional en todo momento, Kleber  vino a nosotros por recomendación por un amigo que es cliente de Fundacion Alternativa, quiere  comprar mercadería y herramientas para su taller, escogió esta actividad ya que la mayoría de su familia se dedica a lo mismo y ha visto una buena utilidad, su mayor obstáculo en la vida ha sido que  nunca le han podido dar un crédito para emprender  su pequeño negocio, para esto  
En esta oportunidad  Kleber y su familia   hacen llegar un cordial y efusivo  agradecimiento a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal ya que con el dinero que le financiemos podrá cumplir con uno de sus mayores sueños.
texts.en:
Kleber is a young 28 year old Ecuadorian. He was born in the town of Latacunga in the La Matriz parish in a rural zone of Cotopaxi. Kleber lives with his wife in her parents' home. His wife's name is Clara. 

With a lot of hard work and sacrifice Kleber was able to complete primary school, despite the terrible state of poverty his family was in. Following primary school it wasn't possible for Kleber to continue with his studies, he needed to find work. 

Kleber has now had his own electromechanical workshop for a number of years. This work has been very demanding in terms of time and effort, his wife has been there every step of the way with unconditional support. 

Kleber came to us via the recommendation of a friend who's a client of Fundacion Alternativa. He would love to buy merchandise and tools for his workshop. Kleber chose this work as the majority of his family also makes a living this way. The biggest obstacle for Kleber has been that he has never been able to get a loan to grow his small business. Thus Kleber and his family are very grateful to Fundacion Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making growth in his professional and personal life possible. 

With the money from this loan Kleber is going to be able to fulfil one of his lifelong dreams.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and tools for his workshop, in order to grow personally and professionally.

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is 28 years old. He is standing in the middle and raising his hand in the photo. He is a group leader of three farmers. He resides in a village called “Harpoke” in Tehsil Kamoke of Pakistan. He is a farmer and his wife is dedicated to the household tasks. They have one child.
He has been farming since he was 18 years old, his father taught him how to farm very well. His wife is very supportive. He grows wheat and rice in his land.
He needs a loan to buy farming supplies including 25 bags of fertilizer and 8 boxes of pesticides for his rice. He hopes that his harvest will be good so he can gain a better income to provide food for his family.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
Las Divinas es un grupo que está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son mujeres luchadoras y sacrificadas que luchan por sus familias, para darles un mejor porvenir.
Gasparina es peluquera, y se destaca por ser muy buena en lo que hace, tiene muchos clientes que siempre van hasta su salón, ya que siempre da un buen servicio. Ella es una persona que con sacrificio y esfuerzo ha ido mejorando y creciendo, y quiere seguir haciéndolo, es por eso que pone todo de sí.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar shampoo, cremas, enjuagues y otros insumos para poder surtir su peluquería y de esa forma poder seguir dando  un buen servicio a sus clientes. Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Las Divinas is a group within the poverty elimination program. The members are determined and selfless women who fight to give their families a better future.

Gasparina is a hairdresser, and she stands out for being very good at what she does. She has many clients who always go to her salon since she always gives a good service. She is a person who with sacrifice and effort has been improving and growing, and she gives it her all to keep doing so.

She is requesting this loan to buy shampoo, conditioner, rinses, and other supplies to stock her salon. This way, she can keep offering a good service to her customers. She is very thankful for this opportunity to keep improving her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioner, rinses, and other supplies.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Carmela is 44 years old and has one child in school.

Carmela has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Carmela has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Besiki

texts.en:
Besiki is 54 years old. He lives in Gurjaani district. Besiki works as a shepherd. He shepherds the sheep of his villagers every day and is paid monthly. Besiki decided to start his own business and requested a loan.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan for purchasing sheep. He will start producing cheese and will sell it in order to generate more income.

Besiki is experienced in this field and knows that it is profitable. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and produce cheese to sell

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Sector Zapeta Group

texts.es:
Maria (es la señora que aparece de segunda en el lado izquierdo de la foto) es una mujer casada que tiene cuatro hijos de entre 3 y 9 años, Maria tiene 37 años de edad.
Maria es una mujer que lucha día con día para la generación de sus ingresos, ellas se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, ella por ahora únicamente vende en el mercado de su comunidad, una de las razones por que no vende en lugares aledaños, es porque no cuenta con suficiente capital para comprar más mercadería. A raíz de esta dificultad, Maria anda en busca de un préstamo, para comprar más mercadería y así poder generar más ingresos y sobre todo ganancias, ella no cuenta con otro ingreso pero   con esta venta ella manifiesta que es eficaz.
La meta de Maria para el futuro de acuerdo a sus ganancias ella puede buscar otros mercados para vender y generar más ganancias, y tener diversidad de cortes y güipiles a la moda, ya que el mundo es cambiante y cada día modernizan los productos. Maria tiene la plena seguridad de conseguir el préstamo y su sueño llegara hacer realidad.
texts.en:
Maria (she is the lady who appears second from the left in the photo) is a married woman who has four children between ages 3 and 9. Maria is 37 years old.

Maria is  a woman who fights every day towards generating income, she works purchasing and selling traditional clothing, for now she only sells in her community market, one of the reasons why she doesn't sell in the surrounding areas is that she doesn´t have enough capital in order to buy more merchandise.

Due to this difficulty, Maria is searching for a loan in order to buy more merchandise and thus be able to generate more revenue and overall profit. She does not have another source of income but with this business she affirms that it is effective. Maria´s goal for the future is to be able to afford finding other markets to sell and generate more revenue, and to have diversity in skirts and güipiles(a traditional Guatemalan dress) that are up to date, since the world is changing and every day products are modernized. Maria has full assurance in obtaining the loan and her dream will come to be reality.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of traditional clothing.

loans.name: Chaudhry's Group

texts.en:
Chaudhry is a smallholder farmer residing in village Kotli Malian, Gujranwala, Pakistan. He has 6 dependents in his family. He mainly grows wheat and rice crops in his farm. He started his farming business 21 years ago. He is standing in the middle of this photo by raising his hand. He and his village farmers formed a group of three and chose him as the group leader.
He needs external financing to buy agricultural inputs to enhance his farm’s productivity. The main challenge he is facing is the lack of financial resources for his business as he has to buy agri inputs for his rice crop. 
He is seeking a loan to buy better quality rice seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs such as pesticides and herbicides for his rice crop. Your loan will help him to acquire necessary agricultural inputs for a successful harvest and quality yields. 
The income from this investment will help him to meet his obligations as the head of the family and family business. He is grateful to his lenders and he promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, tiene una despensa bien surtida en su barrio, que formo con mucho sacrificio hace 10 años.
Mario está poniendo lo mejor de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante, y comenta que con su negocio ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos, y se está esforzando por seguir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos variados para vender en su negocio, como ser bebidas, panificados, verduras, frutas, carnes y otros productos, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en: Mario is from the city San Ignacio, he has a well stocked store in his neighborhood, which was created with much sacrifice ten years ago. Mario trying his best in order to continue growing and succeeding, he also says that his business helps his family and their loved ones, and he is working hard to continue growing. He requests this loan in order to buy various products to sell in his business, such as drinks, bread products, vegetables, fruits, meats, and other products, this way he can continue with his sales.

loans.use: Purchase drinks, bread products,vegetables, fruits, meats, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase two boxes of vegetables

loans.name: Chhum's Group

texts.en:
Chhum lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district. She is 54 years old. She is a mother of five children; one of them is working at a garment factory. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and selling grocery items. She has been involved in her job for 20 years. 

The crops have been destroyed by insects, which causes her to get less return than she expected, and it is the main challenge for her in business.  

She is now leading a group of four members to take her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, she will manage her loan portion to buy seeds and pesticide and pay for labor fees to grow rice and increase her crop yields. She hopes that this loan will help her in order to earn more income to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticide and pay for labor fees to grow rice and increase her crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ton

texts.en:
Ton, 27, is a farmer living in Memot district of Kampong Cham province. She is the mother of two children who are underage for school. She struggles for a living via cassava growing on 2 hectares of farmland; she has been involved this business for seven years. 

Ton earns a lower income than before, as the crop is unhealthy and it cannot produce good outputs. Thus, to have more capital to support her business, Ton is applying for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and this is the third time for her. With the previous loan, which she fully repaid, it enabled her to support her family with enough healthy food. 

Ton will use her loan to start a new business (pepper growing) so that she can earn more income to support her family. She hopes that the black pepper trees will grow better and produce more yields so she can get more income and update her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to start a new business (pepper growing) so that she can earn more income to support her family.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 55 years old and married with four children.  

Roberto is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Roberto requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise his livestock.

Roberto has been raising livestock for 5 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Roberto would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, tiene 41 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio del Progreso Yoro.  Hace 5 años que Juana decidió  tener su propio negocio donde vende mercadería como aretes, cadenas, anillos y pulseras  de bisutería, enchape en oro y plata, también vende ropa interior para damas. Su negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante y por encargos. Esta solicitando un prestamo por 10,000 lempiras para comprar mas producto en bisutería, anillos, aretes, pulseras, cadenas en enchape de oro y plata y compra de ropa interior para aumentar sus ventas. Su plan es seguir trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en: Juana is 41 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with her partner with whom she has two children. She lives in the municipality of Progreso Yoro. Five years ago, Juana decided to have her own business where she sells merchandise such as earrings, necklaces, rings, and costume bracelets, plated in gold and silver. She also sells underwear for women. She carries out her business as a travelling salesperson and per requested orders. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 lempiras to purchase more costume jewelry products such as rings, earrings, bracelets and gold and silver plated necklaces and to buy underwear to increase her sales. Her plan is to continue working in order to help her children.

loans.use: to buy more costume jewelry products such as rings, earrings, bracelets, gold and silver plated necklaces and to buy underwear to sell.

loans.name: Bardjo

texts.en:
Hello lenders! This is Bardjo, one of Ruma’s agents. He lives in Kediri, an Indonesian city located near the Brantas River in the province of East Java on the island of Java. He is a happily married father of five, four sons and one daughter. As his main source of income, Bardjo owns and manages a small stall that sells mobile airtime credits. Right now, he is entering into another business opportunity as an agent for 'Mapan', Ruma's e-commerce product designed for lower income communities.

By supporting this loan you will be providing extra working capital for Bardjo as a 'Mapan' agent. Mapan enables customers to save up, little by little, by depositing change through agents like Bardjo, and as their balance grows, they can purchases items such as housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children. 

As a Mapan agent, Bardjo is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Bardjo will submit the order via SMS, and within five to ten days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Bardjo believes that his community will be able to have access to higher quality products with lower prices. 

Bardjo is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to help community members purchasing products through Ruma's e-commerce for lower communities called Mapan.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es uno de las muchas personas que han sido beneficiado por el crédito pues a Dios gracias su familia ha superado y él se encuentra muy satisfecho por los cambios que ha habido en su vida, porque antes el cultivaba muy poco pero ahora ha aumentado el volumen de su cultivo por lo que sus ingresos han incrementado, Juan tiene nuevamente la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para poder comprar sus insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de cebolla que en estos tiempos es la época.
Ahora Juan tiene el anhelo de construir una casa más grande para que su querida familia viva con mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Juan is one of the many people who has benefited from a past loan. Thanks to God, his family has moved ahead, and Juan is very satisfied with the changes he has made in his life. He previously cultivated very little, but now he has increased the volume of his crop and his income has increased.

He needs to request a new loan to buy farm supplies for his onion crop, which is now in season.

Now Juan has the desire to construct a bigger house so that his dear family may live in better comfort.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Sinab

texts.en:
Sinab is 53 years old and married. His wife doesn’t work and has two children. Sinab is IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar region. He is a disciplined, responsible and hard-working person. 

He considers himself a professional in his field. Sinab is a merchant and has been in this field for more than 28 years. In this work, he has experience and dreams. Sinab wants to earn a good income from work to make a good future for his children by giving them proper education. 

If Sinab has enough money, he will bring new products (foods, drinks, oils, vegetables, etc.) to his shop to sell. His biggest dream is to expand his grocery store. Therefore, Sinab needs Kiva Lenders to support him.

loans.use: to expand his market and be a businessman

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a smallholder farmer based in Nkubu , which is an area in Kenya that is rain-fed and fertile for agriculture. He is married and has 1 child. He makes a living doing dairy, poultry and pig farming. After selling his farm’s products, he uses the income to run his business and meet his family’s basic needs. 
 
The challenge Erick is facing is the expensive cost of transporting goods to the market. Most farmers in his place resort to dealing with brokers at the cost of being exploited. Not him. Erick is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain, has high load capacity and can handle rough terrains found in remote areas. 

With this asset, Erick will be able to transport his produce to formal markets where he will get a fair value for his produce.  
Your loan investing into Erick's business will elevate his family’s livelihood and generate more income for them to meet their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for fast delivery of his farming produce

loans.name: Kholod

texts.en:
Kholod is a 22-year-old married woman from Yata, a village near Hebron city. She lives with her husband and his family in a simple house. Her husband works as a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income. Kholod has a sewing workshop that has been open for the past three years. She makes traditional and artistic pieces and sell them in the local market.

Kholod would like to improve her business and expand it so she decided to take a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing workshop.

Kholod appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Tweyombeke Nyamiringa Group

texts.en:
Valente whose hand is raised up is a fifty two year old married man with six children living in Masindi-Uganda and a member of Tweyombeke Nyamiringa. His primary business is agriculture and he has managed to look after his family because of this business. He dreams of educating his children.

He requests for a loan to help him in ploughing and buying seeds.

loans.use: to help him in ploughing and buying seeds

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
A local residing living in Kampong Cham province, Heang is 51 years old and a mother of two children. The main sources of income are from rice growing and pig-raising. She has been in these two businesses for 33 years. Sadly, these days she can earn only about 33,900 KHR per day because her rice was destroyed by pests and one of her pigs died. 

This is the first time of Heang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) that she applies for a loan to save businesses to get better than before. She leads a group of three to get a loan. As the group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy organic fertilizers, rice seeds and to buy pig feeds, which are expected to support her business well. She hopes to get more crop yields to sell and the pork price will rise so that she can earn more income to upgrade her living to get better condition.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers, rice seeds and to buy pig feeds, which are expected to support her business well.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Las Señoras Artesanas De Chuacruz Group

texts.es:
Juanita (es la que aparece al en medio de las tres en la foto) es una mujer soltera que tiene un hijo de dos años el aún se encuentra bajo su cuidado, Juanita tiene 26 años de edad.
Juanita es una mujer que lucha cada día para la generación de sus ingresos, ella se dedica a la elaboración de artículos de mostacia, por ahora únicamente vende en el mercado de su comunidad, una de las razones porque no vende en lugares aledaños, es porque no cuenta con suficiente capital para comprar más mercadería. A raíz de esta dificultad, Juanita anda en busca de un préstamo, para comprar más mercadería y así poder generar más ingresos y sobre todo ganancias, ella no cuenta con otro ingreso pero con esta venta ella manifiesta que es eficaz.
La meta de Juanito para el futuro de acuerdo a sus ganancias ella puede buscar otros mercados para vender y generar más ganancias, y tener diversidad de materiales como piedras verdes, entre otros que están a la moda, ya que el mundo está  cambiante y cada día modernizan los productos. Juanita tiene la plena seguridad de conseguir el préstamo y su sueño llegara hacer realidad.
texts.en:
Juanita (who appears in the middle of the three in the photo) is a single woman with a two-year-old child under her care. She is 26 years old, and she fights every day to generate income. 

She works in the production of beaded jewelry, and for now sells only in her community market. One of the reasons she does not sell in neighboring locations is that she does not have sufficient resources to buy more merchandise. Due to this difficulty, Juanita is pursuing a loan to buy more merchandise in order to generate more income and, above all, profit. She has no other source of income, but these with these sales she shows that she is effective.

Juanita's goal for the future is that her earnings will enable her to seek out other markets in which to sell and generate more earnings, and to have a diversity of materials such as green stones and others that are currently in style, since the world is changing and every day the products must be brought up to date.

Juanita has full certainty that obtaining this loan will make her dream become reality.

loans.use: to buy jewelry products.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia is a 28-year-old teacher. She teaches while continuing her education at a university. She is requesting a loan of $1,000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to support her education expenses. With this loan, she can pay for registration fee, school materials, document printing, photocopy of duty and other things.

loans.use: to pay registration fee, school materials, document printing, photocopy of duty and other things

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe store

loans.name: Virgen De Los Dolores Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de los Dolores; está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Se fijaron como meta el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Claudia, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la elaboración de cigarros de tabaco, va esforzándose por mejorar cada día. Claudia es una mujer muy sacrificada y trabajadora, que por medio de su humilde trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser alguien en la vida y crecer en todo lo que hace.
La Sra. Claudia pide este préstamo para poder comprar tabaco en cantidad, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con la elaboración de cigarros, y teniendo de esa forma los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group Virgen de los Dolores is in its fifth cycle of the women’s committee program where they all work and help each other to get ahead. They established as their goal the growth of each of them, not only economically but also personally.

One of the members of the group is Claudia. Through her efforts and her continuous work and through the production of tobacco cigarettes, she is pushing herself to get better each day. Claudia is a hardworking and sacrificial woman who, through her humble work, has the means to be able to help her family. She is putting forth her best effort in order to be able to be someone in life and to grow in all that she does.

Claudia is asking for a loan in order to buy a quantity of tobacco so as to be able to continue with the production of cigarettes and, through this, have the means to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy a quantity of tobacco to make cigarettes.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cecilia is 49 years old now.

Cecilia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Cecilia has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Kabirizi Catholic S &c Group

texts.en:
Deus is a member of Kabirizi Catholic S& C Group .He is a hard working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is farming where he mainly grows food crops like beans, soya beans and maize. 

With this, he is able to pay school fees for his children and earn a living.  His major aim is to have all his children educated but faces hardships of bad weather and price fluctuation. 

He is requesting for a loan to hire labor to harvest his maize and soya beans.

loans.use: to hire labor to harvest his maize and soya beans.

loans.name: Las Estrellas De Panimache Cuarto Group

texts.es:
En la vida hay que ser atrevidos, las cosas no vienen por si solas si no uno mismo tiene que levantarse e ir por ellas es la decisión de Rosita de 21 años de edad, ella a pesar de ser una muchacha muy joven ha tomado la decisión de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ella vive junto a su esposo en una comunidad denominada Cantón Panimache.
(La segunda del lado derecho en la foto) la actividad que ella dignamente realiza desde la comunidad de su casa es la de elaborar ropas típicas con esta labor tiene 10 años de realizarlo, gracias al esmero que le pone a sus tejidos cuenta con muchos clientes, pero para mejorar sus ingresos cuenta con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y su esposo trabaja como jornalero.
Rosita con el afán de bridarles a sus clientes tejidos de la mejor calidad, ha decidido solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de hilos de tipo seda, alemán, y lustrina, pero este crédito lo hará junto a un grupo de personas quienes cuentan con la misma necesidad.
El gran anhelo de Rosita es que su negocio prospere para adquirir mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
In life one must be bold, things don't just come to us, we must go and get them. This was the decision that Rosita took at the age of 21. Despite being very young, Rosita has made the decision to improve her life (in the photo she is second from the right). She lives with her husband in a community called Cantón Panimache. 

Rosita makes a dignified living from her home in the community where she makes typical clothing she's been doing this work for the last ten years. 

Thanks to Rosita's attention to detail in her work, she has many customers. Nevertheless, to increase her earnings she also has a small grocery store and her husband works as a labourer. 

With the goal of offering her customers fabric of the best quality, Rosita has decided to seek a loan to invest in different threads such as silk, 'German' and 'Lustrina'. She is applying for this loan along with a group of people with the same needs and goals.  

Rosita's greatest wish is to see her business prosper and thus increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy silk, 'German' and 'Lustrina' thread.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy jeans, blouses, underwear and other things.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Her name is Elvira, aged 50, resident of Taguig City, Philippines. Happily married to Donato, a government employee and still has one child who goes to school. Life in a third world country like Phils. is not easy but the couple work hard to provide for their day to day needs and to support their youngest child school needs.

Elvira operates open a small general store to augment their income. Although there are other general store around her area she is still glad and thankful with the good turnout of her store as it really helps meet her family's everyday needs and school needs of her children. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 700 a day. 

To help her grow her store, she is hoping you could grant her a 45000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items like canned goods, coffee, eggs, instant noodles, beverages etc. She wants to fill her store with all the essential food items to make her store competitive. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. She values her store so much since it is where she gets the funds to support her child's school needs. 

Elvira's simple dream is to have a bigger general store to serve more customers. She aims to send her child to College and see her become professional someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 68 years old, married and lives in Eastern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates an eatery with her wife as the cook. They are making good sales with their business knowingly the location of their eatery is just beside the Paglaum MPC and a secondary high school nearby. 

Romeo is thankful to the cooperative because he was supported with his financial needs especially when he runs out of capital. As a way of showing his thanks to the cooperative, he nurtures his membership as manifested on his records with no default payments. 

Currently, he avails another loan of PHP 20,000.00 to purchase additional kitchen utensils, meat, vegetables, spices and condiments.

loans.use: to purchase additional kitchen utensils, meat, vegetables, spices and condiments

loans.name: Floren Rose

texts.en:
Floren Rose is 23 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

Floren Rose has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Floren Rose requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

Floren Rose has been in this business for two years. In the future, Floren Rose would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Margie is 36 years old and has four children who are in school.

Margie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Margie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Margie would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Kirnalyn

texts.en:
Kirnalyn is 32 years old and has three children. Kirnalyn is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Kirnalyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Kirnalyn requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Kirnalyn has been in pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Kirnalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a smallholder farmer based in Kapsowar, which is an area in Kenya that is rain-fed and fertile for agriculture. He makes a living doing livestock and crop farming. After selling his farm’s products, he uses the income to grow his business and meet his family’s basic needs.  
The challenge common to rural smallholder farmers that Reuben is facing is high cost of transportation. To avoid this cost, most farmers resort to dealing with brokers and end up being exploited.

Reuben is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain and can handle the rough terrain found in rural areas. 
With this asset, Reuben will be able to transport his produce to formal markets where he will get a fair value for his produce.  
Your loan investing into Reuben's business will elevate his family’s livelihood and generate more income for them to meet their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle so as to transport his farm produce quickly to market without it spoiling.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Ramon es un hombre que actualmente tiene 29 años de edad, es casado y tiene una linda familia que vive junto a él, en una comunidad denominada el tablón.
Ramon cuenta que gracias al apoyo que recibió con el crédito logro comprar sus semillas de papa y a Dios Gracias con esta cosecha le fue muy bien, es por ello que se encuentra muy satisfecho, pero Ramon con el afán de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un nuevo crédito que en esta ocasión lo utilizara para la compra de hierro para la construcción de su casa.
El gran anhelo de Ramon es poder finalizar la construcción de su casa para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ramon is 29 years old and married. He has a lovely family who lives with him in a community called "el tablón" (the board). 

Thanks to the support from previous loan, he was able to buy potato seeds, and thanks to God the harvest went very well, and so he is very satisfied. 

However, with the desire to improve his living conditions, he has made the decision to request another loan. This time he will buy metal for the construction of his house.

Ramon's great desire is to be able to finish the construction of his house in order to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy metal for the construction of his house.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 46 years old with one child. Corazon works very hard to provide for them.

Corazon runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Corazon has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: 1 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El Comité 1 de Diciembre se encuentra en el 2do ciclo, están iniciando con muchas expectativas de poder ir mejorando las condiciones de vida de cada una de las integrantes por medio del trabajo unido.
María es muy buena con las ventas, se dedica a vender perfumes y colonias de todo tipo, y de esa forma se gana la vida de una manera honesta y con ello ayuda a su familia. María trabaja y se esfuerza para poder ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener y que no pasen por necesidades.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar perfumes variados para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, cumpliendo de esa forma con el pedido de sus clientes. Todas están contentas por formar parte del grupo y capacitarse.
texts.en:
The committee “1 de Dicimebre” is in its second cycle, and is beginning with many hopes to be able to improve the life conditions of each of the members through united work.

Maria is very good with sales and works selling perfumes and colognes of every kind. In this way she earns an honest living and with it, she helps her family. Maria works and makes an effort in order to be able to help her family and give them everything that she wasn’t able to have and so that their needs aren’t overlooked.

She asks for this loan in order to be able to buy a variety of perfumes to sell and, in this way, be able to continue with her sales, fulfilling the orders of her clients. All of the members are happy to be part of the group and to receive training.

loans.use: to buy a variety of perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes lives with her partner for ten years and the couple have 4 kids.   Mercedes and her family work making cheese.

 Mercedes needs a loan to buy a milking cow, because she wants to increase her milk and cheese production, so she hopes you can help her because she has big plans for the future.

She wants to have a bigger farm.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow for more milk and cheese production

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo tiene 17 miembros, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras que luchan y se esfuerzan por salir adelante, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, como un medio de poder ir superando la situación de pobreza de cada una.
Una de las integrantes, que se destaca por su trabajo y lucha, es la Sra. Stela, quien es modista, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que poco a poco se ha abierto camino y por medio de sus confecciones se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta. Stela esta agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo al formar parte del programa de comité de mujeres.
La señora solicita este préstamo para poder comprar telas y hacer trabajo sobre pedidos para aumentar su producción   lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group has 17 members. They are very hard-working women that fight and push themselves to get ahead. They are in the poverty elimination program as a means to be able to gradually overcome the poverty of each one.

One of the members that stands out for her work and fight is Stela. She is a dressmaker, very hard-working and and entrepreneur, who little by little has found her way and through her confections she makes a living in an honest and dignified way. Stela is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving by being part of the program committee of women. She is asking for this loan to be able to buy fabric and work on orders to increase her production, which will help her to specify her business plan and will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric to use in dressmaking.

loans.name: San Gregorio Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Gregorio es un grupo nuevo que está iniciando con muchas expectativas, y están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una luchando por mejorar sus vidas.
La Sra. Cecilia integra este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante, es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, y ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela.
Cecilia pide este préstamo para poder comprar carne, condimentos, panificados, hortalizas y otros productos, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por mejorar cada día. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The San Gregorio group is a new group that is starting with many expectations and they are in the poverty elimination program. Each one is fighting to improve their lives. 

Cecilia is a member of this group and she makes living selling foods that she makes herself and then goes out to sell on the street. She is very good at what she does and has already made a very good clientele. Cecilia is asking for this loan to be able to buy meat, condiments, breads, vegetables and other products to be able to continue with her work and fight to improve each day. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to improve each day.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, breads, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz hoy tiene 23 años, es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que desde joven se esforzó para poder salir adelante, ella continua trabajando felizmente en la fabricación de hamacas y sobrecamas, con lo cual se viene abriendo camino y se vuelve conocida en su ciudad.
Comenta que su préstamo anterior le fue de mucha ayuda, y hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar hilos de todo tipo para poder seguir con sus trabajos y confecciones.
texts.en:
23-year-old Liz is hardworking and a fighter. Since she was young, she worked hard to be able to get ahead. She continues working happily in the production of hammocks and bedspreads. With this work she has been able to open a new path for herself and become well known in her city. 

She says that her previous loan was very helpful for her and now she is asking for a new loan in order to be able to buy all kinds of threads so as to continue with her work and projects.

loans.use: to buy a variety of threads for the production of hammocks and bedspreads.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El Sr. Manuel tiene 59 años, es transportista independiente, cuenta con un camión semirremolque en el que hace fletes y otros trabajos.  
Se inició en el rubro hace más de 30  años, con un camión más chico creciendo de a poco a base de mucho esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para poder hacer un mantenimiento para su camión de fletes, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y luchando.
texts.en: Manuel is 59 years old and an independent carrier. He has a semitrailer truck that he uses for shipping and other jobs. He started in this occupation more than 30 years ago with a smaller truck, growing slowly based on a lot of effort. He is asking for this loan to be able to do maintenance on his freight truck. This way he can continue working as he was doing. He is thankful for the opportunity that he is receiving to be able to keep growing and fighting.

loans.use: to do maintenance on a freight vehicle.

loans.name: Norma Adeli

texts.es: Norma tiene 33 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con  su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, dos niñas de 12 y 8 años de edad. Norma  se dedica a la comercialización de billetes de lotería en forma ambulante desplazándose a los mercados, plazas y parques de su municipio y gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo logra sacar adelante a su familia con los gastos del hogar, además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a prestar su servicios de seguridad en una empresa cercana a su comunidad.  Norma con el deseo de aumentar sus ventas está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para compra: de billete de lotería y así poder  generar mayores ingresos que le permitan brindar a su familia una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Norma is 33 and lives in her own house with her life partner and her three children, with two small girls ages 12 and 8. Norma earns a living selling lottery tickets by way of traveling to markets, plazas, and parks in her town. Thanks to her work and effort she is able to move her family forward with home expenses. She also counts on the support of her husband who works offering his security services in a company close to their community. 

Norma, with the wish to increase her sales, is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy lottery tickets. In this way she will be able to generate a better income that allows her to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of lottery tickets.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Isidro está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que tiene las expectativas de poder capacitarse y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Beatriz integra este grupo, es una mujer muy trabajadora que se unió al grupo para poder capacitarse y mejorar para poder seguir ayudando a su familia como lo viene haciendo. Ella se dedica al humilde trabajo de la venta de venta de remedios naturales, y comenta que su trabajo es sacrificado, pero que está contenta porque se gana la vida a través de un trabajo digno.
Pide este préstamo para poder seguir con sus ventas y comprar remedios naturales variados, y de esa forma continuar con sus ventas. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The San Isidro group is in its first cycle of the women’s committee program. It is a new group that has the hopes of being able to receive training and improve their living conditions and those of their families.

Beatriz is part of this group and is a very hardworking woman. She became part of the group to be able to receive training and improve in order to be able to continue helping her family as she has been doing. She participates in the humble work of selling natural remedies. She says that her work is demanding but that she is happy because she is able to earn a living through this decent job. 

She is asking for a loan to be able to continue with her sales and to buy a variety of natural remedies. She is thankful for the opportunity that she has to be able to improve each day.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Renacer está en el ciclo número 2do del programa de comité de mujeres, donde desarrollan el trabajo en equipo y de manera solidaria. Todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 
La Sra. Guillermina, es una  las integrantes quien tiene una despensa bien surtida que con sacrificio pudo montar e ir mejorando. Ella es una persona muy buena en las ventas, es por ello que le va muy bien, es una mujer muy luchadora que está creciendo y esforzándose por salir adelante. Ella a través del esfuerzo, el trabajo duro, las ganas de superación, ha ido mejorando mucho.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, panificados, lácteos y otros productos, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas y cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Renacer group is in its 2nd loan cycle with the women's committee program, where they develop teamwork and solidarity. All of them are in the poverty elimination program, fighting to improve their living conditions. 

Guillermina is one of the members who has a well-stocked store that she was able to set up and keep improving with sacrifice. She is very good at sales and for that reason she is doing very well. She is a fighter that is growing and pushing herself to get ahead. She has been improving a lot through effort, hard work and the desire to excel. She is asking for this loan to be able to buy various supplies for her store such as vegetables, fruits, breads, dairy products and other products as a way to be able to continue with her sales and comply with her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, breads, dairy products and other products to supply the store.

loans.name: Caacupe Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado Caacupé está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una se destaca por ser una persona luchadora y emprendedora, que quiere mejorar su vida.
Todas las integrantes están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder capacitarse y mejorar, entre las que se destaca la Sra. Mirian, quien vende prendas de todo tipo, y por medio de sus ingresos ayuda a su familia y demás seres queridos, dándoles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, pero que lo hace por un mejor futuro.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar jeans, remeras, camisas, pantalones y otras prendas, para poder surtirse, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called Caacupé is part of a program to eliminate poverty. Each member stands out as a determined and enterprising person who wants to improve his or her life. 

All the members are putting their best effort into getting trained and improving. Among them is Señora Mirian, who sells all kinds of clothing and uses this income to support her family and loved ones, giving them everything that she didn't have. She tells us that her job is very demanding, but she does it for a better future.

She is requesting this loan to to buy jeans, T-shirts, shirts, pants, and other articles of clothing so that she can stock up on merchandise, which will allow her to continue with her sales and meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy jeans, T-shirts, shirts, pants, and other articles of clothing

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nueva Esperanza está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción,  la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo luchan por mejorar.
La Sra.  Sandra es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas, comenta que poco a poco se ha abierto camino y está luchando para poder salir adelante. Ella comenta que la venta de ropas usadas cada vez va en crecimiento, y es por ello que le va muy bien, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que está luchando y esforzándose.
Sandra  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de estante y muebles para su local de venta de ropas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Esperanza” Group is in its first cycle of the Women’s Communal Bank Program. It’s in the city of Concepción, in a zone that is not far from downtown, and still growing. It’s a zone that is difficult to access, so the members of this group are fighting to improve.

Señora Sandra, one of the members, sells used clothing. She says that little by little she has made progress; and that she is fighting to be able to get ahead. She says that sales of used clothing are growing more and more, and that is why they are going very well for her. She is a very hardworking, enterprising woman who is fighting and trying hard.

Sandra is requesting this loan for the purchase of shelving and furniture for her clothing shop. In this way, she can continue with her sales as she has been doing, in order to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase shelving and furniture to equip her clothing shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to get a stand to sell chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy meat, flour, bread, oil and sugar to stock her store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 65 years old, married and lives in Mamanga Daku, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She has a sari-sari (or convenience) store and a farm where she plants vegetables, spices and cassava. She has been in these lines of work for quite a while in order to support the needs of her family. She is requesting a loan from Paglaum MPC for PHP 6,000 to restock her store with items such as canned goods, noodles, soy sauce, oil, vinegar and more.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 43 years old, married, has two children and lives in Lao Proper, Plaridel, MIsamis Occidental. She earns a living by selling fish at a stall she owns in a local market. She is a beneficiary-parent of the Paglaum Community Development Foundation, and signed up for membership with the cooperative because she believes in the services it offers to its clients. She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en: Teofila is 63 years old, married, and lives in Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena-Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is a farmer and owns a rice field on their place. She is helped by her husband, who tills their own land. Recently, she availed herself of a loan of PHP 15,000.00 to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and pesticides.

location.town: Plaridel-Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide
